After going thru all the numbers of purchasing a share in the property, my partner and I decided not take on any more debt at this time. Several attempts was made to persuade us to purchase and we decided not to. We was directed back out to the front of the office and looked for shuttle to take us back to our hotel. The van drivers all of a sudden was busy and had other pickups to do and left us stranded to walk back to hotel. This was such a disappointing experience with this hotel resort. Be careful when doing a tour for this property. No purchase, bad ending.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are owners for The Grand Islander, but couldn't get in so we instead took timeshare ownership at the Lagoon tower. Loved the unit - 1bedroom plus located on 23d floor. We are elite members and that is a plus. No complaints with staff, service, room cleanliness. Love the fire works. We love coming in December because my time off from work is at that time. Yes things are expensive at this time of the year, but it is well worth it at Hilton Hawaiian Village. The resort is beautiful and clean. Walking distance to Ala Moana shopping mall, and restaurants. The Hilton brand cannot be beat and the staff/workers are Great. We give this Resort many "Bravo" stickers and many smiley faces. We will be back for this coming December 2018.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is an exceptional property with lots of amenities. Many types of rooms to choose from to accommodate any type of vacation. Many options for pools, shopping, dining and walking distance to everything. The lagoon is cool and works well for young kids.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I both are consultants at Tupperware in Canada and this year we won an all expense paid trip to Hawaii and stayed at this amazing resort.We had a great view from our room and I have to say that the room and grounds were spotless, the staff were all very nice and the prices around the resort for gifts etc were decent.I’d definitely go again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I stayed at this fabulous resort for 2 nights. The location is great since there are shops, restaurants, lagoon, and the beach, all within walking distance. The enjoyed watching the sunset while snacking on garlic shrimps from a food truck parked near the beach. The only complaint is the extremely high parking fee here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I love the Grand Hilton Vacation resort at Hawaiian Village. My family and I loved the Tropic restaurant which is on site. The restaurant was like eating on my front porch. Very cozy. Very friendly. Great food. I loved the breakfast buffet. Baked salmon for breakfast. Wow. I had a wonderful time on the catermeran sail boat. What a great friendly crew. Swim in ocean. Swim in pool. Wow!I love this resort.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I spent 8 days at the wonderful Lagoon Tower resort at HGV. (We are time share owners for the past 4 years). We stayed in a large one bedroom appartment, with a great side ocean view. (Diamond Head side room). If you've never stayed, this is the place to be. Just minutes from the beach, nice shops on the resort and only a 10 minute walk to world class restaurants and shops. Service from the staff is impeccable. Great for families, or for couples.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Everything was fabulous!Loved every bit of the 5 days that I was there. Beautiful island and village, very convenient. Staff was wonderful! I can't wait to make the next trip back there again. THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR HAVING US!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: What can I say, it is Hawaii! What an amazing experience it was. The food, the service was excellent!!! Although there is a tram to take you from one side to the other since the resort is so big. One thing, there was construction during day hours, so when you look over your balcony there are work trucks and debris. But who is in there room the whole day...not this girl, so it really didn't bother me that much. Best vacation ever!!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Everything was great except parking is highway robbery. $43 a night for parking is ridiculous. The room was wonderful but as a maintenance and ownership paying club member, that is a ridiculous extra fee for parking.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have now stayed at The Hilton Hawaiian Village 3 times in the past 4 years and have found it great with all the very high standard facilities and the private beach/pools areas. Even though it is quite busy, it is far less so than the very crowded Waikiki beach areas. The Lagoon and Beach give you plenty of space and with a vast choice of pools we have been more than well catered for. Being an HGVC member we have been staying on the 17th floor of the Lagoon Tower in a 2 bedroom apartment and it is superb. Can't fault the quality of the apartment and its fittings, luxury in all aspects, cleanliness great and the staff delightful. Can't rate high enough, especially if you want a very above standard experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Atmosphere, location, and service. Stayed at the Grand Waikikian , excellent. The village has it all restaurants, stores pools, beach. Staff was very helpful and Suite was clean and comfortable. Worth a visit!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We like to stay at the HGVC at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for "staycations". This is our 2nd stay this year. HGVC has 4 different properties at this site. We've stayed at the The Grand Islander and Lagoon Tower during multiple visits. Just booked our next stay for The Grand Waikikian. The Grand Islander is the newest property, I believe they opened in March 2017. Very nice, but it's about a 5-10 minute walk to the parking structure. The other 3 (Lagoon Tower, Grand Waikikian, Kalia) are "connected" to the parking structure. There was a big increase in parking fees. In March, I believe it was about $23/night. Parking increased to $43 per night for self-parking and $50 for valet.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The room was very nice but the hospitality and fees were ridiculously poor. The management and staff would not solve simple issues and rely on the fall back position that "it is not our policy" instead of trying to accommodating guests. Pool was not heated in the winter closed at 7 pm I guess for the convenience of the hotel. Hot tubs were over run with children and infants from three adjacent Hilton properties that had no hot tubs and had double the participants as the policy stated on the sign nearby. Again, pools were very cold. Main hotel lobby had no access to elevators. Parking fees were double the surrounding parking lots. There was no restaurant in the hotel .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is probably the most fitting vacation hotel for family with kids. And the plus part is that it is near waikiki and near all the shoppings. The only down side is the place is packed with people...but then it is Waikiki. If you don't mind a crowd, this is the place to go.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have been visiting the Hilton Hawaiian village for years , and in the last 6 years we bought a time share there for 2 weeks a year , but we also use the Ali tower of the hotel for extra stays . Located on Waikiki, a few of the hotel has its beach and only with a Lagoon . The place is busy but yiu never feel is over crowded , so much to do , walk along the beach , catch the beautiful sunrise and sunset , swim in pool , beach or lagoon , enjoy the many restaurents on site . The time share on Lagoon tower is renovated and very nice . Ali tower is the best hotel tower on the property, beach front , own pool and more private ( there are many tower) . Easy walk to the main drag of Waikiki as well as to the AlaMoana shopping Centre. . The price is reasonable , but can be step at Xmas time . Last few years we come with whole family 11 of us ( 5/kids ) All have a swell time. A trip we look forward to ,

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Whenever we visit Oahu we love to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. It is a great hotel and resort at a central location with very friendly staff and excellent amenities. We love the central location so we can easily reach close by attractions, walk to the mall, and have great restaurants and grocery stores nearby. We have been coming here for years and have always enjoyed our stay there.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Amazing views over the lagoon and sea. Great grounds surrounding the hotel to walk and see eg harbour Spacious comfortable well serviced room close to all amenities supermarkets Very friendly staffBeen several times before recommended

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a great time staying for 10 days at the Lagoon tower as a club owner. All Staff were very friendly and helpful. Prompt service everywhere in the resort. Checkin/ checkout was very quick. Great location in Waikiki and offers best facilities for couples and families.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Please get an outside opinion/advisory on what needs to be renewed, refreshed. An uplift would go a long way to make the place appealing. Staff are well trained, knowledgeable, have good ideas on what to see/do, where/when to avoid traffic jams. One example: suggested that we check-out the night before & leave as early as possible were the best thing yet ! ! NO problems getting to airport & check in on time ! !

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: A anniversary trip. Stayed at lagoon tower. Even though recently remodeled, still needed updates. Staff not very friendly (a few were) pool hours are rediculous! Close at line 5 pm, hot tub was always crowded. Bar by pool closed early so we couldn't get drinks. AC was outdated and room was hot. Elevators were slow, parking is outrageously priced ( like everything else in Honolulu) house keeping only comes 1x per week, but will bring you towels if needed and soap. But if you have sand everywhere, you basically have to deal with it. Live music on lawn was nice, but sometimes too loud when trying to sleep. Would stay at a different property next time most likely.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful property. Great amenities. Beautiful beach front. Awesome views . I personally feel.the rooms are overpriced. Staff members were very pleasant and courteous .Didnt eat at the resort . Chose to eat with the locals

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great property right on the beach and the saltwater lagoon. Very friendly staff. Slow elevators. I wish they provided lounge chairs and umbrellas, rather than having to rent them. Beach and lagoon were both beautiful. Music by Hawaiian singing group Olomana at the open-air Tapa Bar was top-notch! Many restaurants and bars to choose from on the property and down the beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I had saved for many years to go to Hawaii so I wanted to stay in the nicest places I could find. I did research and this place seemed like it fit the idea. When I arrived, I am not sure what I was expecting, but this wasn’t it. Don’t get me wrong. It’s in a perfect location. It’s directly on the beach with plenty of beach front, but the hotel itself is somewhat dated. We stayed in the Tower because I stated I wanted full ocean view and the ability to see the fireworks from my balcony. The room had older carpet, the bathroom vanity was dinged and dented, there were areas that could have been cleaned a lot better than they were, the dresser looked like a few suitcases had hit it and my full ocean view was more of a side/full view. The “super” pool is not that big and if you choose to sit on the beach, be prepared to rent chairs and an umbrella because they are not provided for guests. It’s a $36 charge for two chairs for the day. It has a great shopping area, nice dining and options so that you never need to leave the property if you choose so, that was nice. I heard some of the other buildings were newer and more luxurious, but I did not view them so I’m unable to comment on those. After we left this hotel, we flew to Maui and stayed at The Grand Wailea. That place is what I was expecting from this place. Big difference! So, all in all, it was an average hotel in a great location.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: When asking Manager about the room we booked and what we were checked into I was completely shocked at how unfriendly and rude she was. We paid almost $3,000.00 for a room with beautiful Ocean and Lagoon view and instead we faced an ugly older hotel. So disappointed in how Manager reacted and her response was to check me out of first room and leave me roomless all day until 4pm when it was my fathers birthday and we had things planned all day and needed to be dressed up and ready to go at 3pm for celebrations. She told me bc I wouldn’t have a room I could shower in the gym!!! Seriously??? This is what $3,000 gets?

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: HHV is a great resort at a super location. Within walking distance to all of Waikiki but pretty much anything you’d need is right there at hand. Timeshare units well appointed and comfortable. Good restaurant selection.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Still restore derelict properties to quite a high standard. Was told Lagoon Tower was fully refurbished. My fault for not checking. No new LED lighting in bathroom, kitchen still looked the same with old appliances and slippery tubs from the 50’s. Check out room 860 and bathroom sinks. The Village itself is wonderful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed here for a week. From the time we arrived, everyone was ready to help us. The views and accommodations are a standout. We enjoyed sitting back and drink, eat and listen and watch the entertainments. The view is stunning. This resort is also near to the shopping areas like Ala Moana shopping center and shopping areas at the Waikiki which my wife very much enjoyed.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Don't bother to pay for a room with an upgraded ocean view. You get about 20 degrees of view. Not at all usable and nowhere near worth the added price. As a Diamond Member, I expect a few things, especially when literature is left on the coffee table, which apparently does not apply to this hotel. For example: 1. I see on your coffee table literature that Diamond Member get $10 in resort dining credit. "No! Not here." 2. I see that Diamond Members get free breakfasts. "No! Not here." 3. I would like to take advantage of my Diamond Member guarantee of a late checkout. No! We will charge you $125."

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The hotel room was even better than I expected. The room and lobby screamed quality in every way. Real wood and fine materials everywhere. I never thought I would say this in a review or otherwise but the toilet was even amazing. It had a warming seat, had a built in bidet, and dryer. I came home and was going to buy one for our home until I found out that it costs $3,000. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Overall a 5 Star experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Had a very relaxing family holiday the room was fantastic couldnt of ask for better. Everything was close by shops food etc. The location was walking distance to Waikiki and your pick ups for tours were all just down stairs

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I have stayed in the Village some 3 times now and have purchased into the HGVC as a result. Love the place with service, facilities and proximity to Waikiki first class.We stay in the Grand Waikikian usually which is a luxurious break and the views spectacular- highly recommended!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Nice location, excellent pool, equipment rental expensive, appears very busy most of the time, took about 40min to check-in which was a little annoying after a 9 hour flight (HHonours check-in line was taking just as long). Otherwise no issues, staff were helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We loved our experience at this hotel. Everything on a top level but nothing special. You will find there a correct service and security. Basically i can advice it for everybody. It is a real Hilton level experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Being our first trip to Hawaii and finding it hard to find a 2-3 bedroom accommodation on Oahu, our travel agent recommended the Hilton. Arriving at the Hilton, found that it was a large resort complex that was easy to get lost in. The maps and signs made it easy to get around. Yes the resort fees are expensive but found that the facilities that it offers were great. Provided unlimited wifi, free DVD and game rental and pool towels. Friday night fireworks were amazing.We had a 2 bedroom suite in the Lagoon tower that gave use plenty of room for 6 adults, also with 2 bathrooms. Queen sofa bed was spacious and comfortable as well. Staff were very helpful. Views of lagoon, ocean and diamond head.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Visited with 8 members of family incl. 2 kids. Was satisfactory in overall, but the place was a bit too over-crowded. Will definitely visit again if I would stay in Waikiki area with family over 6 ppl. However, other area of Oahu (such as Ko olina) was better experience for me personally.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton Grand Vacation. Just returned from holiday to Hawaii. Resort very good. Rooms excellent. Value for money average. Resort tax pretty steep considering other costs. Close your eyes when you get the bill. Beach Bar excellent. Mai Tai lady sensational!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Large resort with lots of kids. Not my cup of tea. Room was nice and staff was friendly but it was crowded and noisy. Hotel needs updating. Sales pitch with club staff was too long and not worth the time

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The atmosphere, location and environment are outstanding. My experience is that once you tell the concierge you are not interested in a time share their interest in helping you diminishes. My impression from this is that if they can not make more $$$ from you, you are cast away. The room we stayed in was very noisy at night, from the great lawn activities, Tapa music or the not sealed room doors. The resort though is awesome. Location, Location, Location!!!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Lagoon Tower on the 23rd floor. The rooms were very nicely done. The wifi was above average, and the televisions were 2 40" and a 65" in the living room with a play station gaming console (very important to a 9 year old boy).I'm Grandpa, and my wife and I took our daughter, her husband, and our two beautiful grandkids. If I could, I'd give it 4.5 stars, because while my complaint is important to me, they got so much right.My sole complaint is the shower/bath. No safety grab bars in either bathroom. In this day and age, that's a serious problem for us older folks. On request, they did supply a rubber bath mat, which was adequate, since nothing better could be provided.Our balcony faced the Rainbow Tower, and provided incredible views of the ocean, downtown, and the lagoon. It was also nearly perfect viewing for the fireworks on Friday night.This is a large resort, and has a lot of options for dining and shopping (caution, none of them are inexpensive). The property is impeccably maintained, and we spent a lot of time on the resort. It is also very handicapped accessible in most parts of the resort. The halls and doors are wide enough for a mobility scooter, as are most of the sidewalks.I'd come back as many times as I can.Thanks also to the helpful and friendly staff!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: They charge top $$$ but the service is very poor. Very rude check in staffs and manager that does not care at all. Parking is $50 but they will not bring your car out in advance. Also they have a card system with the towel where in you use the towel in the poll but you need to bring it back so you get the card back. If you dont then they will charge you $10 per card. This is such a hassle specially when you have kids. Imagine getting in the pool and feeling cold, change and go down in the pool area again to return the towels. First time I've experience this.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed a week with friend in a two bedroom. Nicely appointed and close to everything on Waikiki beach. It's not oceanfront but it's just a short walk past other parts of the beach to get there. Snorkeling is available right off the beach. Shopping and restaurants near by. Would love to come back some day.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton, which was the finishing point of the Na Wahine O Ke Kai, Moloka'i to O'ahu outrigger canoe race. The staff was very helpful and friendly - even walking past them in the stairwell going to our van. Our room in the Lagoon Tower was beautifully appointed, with 40" hdtv's in the bedrooms and a 60"(?) in the living room. They even had a Toto Washlet on the toilet to add to the special experience!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Lagoon tower for 11 nights at the end of a 3 and a half week getaway in a 2 bedroom resort view room. The room was amazing!!! Overlooking the water slide pool and marina. Room was massive! Would stay here again. Have stayed in 3 other towers and this is our favourite

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a great location. While one can do anything one wants at the property, it is located conveniently to other restaurants and shopping in Waikiki.The Lagoon Tower has great views and is easy to navigate. The staff is very helpful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We loved the beautiful ocean view and large deck. It was amazing! The bell team were super quick and the maintenance team kept the property nice! Great job Hilton! We would definitely stay at a Hilton property again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I own a biennial timeshare unit. Since the renovation it appears that the unit is in good condition, they did a very nice job all of the furnishings and upgrades are nicely We had a good time. The resort was not too crowded and service was great, no complaints.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have no need for anything other than a studio. My room was literally 4feet from the elevator. The laundry room was further from the elevator than my room. Room noisy. PlayStation as DVD remote. Bad!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Village Lagoon Tower . We have a group of 5 including a 4 years old boy. We stayed in a 2 bedroom ocean view unit approx 1200 sq ft very roomy comfortable suite. The building may be aged. The elevator can be faster. The room may be renovated 5 years ago . I felt at home, warm and comfortable. The ocean view was gorgeous. The staffs were very friendly and helpful. Hilton's standard good service. The Hilton resort is huge with private lagoon, beach and many swimming pools, Restaurants, shops including LV and other brand name shops. This resort is wonderful, you can just hang around here for a few days to explore. But you won't do that, Honolulu is just so much more to see and many more places to eat. The atmosphere here is great like Disneyland. Oh, if you don't like kids running around and want a quiet honeymoon hotel, this is not it. It is noisy around the kids pool which I do enjoy that happy family fun atmosphere. There are lots of people around because it is a huge Hilton resort. The Friday night firework around the lagoon area is another enjoyable event that you can see the fireworks so closed by and do not need to fight people . If you don't need the car badly Bus and taxi are very handy . Daily Parking is expensive $30 per day and hourly parking in town is expensive and not easy to find parking . We walk and use bus and taxi. Bus stop very close to the hotel. MacDonald and ABC Stores are with 10 minute walk , 15-20 minute walk to Waikiki and famous Ala Moana Shopping Mall. Honolulu is such a lovely city walking is safe and enjoyable. Avoid walking at night time at some quiet roads may not be safe because some homeless people may scare you. I like the Hilton resort. I love Hawaii!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The location is great, everything you can ask for, food, gifts and spas are offered in this location.The outside area is very well maintained, and the Friday night fireworks is one of the best that I have seen. Great trip for the money

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This property is HUGE! Also, I found it frustrating that the majority of the staff seemed to be more fluent in Japanese than in English. It might have to do with the huge number of Asian guests there. The Rainbow Tower room we had for our first night was excellent! Beautiful, storybook view and room. The remainder of our stay was in the Lagoon Tower. We were supposed to have an ocean view. We could only see the ocean if we went out on our patio and looked left. Otherwise our view was of another hotel. Next time we will be sure to stay at a much smaller, more personable place.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our second stay in the Lagoon Tower 2 bedroom apartment. The apartments are well equipped and very spacious. The village is very family friendly and offers an array of activities to keep the kids (big and small) entertained. While there are plenty of dining options within the village, we would often venture out for lunch and dinner and found there were many great restaurants within a short walk.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: What a wonderful place to spend time as a family. There are pools and a lagoon that provide hours and hours of fun. The ocean is so much fun to play in and of course, the waves are a must do. Everything is on site but expensive. We had a wonderful time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family had a chance to finally experience Oahu, Hawaii and we had a blast! Being a previous resident of Oahu, I knew the Hilton Hawaiian Village was where we would stay. It was the most amazing experience for our kids and my spouse. Prior to living in Hawaii, I had a chance to visit for a friends wedding and we stayed at this beautiful property. Coming back years later I wanted my children and spouse to have that same awesome experience I did so many years ago. Hawaii is a beautiful place and Hilton just embraces the Hawaiian culture and incorporates it in every part of the property. The staff is amazing and the property is so family friendly and gorgeous. Its a home away from home. We absolutely loved our stay and can't wait to come back! Aloha and Mahalo HGVC & HHV for making our family vacation even more memorable! Connie, Kai, Nick, & Joe

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: In my opinion, the front desk and concierge staff were not consistent in providing Hilton quality customer service. But the rest of the staff at were so friendly and welcoming, views were great, location was perfect, and room was clean.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: What else can I say? Totally loved this property as Hilton Vacation Time Share owner.Booked this on short notice, less than 2 months prior to trip was able to get a small but efficient room at The Lagoon Tower. Can't be too picky as rooms among the whole HHV (Hilton Hawaiian Village) 8 towers get snapped up quickly.Our first 5 nights at the Lagoon Tower was great. Room not as big as suites. No balcony and lower floor. Not a big deal as we did not spend a lot of time in the room. Bed is big queen, comfy. Small kitchenette has sink, microwave, toaster, coffee machine, all kitchenware, utensils. Strong AC. Only drawback (negative) is bathtub fit a small person under 4 feet. If you were to sit in the tub as a grown up, it is impossible. Treat taking stand up shower in this as if you were on a cruise ship. They do have a clothes line you can pull out to hang dry clothes, so that's nice.As for access to amenities like the lagoon in front on the beach it's just a stone throw away, fantastic.Then we got upgraded to the Grand Wakikian for 3 nights. What an upgrade! It's a suite, compared to our Lagoon room, this felt like a palace. Separate living room with sofas, TV, full sized kitchen, big bedroom with a 2 person bathtub. Bathroom has a good sized shower stall. And balcony facing Ala Moana Blvd. And a washer and dryer--what a surprise. Again, location is superb as far as accessing all the amenities HHV has to offer: restaurants, many ABC convenient stores, shops, lagoon, beach etc etc. Walking on the 2 miles stretch of Waikiki is not a problem for us. Beautiful sunrise, sunset etc.Both rooms we have were quiet, free WiFi was great.Service from Hilton from start to finish and in between was PAR EXCELLENCE! From valet to check in staff. Housekeeping (remember this is timeshare so only every so often they clean the time share room which is fine for us). Everyone has big smile and cheerful to help.It's one of the best Hilton Vacations as a timeshare owner.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There was 9 of us that just got back from Hawaii and stayed at your property. While the property itself is beautiful, I am very disappointed in your check in policies. We had 3 rooms reserved and we could not get all 3 room in the same tower unless we upgraded to partial ocean views and full ocean views. This ended up costing an additional $1200.00+ for a 7 day stay. I've traveled a lot of different places over my years and I can tell you, this is the first time I've ever encountered this problem. Most places try to make you feel welcome, well that was not the way we were treated here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Awesome views and nice accommodations were tainted by a lack of cleanliness, specifically in the bathroom. Also, I was given inaccurate information on several occasions, always to the benefit of my hosts. Starting with the room, it appeared generally clean, except in the bathroom, where you REALLY want clean. Instead, the door was filthy with hundreds of fingerprints and there was buildup accruing in the caulk. Worse still, there was a buildup on the bidet wand that I didn't notice until AFTER first use. I am STILL concerned about the consequences of that. On the service end when adding this stay at Laguna Tower to the beginning of a previously booked stay at another tower, I was inaccurately told I might be able to hold the room until the next room (same HGVCresort complex) became available. After arrival, they wouldn't even consider it. When deciding on valet or self parking, I specifically asked if I could call to have my car brought up. The answer was "yes" ... until I was on the hook for valet parking. ($47 daily).That leads to the next innacuracy. They gave us distorted maps that make it look much more difficult to get to off resort (affordable) dining and entertainment options than reality. Use google. The worst inaccuracies of all were conveyed by the concierge staff, who it turns out are part of the Sales team. They claim to offer discounts on services and experiences, almost all of which are offered for less from the merchants. After surrendering my car due to parking costs, they steered me away from the trolley shuttle to their partner cab company, wildly inaccurately forecasting the cost. And they persuaded to take their discounted luau in exchange for a "60 minute, no pressure" sales presentation" (ok, my fault for believing that one) that almost interminable alternative offers each time you decline. If you do this and you're not buying, count on 3 hours. Bottom line is that the location and views are very nice. The accommodations were mostly good but source information youself or be prepared to pay top dollar for everything.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: First time at the Lagoon Tower, we are new timeshare owners. We have a 1 bedroom plus unit and stayed for 14 days. We asked for back to back reservations so we would have to change rooms and they honored our request. Excellent room and service. No ice on the first night so we went to the Rainbow Tower got into the elevator and got off on the first floor and got ice from the ice machine. We had an excellent vacation!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Until now it was a yacht harbor view but this year we did a garden view but the grass garden was near the sea and the feet through the lagoon so it was more satisfying than I expected! Tonight is that Friday's fireworks can be seen from Lanai! Up to now, I went to the village and saw it in the crowd, but it was unexpected to be seen from Lanai. . . From next year, it seems to worry about choosing between harborside or garden side!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is the 3rd tower we have stayed in and of the 3 is the worst due to the extremely long wait times for the elevator. Fortunately we were only on the 11th floor and are capable of going up and down 11 flights of stairs. It's definitely a daily work out so didn't bother going to Koko Head. Check in was a nightmare since nowhere in my confirmation did it state that I am supposed to check in directly at the Lagoon Tower so I waited in line in the wrong area. SUITEWe stayed in a 1BR Suite facing the marina and the hotel across so we can see 4th of July fireworks. However, the noise of screaming children from 11 floors down at the waterslide made for a noisy room. We made the request to see fireworks but would definitely be more precise in our request to face the Rainbow tower rather than the marina. Our suite was very dark and cold. The bathroom is extremely small for 3 people and the kitchen felt like I was in a closet. The living room was unwelcoming and the sofa hard to sit on and was only good as a sofa bed.WIFIWifi does not work in the balcony. However, they fail to tell you that.HOUSEKEEPINGKudos to them! Keep up the good work!I absolutely do not recommend the Lagoon Tower especially if you're paying $512/night not including resort fees and taxes.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I stayed in a 2 bedroom in the Lagoon Tower. We had a view of the ocean/lagoon on one balcony, while the 2nd balcony overlooked the parking garage luau (fun to watch). The room was a great size, however, I was told the 2nd bedroom would have double beds and it only had twins. This was a problem because there were 7 of us. My youngest daughter wound up sleeping in the king bed with my husband and I since they would not provide a roll-away citing fire code laws.This resort is like a mini city. We enjoyed Duke's Lagoon where my teens rented aquabikes and paddleboards. We rented an umbrella and chairs one day. The beach was crowded, but not overwhelming. My girls didn't like the beach as much-it is very rocky here. We preferred the beaches on the east side of the island (Kailua, Lanikai). The Friday night fireworks were cool but quick and mobbed (think Disney), however we could see them right from our balcony. They have self-parking and charge like $40 a day-just factor that into your budget. Overall, it was a good stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you are not an owner at this location don't expect to get the diamond head side. They say they other side is ocean view but you see an ugly high rise if you are in a one bedroom. Staff just going through the motions. Very disengaged

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have been to Waikiki many times and this was the nicest place I have stayed. The rooms were beautiful and the view so nice! It was also great to have access to the full facilities of Hilton Hawaiian village of which there are many. This is a huge family hotel so maybe not great if you don't like thousands of kids running around but I think this comes with the territory. It has direct access to a really lovely swimming beach and also one sand bottom pool you can rent kayaks and peddle boats. Really unique and fun. It's also cool that there is some wild life like fish ponds and parrots through the complex. Also a huge selection of restaurants and shops. You really don't have to leave the complex if you don't want to and still have a great time. The front desk staff were really nice and helpful but the ancillary staff not so much. Found it pretty difficult to get things done through the concierge staff and they seemed pretty grumpy like we were a burden for asking for restaurant reservations. I also found out they were meant to give us a welcome gift but didn't realize until it was too late. I feel like they should have asked if we had received this. Also, we asked the bell desk staff for directions to the trolley or bus stop and they refused to tell us and kept trying to convince us to get a taxi. We were heading only to ala moana mall and ended up just walking out of frustration. Seemed like maybe they are getting pay offs from taxi services and this should be looked into. Other than those minor things we had a really nice stay and would recommend the Kalia Tower to our friends.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Love the resort, love the lagoon tower and the staff. it doesn't get any better then the front desk, resort management and bell staff. Resort Managers, Steve, Aikiko & John will work to ensure all your comforts and satisfaction are met. The front office staff, Lynn, Grace, Yumi, Shirkiro & Toshie to name a few are nothing short of perfection. Thank you for an amazing and always welcoming stay

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The only thing that bothered me, was that there were three small elevators that were constantly in use. They were used by the staff and hotel guess I like. So when a bellman or a cleaning staff was using the elevator with their cards. You couldn't fit in there with the stroller and your kids. Many times when we use the elevator we were packed like sardines. We were on the 20th floor and we would have to ride the elevator packed and stop at several floors. That was kind of a headache. I asked if there was a service elevator and they said there was not. That's one thing that I dreaded about using the elevator was being packed like a sardine. Also we had the Studio suite. Which was located right next to the elevator. It did feel like we were walking into a storage room but it was not bad size when you got in there. And it wasn't that noisy as I thought it would have been. Overall I enjoyed the hotel and the staff. We definitely would stay there again I would just recommend that the hotel try to limit the staff using the elevators.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This property was fabulous but it's has become overcrowded they are adding more rooms and the facility's are not adequate for the extra people. Don't expect to get a seat at a pool . Don't expect to have your bedding request satisfied . The nice grass lawn by the lagoon you used to be able to sit there in the shade now they rent the lawn out for functions so you are not allowed to sit there either.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just spent two beautiful weeks at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. We were at the Lagoon Towers. I had three rooms, two of them were on the south side facing the Lagoon and Beach and the other faced north which was the harbor and pools. We were on the 14th floor rooms 1464 & 1468. Very pleased with the accommodations, clean and very roomy. I can't say enough about the service from everyone!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed here with a friend for a week. The room was spacious and we had a nice view of the fireworks and a parade! The room was nicely furnished and the kitchen well stocked with items to make meals. It was a bit of a hike to get to the beach passing through other towers. There are shops and restaurants on site but only tried the ice cream shop as we made our own meals. A shopping mall is a short walk away. The weather was perfect and had a wonderful time but Kauai is still my favorite island.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Thus resort is getting run down. We were expecting a lagoon view room from marketing material and website only to be given a room facing the illikai. Very expensive and the tipping is out of control for average service.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My husband along with me, our 2 daughters, 2 son in laws and 3 Granddaughters took a nine day vacation to Hawaii. 3 day in Aulani and 6 at the Hilton Lagoon Towers. We had a great time. The kids loved the Disney characters, Lazy River and play structures at Aulani. At the Hilton we enjoyed the pools and the Lagoon. It was centrally located so we could walk to many locations. Downtown is busy and traffic was awful. It was easy to get a taxi or Uber. The Hilton is a beautiful place to stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Location is great on Waikiki Beach but overall very disappointed in the service level of this resort. Also beware if you are traveling with kids. The resort is very loud and has lots of nightly activities going on outside Lagoon Tower and the loud noise doesn't end until 11pm. This was a big issue since we were traveling with young kids and often had early morning tours planned the next day. Also this is a very large resort and seems that there isn't enough pool space at any of the pools to accommodate the number of guests in the pools and on pool decks. The pools seemed like kid soup with people all on top of each other and we could never find even one chair.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower and thoroughly enjoyed it. The rooms are fantastic (as are the views from the balconies). Our toasted didn't work when we got there, but they promptly replaced it when we asked for a new one. The concierges were very helpful and friendly. We got a free, unlimited DVD rental card -- it works just like Redbox but, you know, free. That was really cool. The village on the Hilton "campus," so to speak, is a really nice blend of shopping and dining. The restaurants are definitely overpriced, but then again, ALL Waikiki restaurants are, you do get discounts if you're staying in a Hilton building and I don't think we had a bad experience at any of the places we chose. They charge $40 a day to park in their garage without valet service, and more if you want to use the valet -- crazy high prices, but what can you do? It's Hilton, after all. If you're staying here, chances are you know the prices will be high...but the quality will be, also.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I've been staying at this property exclusively since 2001. I can't say enough good things about it. It offers several pools, activities and the location is ideal. Since the property is beachfront, you have access to the boardwalk which leads to great shopping in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had 6 wonderful nights here in a 2 bedroom suite booked through vrbo at a great rate. The check in process was quick and seamless. We had a Twin room with its own bathroom, a main king bedroom with ensuite and a very spacious lounge/dining area with a comfortable pull out couch bed. There is also a very sizeable kitchen that's well equipped with everything you could need. Off the lounge is a large verandah with table and chairs and we had a great view across the Lagoon to the beach and ocean. It comfortably accommodated 5 of us (parents and 3 older teenagers). We hired umbrella and beach chairs for the beach on a couple of days and just lazed in the sun and water. There's a lovely little reef just off the beach with really pretty little fish for snorkelling. The beach itself is not overly crowded...particularly compared with the "main drag" but then it's a very easy 10 min walk into the Royal Hawaiin centre for shopping and restaurants. It's also an easy walk to the Ala Moana shopping mall in the opposite direction. Other posts have mentioned a long wait for lifts. We were on level 7 and never had a problem. Loved it.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We Love Hawaii, over the past few visits the welcoming for Club Members is just not as inviting as it was in the past. We are having such a difficult time in securing a room in the the Tower of our choice.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: 1. $47 for valet a night and no one avail to get our car2. Contaminated pool. Asked to get out. 3. No towels at pool. 4. For sure no lounge chairs avail. 5. Long waits for elevator. 6. Called for more toilet paper and supplies. They never came. 7. Reported all this to the resort manager. Nothing done for all these inconviences. 8. This is what ownership at Hilton Grand Vacations Club is like9. So crowded....10. So disappointed.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: On the 4th of July you mess up my family's room. Would not recommend staying at for a holiday. We were tired and just came off a plane but you decide to mess up and apparently "forget" that we had a reservation. It's not first come first serve.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Kids had a blast with pool and water activities, kind of old but well kept, rooms was okay size and clean but utensils were old and needs to be replaced! Some towels in the room and pool are old and not fresh smelling!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: From arrival to departure everything was great. There's no better place to visit than Hawaii and no better place in Hawaii than the Hilton Hawaiian Village. I used to live at the Hotel years ago when there was annual tenancy available and now keep coming back as often as possible. I once had to stay at another hotel as the Hilton was sold out and vowed never to do that again. Nowhere else is comparable on the island of Oahu. With it's private lagoon adjacent to the ocean and weekly Friday night fireworks this place is unique.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Both my wife and I had a good time in our Lagoon Tower Penthouse. One of the things that we noticed is there are very little perks and deference paid as timeshare property owners at this location. It wasn't that crowded for most of our stay and some rainy, cloudy days didn't dampen our experience.The only issue that we had was that advance notice elevator maintenance took place on 3 intermittent days during our stay which made fo some long waits to get up or down. It seems that the last 3 years, a property maintenance issue at the Lagoon Tower took place during our week.The HGVC staff that we interacted with during our stay were both pleasant and very accommodating.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We love the Hilton and the Lagoon Tower. I have two issues, the first is the parking fees. I understand the parking problems but I feel, as an owner at this property , if your are stay at your home resort you should have a discounted rate for parking when a fee is charges. I feel $49 a day is an exorbitant fee to charge an owner. It cost me more to park the car then it did to rent it.My second complaint is a fee for a lounge chair at the Lagoon/beach. There are lounge chairs at the pool I feel if you are staying at the property and want to lay at the beach I shouldn't have to pay a fee for a chair. As an owner I should just need to show my room key and I should be able to get a lounge chair for the beach at no cost.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I stayed at the Grand Islander as a marketing stay, then we spent one night at the Lagoon Tower. Worst mistake ever, what a difference. Room looked not cleaned. we were kicked out of the lounge for guests who had already checked out. I have stayed at better hotels for a more reasonable price. Hotel overal needs to be updated. Things get old with the years. Not just the appliances, the carpet, the drapes, etc, etc.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I'm a 72-year-oldman.I use HGVC and five years pass. I always use facilities of Hilton comfortably. The stay of the Lagoon Tower of this Waikiki of Hawaii was the best in that. My daughter family who lived in Cincinnati, Ohio came and joined in Hawaii, and enjoyed summer holidays of one week with my wife and me. It was really good. Using HGVC, I want to enjoy our family vacations from now on.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you thought time shares were a waste you will change your mind with the Hilton it is the best thing we have ever done - the place is amazing - the accommodation five star the location perfect it is real value for money and you actually own it and can leave it to your children

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Lagoon Tower is the best timeshare located in HHV for Family. It is conveniently located next to the Lagoon, Beach, and a swimming pool with a slide. The plus rooms have great views of the ocean but the normal rooms still have a very good partial view.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I'm an honors member. Didn't really seem to matter. Didn't get the room I booked. Price of the room vs. amount of time spent in it... doesn't equal out. Enjoyed our time but food is was outrageous. Will definitely come back just probably stay somewhere else.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Resort and room in lagoon tower are amazing. The location is hard to beat if you are a family as everything is so close by. Be wary that the hotel is extremely expensive from food to drinks to restaurants to water hire.. it is way overpriced so if you come be prepared to spend big and charged for everything along the way.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Perfect location!! Easy walk to Ala Moana shops and heart of Waikiki. The 2 bedroom apt were fantastic for 4 girls sharing. Amazing lagoon and ocean view. The resort has everything you need. Even though it was super busy it never felt crowded.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I own HGVC on the Big Island and decided to spend the first part of my vacation in Oahu. Having never stayed in Waikiki before the Hilton Hawaiian Village and Waikiki Beach can be a little overwhelming at first. The check in process for the Lagoon Tower was quick and efficient. Our one bedroom was spacious and our lanai overlooked the marina and ocean. We were steps from the beach and all of the action that Waikiki has to offer . The concierge service assisted with tours we were interested in. We did not need to rent a car as the tours included transportation. The icing on the cake was the Friday night fireworks display.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We love staying in the Lagoon Tower. It's steps away from the beach, and most rooms have at least a partial ocean view. We've stayed in both a 2-bedroom ocean front room and a 3-bedroom ocean front room, and we couldn't ask for better rooms. Love having a kitchen and plenty of space to spread out. There are laundry rooms on each floor, but it would be great if each unit had it's own washer/dryer. The elevators can get pretty busy on weekends, but that's our only real complaint.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: All the staff has been fantastic. Service staff is great. The food has been great. Housekeeping has been a little lax. If you don't upgrade your room though you will not get what you think you got when you paid a lot of money initially. We upgraded yet after an additional thousand dollars I feel like we got the room we should've got anyway. The luau was fun and the Atlantis submarine ride was cool.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village was a wonderful place for my wife and I to fully enjoy our honeymoon. We had no issues, and if there was anything we needed we called and it was taken care of. We had nothing but a good experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: A week in Hawaii was fantastic. We left Colorado in May while it was snowing and returned home again to more snow. While in O'ahu, we experienced great weather, incredible beaches, and fantastic food. Snorkeled in Hanauma Bay, took a bus tour around the island to see places and learn more about the island than just going to Waikiki beach (which would have been great all by itself). Highly recommend the Hilton Hawaiian Village to anyone.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family enjoyed the stay. Grandson had room to run around. The kitchen area was great--we had a chance to cook several meals and storage leftovers from our outside food adventures. Staff was very attentive to our needs. For seniors, there were no handle bars to get in and out of bath tub.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed here with another couple, we had a high room with a fantastic ocean view, the evenings on the lanai were very enjoyable, nothing like a breezy evening view with a good cocktail and friends, on a less positive note the rooms are a bit dated, and having a shared laundry is not our most preferred way of enjoying a long stay in a condo environment, the concierge service was a great benefit and resulted in some significant savings on events that were priced much higher online than the price that Hilton was able to get for us.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We came as a couple to get married on the beach. We had a flawless trip including our wedding thru Weddings of Hawaii...it is true, walking to outside restaurants is cheaper. We will utilize our kitchen more next time to save money. Again, great time and coming back next year. :)

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was my 3rd time staying in the Lagoon Tower by HGVC. It has been nicely updated since the last time I stayed here over 5 years ago. We've stayed at the Kalia Tower and also the Grand Waikikian, but like the Lagoon Tower based on its proximity to the lagoon and ocean. I stayed here most recently with my fiancee and her parents in a 2-bedroom ocean view unit and it was amazing.As mentioned, the units have been updated and ours looked fresh, clean and tidy. Our unit had a king bed in the main bedroom and two full beds in the 2nd. The king bed in the main unit was very comfortable. The living room and kitchen area were spacious and the balcony looking out to the lagoon and ocean was a favorite for my fiancee's parents. We would have breakfast and coffee on the balcony in the morning and sometimes eat lunch or snacks out there as well. While the hotel was busy, we didn't hear any of our neighbors and always had a peaceful nights sleep. There is a full kitchen with fridge, stovetop, oven and microwave. This definitely helps you save on eating out all the time. The kitchen has also been nicely updated and fully functional with all of the utensils and cookware you need.The check-in process was quick, easy and the staff are very nice and friendly. The front desk no longer gives out leis, but when I told them it was my fiancee's parents first time to Hawaii, he went out of his way to track down the kukui nut leis just for them. Great customer service! We received great service from the bellmen, concierge and housekeeping as well. They were quick to deliver anything that we ran out of in the room and were always courteous. The Lagoon Tower is very close to the lagoon (thus the name) and the beach. We like this location because it's a short walk to Kalakaua which is the main stretch of Waikiki. Being a short walk away means it's not in a crazy busy area, yet it is close enough to walk out to the many restaurants and shops. The minor drawback is that laundry is located in a shared area and not in the room itself like in some of the other HGVC properties. It was never a problem for us though as every time we went to use the washer / dryer, they were readily available.We loved staying at the Lagoon Tower and can't wait to come back again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Time Share opportunity. We bought in. Great location here and world wide. If you enjoy traveling the world as much as we do this gives you a wonderful opportunity to stay at great locations for a reasonable rate ..

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Went on a family holiday for our 10yr wedding anniversary. and also had some friends travel with us as well. Hotel and staff were great, location great and Oahu in general outstanding. Can't wait to go back.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: They promised a ocean view instead we got a palm tree view. rooms were clean and the staff was good. Parking was $42 a day. Taxes were $10.49 for each day in addition to our points and transfer fees. Close to very expensive places to eat.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have stayed at this resort many times. We love the location on the beach, nice wide area, never too crowded. The Hilton is a great property. We love that the rooms have a full kitchen as we make our own breakfast and picnic lunch everyday. So many great restaurants in Honolulu for dinner.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great Vacation, wanted to give my dad a vacation of a lifetime and the staff was able to get me all I wanted. They contacted me and arranged all our events/tours before we arrived. Everything from the helicopter to Pearl Harbor was perfect.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hawaiian Village is a great place, trendy, great stores, however the Lagoon Tower is old and in need of updates. Staff is very friendly can't say enough about them, however parking a rental car is expensive

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This place is amazing. It has the best location, great restaurant, beautiful pools & beach and most relaxing environment! Everyone we came in contact with was friendly and very helpful! Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights at Lagoon Tower by HGVC and we're a family of four. We are Club members and had stayed at other HGVC resorts. This one met our expectations, as always. The room we had had two bedrooms and it was well appointed, clean and the beds were comfortable. It also had a full kitchen with everything you need. We had two balconies, one by the living room and one by the dining room, both with awesome views. The Lagoon Tower is inside the Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort so there are restaurants to choose from. You can also walk out from the Resort so you have other choices if you think the ones inside are too pricey. The Ala Moana center is also just a 10 minute walk. Waikiki Beach is right outside and there are also pools plus the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon. The staff are also friendly. Overall, we had a great stay!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Wow... Where do I start? Airport arrival: Took Charley's Taxi from the airport to the hotel. Called them once we arrived at the airport-- they came 5 mins later. Only $29 flat rate for my family of 5. No one can beat that price! Also used them going back to the airport, they already had taxi's lined up, so we didn't need to call. Hotel arrival: We saw long lines once we arrived, but thanks to being a timeshare member, we walked right up and was able to check in. (Lagoon Tower is for timeshare members, but you check in at the Grand Waikikian). Bell men where right there to assist with bags. I did not receive a lei upon arrival, but the resort was so breathe taking-- I didn't care! (Well maybe a little). Hotel room: We received a 2 bedroom suite, with 2 balconies, full kitchen, with bar and stools, full dining table, 2 bathrooms, and a wonderful view of the pool area. Grounds: Everything was perfectly manicured to make you feel like you are in paradise! Some colors of the flowers or on the birds were some I have never seen before. Plenty of picture perfect opportunities. Ponds, waterfalls, clean beach and pool area-- grounds are well kept. Water activities: Pools, pools, everywhere! And a beautiful lagoon for activities for a fee. The beach was absolutely stunning! All of the water is in walking distance, and close to each other. Food: There are so many restaurants, grab and go, and bars available. Believe or not, I chose to stay in my food comfort zone. I did Benihana, Ihop, Starbucks, and Buffalo Wild Wings. (Yeah, I know). Shopping: Lots of stores within walking distance. Souvenirs, crafts, etc... all await you once crossing the street. Exploring: I was able to book a Luau, Pearl harbor, and other activities all at the desk in the hotel. The price was the very same if I would have booked online. Conclusion: The staff is friendly with warm smiles, the grounds are well kept, food and drink are at not a shortage, and the weather is near perfect. We flew 11 hours and had to adjust to a 6 hour time difference. I'd do it all again for this property. We will be back! Mahalo for an amazing vacation.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is our second visit to the Hilton Hawaiina resort Lagoon Tower. We love it because it has the widest stretch of beach front. It is also far enough from the hustle and bustle of Waikiki but everywhere is walkable if you want more action or shopping. The Village is quaint and has many great places to eat if you don't want to venture far. Our oceanview one bedroom condo is extremly spacious and bed is very comfortable. The lanai is large compare to other properties.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Nice timeshare in the perfect location. Rooms are large and comfortable. Amazing view. All you need to do is bring your clothes and toiletries, everything else you need is there. Pack light there are washers and dryers on each floor.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great place for a family holiday, central to all amenities, shopping centres close by, walking distance to good eating places.Rooms very great, pools and water slides were used constantly, although water was a little cool in the pools.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I booked 2 nights at Hilton Grand in Waikiki last year. I have to say it was really good. Love the spacious room, love the pools and beach. The best thing was the sunset view from Waikiki beach with all those plum trees as your background. How wonderful it was! Because our flight was at night, hotel even provide us with 1-hour free room for getting rest, taking shower after the beach. Thank you very much! We will come back again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great if you have kids. Expect to pay a lot for food. Parking costs are unreasonable. $35 for a breakfast buffet- really? Otherwise, it's great if Waikiki is your destination or base for travel. Tropics Bar and Grill is fantastic. Remember, you are in major city that doubles as a vacation spot.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I am an HGVC member and this is the third time i stayed here. The overall experience was good. I chose a ocean view room and stayed in 22rd floor room 2268. There was a problem -my room was next to a fire exit. So the room design is not standard room with open plan. It was awkwardly designed with bedroom, kitchen, bathroom each separated. It gave you a impression of an cheap Wyndham apartment instead of a Hilton experience. Disappointing stay this time but lagoon tower is recently renovated and very well located. Facilities at the pool are getting ran down. The management needs to pay attention about breakdowns around the place. I will be back to check it out next year

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Second time I've been here, and it's better than ever! Incomparable room views, especially from the Rainbow tower.Everything you could want, all in the same complex. I guarantee, I'll be back for sure!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: During the stay, there were slow elevators due to several being out of service. Other than that, the stay was great. May want to skip Valet service since the charge is high per day $46.00 per day. Nice Honolulu Cookie Company treats for the Premier Elite members

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great resort with many amenities. The The Hilton Hawaiian Village lagoon is perfect for families. There are kayaks and paddle boards for rent. Waikiki Beach is only steps away if you prefer the ocean. The Lagoon Tower accommodations are large and comfortable with full kitchens. The only downside to the Lagoon Tower are the slow elevators.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We always have a great time when staying at Hilton. The staff are friendly and helpful. The facilities are always clean. This is one of the main reason why we bought Hilton Grand Vacations Club timeshare. It's worth it!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village was amazing! Great location on the beach, very helpful staff, nice amenities, and close to a variety of great resteraunts, bars, and excursions such as snorkeling and deep sea fishing. The rooms were big, clean, and the beds were very comfortable. Not great water pressure and spotty wifi, but those were the only drawbacks. Parking is expensive but as retired military I could park down the street at Hale Koa, information that the reception person gladly offered. Great view from both balconies too. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: needs upgrades to keep up to other more modern hotels hallway carpet needs upgrade , kitchen equipment showing age , size of suite was very good , bathrooms need upgrades overall an average hotel experience

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: 1. How we almost got a free upgrade to a 2 bedroom condo. 2. Once you've stayed at a Hilton Grand Vacation timeshare, you can't go back to the standard Hilton hotel rooms anymore. 3. Hilton Hawaiian Village is a complex of 9 towers in Waikiki.  3,000+ Hilton hotel rooms and 1,000+ HGV timeshare condos.  4. February 2016, I stayed in the Kalia tower in a regular 12' x 24' room.   HHV towers with standard hotel rooms include the Alii, Rainbow towers, Diamond Head towers, Tapa Towers, and the regular rooms in the Kalia tower.  5. I purchased a Waikiki Hilton timeshare for $37K, with $4k worth of annual timeshare usage.  Must use the $15k in bonus timeshare money to stay at Hilton and RCI timeshares for the next two years.   6. We arrived at 230pm, and checked in at the main lobby.  Hundreds of guest in line.  I ask where to check in for the HGV Lagoon tower.  Lady says this is the line for the hotel guests.  Lady directs me to walk to the Grand Wakikian.  7. In the Hilton Hawaiian Village, three of the eight towers are HGV buildings: the Kalia suites, the Grand Wakikian, and the Lagoon Tower, and they have their own separate checkin.  8. We walk the 100 yards to the Grand Waikikian.  No line here for HGV guests!  Registration says we were checked into a two bedroom HGV unit for one week.  My wife said she thought we had a one bedroom unit.  9. Room not ready, so we took a 10 minute walk to Food Pantry on 438 Hoborn Lane to pick up groceries, avoiding the overpriced ABC and Whalers General Stores in HHV.10. At 330pm HHV texts that our room ready.  No, not a two bedroom unit, but thanks to the wife, who doesn't know when to keep her mouth shut, a one bedroom unit, room 361, on the third of 26 floors in the Lagoon tower.11. Room right across from elevator, almost triple the size of the HHV hotel rooms.  700+ sq ft, with full kitchen, living room, dining area,  bedroom with king bed and bathroom.  Two flat screen TVs, including a 60" TV in the living room.12. Granite counter top in kitchen and bathroom sink area.13. No sheets by themselves on the bed, but sheet wrapped comforter, so we can't kick off the comforter alone, with only a sheet on top when sleeping in the buff.14. Electrical outlet closest to dining table not functioning.  Refrigerator did not keep food cold enough, at the coldest temperature setting.   Milk spoiled after 5 days.15. Pull out bed sofa in the living room, but not to sleep on unless you want to wreck your back. 16. Saw 5 minutes of fireworks from the balcony on Friday at 745pm.17. Wife would have preferred a bath tub instead of a shower.  I asked the housekeeper and they said most of the rooms in the Lagoon tower have showers, not baths, due to guests bringing in sand from beach.   18. Free communal laundry room on each floor.19. Not a great view on the lanai, with the lagoon in the background.  However it has it's advantages.  Great for people viewing, especially looking down on young women in bikinis walking below! 20. Better than viewing the busy street access to the Marina on the east side.21. Easy to get up or down the stairs to the lobby when the slow elevators to all 27 floors packed.22. The third floor lanai is shielded by the Rainbow Tower 100 yards away, from the  tropical sun that makes most of the higher floor lanais too hot to use during the day.  23. We had a ring side view of a Hawaiian dance show as part of a private buffet on the Great Lawn between the buildings.  Night time serenaded by the Hilton Luau on top of the parking garage next door!  24. Free AC, wifi, and unlike the Hilton hotel rooms, no resort fees, and no 24%  state hotel tax.  $35 parking per day for both hotel guests and HGV guests, so don't bring a car. 25. Every tower has their own pool, and there is a main pool with slides, for hotel and HGV guests only.  Good enforcement preventing guests trying to save unoccupied pool chaises when not in the pool area.   26. Avoid all the overpriced restaurants on the premises, and eat fast food take out from Food Pantry, or eat nearby at Wailana Coffee Shop, Goofys, Steak Shack, Waikiki Cheeseburger, or Grand Harue, all within a 10 minute walk from our room.27. And teach my wife not to express surprise at a two bedroom offer!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There were one room in my three-bedroom family of five people It was good because the children ran round and did not have to wait for the toilet. However, it was inconvenient that the washing machine was not attached to the room There was a laundry, but there was a crowded day, so I was not able to wash it as I wanted. But the view was great and the view was also good

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is my favorite resort. Everything is here. You really don't have to leave the area. Mall is not far from here. They offer activities on th he resort. Good place for kids. Fireworks on Fridays. Nice walks

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: nice location, convenient, easy accessibility to beach. Parking fees a bit outrageous at $35.00/ day. Wish the rooms were a little more updated, however. Liked that it was close to shops and restaurants. Seems to be a great place for family getaway.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the lagoon tower, had a good view of the ocean. From the balcony we can see the Friday night fireworks. Staff was friendly and helpful. We spent more time in the lagoon then the beach and the kids really enjoyed the pool with the slides. The only negative aspect of this resort is parking is $35 a day.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Awesome place to be. One of the best place if you are going to Hawaii. The pool is great. The park surrounding the area area also beautiful and clean.There are a lot of cops patrolling the area. So, it is very safe.. Tyhe army Museum is just next door to visit for free.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This resort is massive but is well managed and wonderful! They take your cell number on arrival and text you to check in throughout your stay. Compared to other timeshares we have stayed at - this is like an upscale hotel - I guess because there is also the hotel portion. There are many restaurant choices right on the property- pizza, Italian, Japanese, NY deli as well as hotel restaurants and pool bars. The units are up to date with large screen tv's, gaming systems and DVD player. They even offer FREE DVD rental - like a Redbox! I wish every timeshare could be this amazing! Never want to go home!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Lagoon Tower. none of special requests honored. the room was number 68 which all those rooms are extremely smaller than all the other one bedrooms, probably about 20% smaller and not what we wanted to waste our points on. worst one bedroom in the building, layout terrible. tv in the corner couch in the middle. stupid electric bidet in the bathroom, small seat and you need king kong arms to reach the toilet paper. etc. etc. food ridiculously priced. $60 for 2 small sandwiches and drinks, Benihana, elaborate dinner $120

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Always a great vacation for the family. Hilton is very accommodating to their guests. A great and convenient location in Honolulu. The friday night fireworks are always awesome and in big demand. We will be returning next year with more extended family.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed for two days in the Kalia Towers and it was very nice. Reasonly priced for Waikiki and close to everything.Plenty of pools for kids, the ocean for adults, and Friday fireworks! Tip: get dinner at Tropics, drink some wine, and watch the fireworks from there. You still hear the music from the show, get good seats for the fireworks and have a decent meal

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beach is wonderful. Many amenities and convenient shopping within the compound. Rooms and beds are comfortable. There are many options for food and drink. Staff is very responsive to requests. Overall good experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very satisfied with Lagoon Tower; beautiful view of the Lagoon, beach and ocean from the 16th floor. Quiet, well-appointed unit. Across the street from trolley stop making all of Waikiki very accessible.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our stay in the one bedroom, ocean view condo unit was great. The staff members were terrific and the view was great. The street noise can be annoying, but the view made up for it. If you are staying on Waikiki, consider staying here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: A great spot for a short break, well equipped rooms, this resort has everything you might need including shopping. Short walk to Waikiki and the very large Ala Moana shopping centre. The local bus company "The Bus" is an excellent way Ro explore the island if you have time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: What an elegant, beautifully designed oasis. If we stay again we will definitely take advantage of more of the resort ammenities. I only wish the recreation facilities had been avsilable for early birds, you can't rent a snorkel before 9AM, even then, the booth wasd opoen but there was no one to wait on us!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a great property at a great location. No other hotel in waikiki will give you such nice swimming pools and have beach front access. Since you are in Waikiki, the food options outside the hotel are much better and better priced. Mainly, stay away from the Luau. You're better off going to the Polynesian Cultural Center for a Luau.
