review_body: Very good amenities! Clean hotel, luxurious and friendly staff.We loved the lagoon!They have restaurants, it is close to shopping and all the other important stuff. The beach in front has different sides, for kids of all ages. We loved the Friday evening fireworks!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: She goes out of her way to make sure you enjoy your trip! And after you deal with Grace, you are in a much better mood! She MUST BE Hilton's Secret Weapon!! She is the polar opposite of the first girl that checked us into our first two rooms!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location with plenty of amenities. Got a partial view studio in lagoon tower even though view wasn't guaranteed. Comfortable room! Great concierge service! Bus stop located close by. Lots of restaurants on resort ground. Only problem was noise from the great lawn during an event. Overall great vacation location!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I had no idea what this vacation would entail but extremely happy I took the chance to experience paradise at it's best. The complex is within walking distance to shopping, eating, relaxing, and the most beautiful scene of blue skies, every shade of blue water, and white sand sprinkled with beautiful green palms, white plumeria trees and red ginger. This scene brings paradise to you live and unfiltered. One of my favorite vacations to say the least.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: One of our first stays with HGVC. Had a 2 level penthouse unit which I didn't expect. My jaw dropped when we entered. Far beyond my expectations. The resort is hugh but everything is very well maintained.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Took our kids to celebrate college graduation. Stayed in the lagoon tower. Facility and rooms were beautiful!! Stayed as part of a time share purchase opportunity (we paid $1600 for a week). Facility was extremely inconsistent in service. A few great employees, many uncaring and some inept. Not up to Hilton standards....I recommend if you want a time share and you reply on yourselves not the staff.....

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The location was amazing! There were shops and a variety of restaurants nearby and all of them were delicious! There were lots of opportunities for activities and excursions, but if you just wanted to lay at the pool or beach you could. Highly recommend!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: A 17-member family trip stay at the HGVC Hilton Hawaiian Village was a most memorable and fabulous experience. The overall staff was professional and pleasant. Check-in and check-out was smooth. We will visit again!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is our second family vacation at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, Lagoon Tower. Great suites...spectacular views...wonderful shopping venues. Highly recommend this location for your Oahu vacation!!! Great location with easy walking to Ola Moana mall and downtown shopping, restaurants.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The room was extremely small since the elevator took a big chunk of room 571. Don't get that room if you can! I got that poor little linen closet size room due to late check in. I missed the chance to get a normal studio room. I felt really bad since I was treating my sister who came all the way from mainland. The room is an embarrassment!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I am an owner and everything was all good until I had a run in with a rude male employee at the registration desk my second day of stay and the check out process. First check in time was from 3-4 and I didn't get my room until after 3. Second, I was RUSHED out and not given an adequate late checkout time and when I asked for longer, customer service was really snippy and rude! I did not expect this from HGVC especially when you pay for your timeshare and expect optimal service. I was rushed out and harassed by staff to checkout. Not one person but two to three people called me about checking out! This was ridiculous but other than that, the hotel is cool. Plenty of amenities.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This review is about the Hilton Grand Hawaiian Club reservation staff. When making reservation through Hilton Grand Vacation Club, I paid more to upgrade from no view to an ocean view - we didn't get it when we arrived. I called from the lobby to complain and was basically told there was nothing in the notes about an view - just a request for a separate living room with a kitchen. That is not what I asked for when upgrading. You can't control what they put in the notes in their system, but you're stuck with what you get on arrival. I told them I wanted a refund for the upgrade I paid for, but I didn't get that either. I was given $100 Hilton dollars that I could only spend on the property. I was basically told I was a liar. The hotel property itself is nice. But be careful in trusting the HGVC people. One of their own employees told me they hear this all the time from guests who book their travel through HGV reservations. You're at their mercy.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Make sure you research if there will be any local events during your stay. We ended up checking out at 8am due to a parade and the closing of major avenues nearby the hotel. The hotel advised us only 2 days in advance. Our stay was good except for that and a time share sales associate who was very upset when I declined an "amazing deal" by refusing to attend a 90 min sales presentation while on vacation. Other than that, the hotel has a amazing location.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton Grand Vacation was a great experience from check in to check out. Highly recommended. Clean, safe and affordable. Staff went above and beyond to make our stay good. Would do it again. All the staff was helpful and friendly.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We usually stay at 2 beds room.Sometimes we enjoy the dinner in our room.The kitchen is enough space to prepare it.And we could see the Hilton firework from our room on Friday night.I hope to have the BBQ grill at the garden area in the near future!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The location of the room is great! great view, good size room. Location of hotel is excellent! Can walk everywhere!Restaurants & shops close by. The beach is right there, property has several pools. Staff is very polite . Love the ice cream palor on site!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Resort Manager at the HGVC Lagoon Tower at Hilton Hawaiian Village was not very helpful or understanding with our discussion about our room reservation and location upon arrival. We wrote a lengthy complaint on a HGVC form provided by our long-term Sales Rep. As we were leaving for our return, the Resort Manager who had evidently seen the complaint approached us and promised to do better on our next visit. If you look at my review for our stay in 2014, we were less than enthralled with issues that were not resolved to our satisfaction by this same Resort Manager.Our room which did not face Diamond Head but an "eyesore hotel" next door to the property was located adjacent to the elevators. The noise and vibration caused by the operation of the elevators was a source of sound intrusion day and night. Particularly disturbing for those in master bedroom and trying to get to sleep at night.During this stay, we received 2 notices that puts a damper on things:1. June 1, 2016--On June 2nd from 10:30 am to 4:30 pm you will not have any hot water supply.2.June 2, 2016--On June 3rd from 11:30 pm to 4:00 am you will not have any hot or cold water service.The room renovations and furniture/appliance upgrades that were made are OK. The furniture for our 2 bedroom Penthouse was very basic, non-descript, and functional. The appliances were not of a superior nature. The shower heads were not full flow water; it took us 3 times as long to shower and rinse that it does normally. I would have preferred a larger shower head, higher up with full water blast versus the Japanese toilet seat in the master bathroom which boasted remote controls, heated seat, and bidet functions. Plus no washer and dryer in your room it is down the hall for you to access with everyone else on the floor. By the way they are in the rooms at the Grand Waikiki'an!Why have a gate at the pool if you're not going to supervise the non-guests who seemingly walk-in without key access or those who simply jump over the unguarded pool gates? This has happened year after year at the Paradise Pool and we have complained to no avail. That and under age children in hot-tub/whirlpools is prevalent and not enforced by staff.Overall, our whole experience as Lagoon Tower Penthouse Owners was not up to the expected HGVC standards or the HOA maintenance fees and taxes paid annually.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: When you're trying to sell me ownership don't put me in the oldest, broken, most undesirable room. I have spent thousands of dollars in the last several years and always get the short end of the stick with Hilton. I would expect more from a company like Hilton. I truly believe I could have got better accommodations for the price I paid with other major hotel brands, even with the discounted price. Product and customer service wins loyalty, not just customer service! Additionally, why have a gate at the pools if you're not going to supervise the non-guest? I had to tell my three year old daughter to get out of the pool two days in a row due to inappropriate behaviors from several individuals that weren't staying there.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We arrived at 9 am at the hotel and at 10 got room in Alli's tower and not have to wait until or 15 people at the reception were very welcoming and although I had a problem with booking made me upgrade partial sea view in Alli. Alli recommend because it has only pool for those staying here, it's quiet and has a gorgeous sea view

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Not the HGVC standards we are used too. Being a HGVC owner in SC this property is very diferent then the properties we stayed in on the Big Island, Orlando, SC, and Portugal. We were in a 1 bedroom in the Lagoon tower, 4th floor. The room is getting run down. The bath tub very worn. Towels stiff and small. Appliances worn. Plus no washer and dryer in your room; it is down the hall. The mattress on the sofa sleeper thin and worn, uncomfortable. The staff overall not very nice or helpful with the exception of the valets. They were all very nice. It is hard to describe but the staff made you feel like it was a privilege to be here verses the staff should appreciate us for being here. Overall, our whole experience is not up to HGVC standards.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: As mentioned in several other reviews, our "ocean view" room (lagoon tower) had a view of the parking lot and hotel next door. It was about 80% parking lot/hotel and 20% ocean. The hotel manager has addressed this on other reviews stating that you can technically see some ocean and that people should have booked an ocean front room. "Ocean view" is an industry standard term. You don't get to make up your own definition for it. The room we had was a resort or island view, maybe a partial ocean view or obstructed ocean view. We received a letter in our room that we would have no hot water from 10:30a-4:30p on our last day. No offer to compensate guests for 6 hours without hot water. By 6pm, the hot water still wasn't on and I had to take a cold shower to get ready for dinner. I called the concierge about it twice. The first employee had no idea the hot water was going to be off that day and said she would call back after asking about it. She never called back. The second employee cheerfully said the hot water would be back on at 5:30pm. This was at 6pm. I finally had to ask for some compensation for 7.5 hours without hot water. I was given a $100 resort credit. I thought the property was beautiful, but I would stay somewhere else next time. We really wanted an ocean view (which is why we booked one). It's sad that the staff can't understand why that would be disappointing. I also can't believe they wouldn't offer any type of compensation to everyone that had no hot water for an entire day. They just didn't care.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Just in front of the sea! I could see wonderful sunset and on Friday Hilton Fireworks from my room. There are many pools so that my family enjoyed a lot. Talking about shopping, I could walk to Alamoana or Waikiki. My family enjoyed a lot staying in Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our experience was very good, we liked everything except the bathrooms need ventilation, otherwise everything is awesome! The best view from two balconies. Nice beach, however spa needs to be open until at leat 9pm

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We love the Hilton brand, we really love the Hilton Hawaiian Village; the location, the amenities, the restaurant choices, it all adds us to a great experience. This is our 6th visit and we've stayed at the Lagoon Tower, Akai Tower, and Grand Waikaikian. Every one has its own style while our favorite is the Lagoon Tower with the ocean views.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a Lagoon Tower One Bedroom on the 14th Floor and a Lagoon Tower 2 Bedroom on the 23rd Floor. We booked using points rented privately through a HGVC member.The resort its self is large with lots to do. The pools are hectic and there isn't much in the way of staff supervision. On one occasion in the Tapa pool some young teenagers were playing rough and throwing balls around the pool. It wasn't enjoyable to sit around with this going on so we moved on to another pool. I'm not against pool games but it was rowdy and there were no staff to calm the situation down. The other pools were always busy but in general you could get a chair close by. The kids pool in the super pool area doesn't have any seating around it which is odd considering that it is a kids pool. There is the Hau Tree Bar right next door, we went for lunch and a few drinks and could watch the kids swim at the same time.Lagoon pool was fun but again, always very busy.Don't expect to have a serene cocktail by the pool experience, this resort is go go go all of the time. There is a pool up in the Kalia tower that seemed much quieter but its a bit of a hike to get to if you arent staying at that tower.The food options are OK, nothing special and again very busy. We didn't eat in at any of the restaurants for dinner, instead opting for the walk into Waikiki or getting take out and eating in our rooms.The rooms in the lagoon tower have recently been renovated and are really nice. The one bedroom was easily big enough for a family (King in the bedroom and a pull out sofa in the lounge) and the small but well equipped kitchen made it possible to make breakfast / lunch etc.We had family staying in a 2 bedroom suite and it was massive (2 bedrooms with a king and twin beds plus a pull out in the lounge). The lounge, kitchen and dining room were huge and easily accommodated us all for dinner etc.We have travelled to Hawaii many times and for us the location of the resort wasn't convenient. We only stayed here as were were travelling with family who wanted to stay and they did enjoy the location and facilities. Lots of pools to swim in, the lagoon is awesome and the rooms large so this is the place for families.For a young couple, I would recommend staying closer to the centre of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Overall a very good experience. Loved the location of the resort as well as the cleanliness. The kids had a blast at the pool and they were super excited to be so close to the beach. We would def recommend this to anyone.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton provided all the comforts of home away from home. Couldn't ask for a more comfortable and enjoyable vacation, and we wouldn't hesitate one moment about returning back on our next vacation next year.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hotel was overpriced. The micro sized "efficiency" was not suited for a business traveler Internet was typically Hilton slow. Will not use this facility for another business trip to the area. Front desk staff was pleasant enough

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Rooms were nice enough, but not really special. Beach area was not particularly inviting. Parking was $32 per night in addition to room cost, but I am not a Club member, yet. Would have preferred to stay away from Wailiki area for the traffic.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I spent 10days in Hawaii playing golf every other day with my husbund and his mother. The accomodation was superb and the hotel location was perfect to do so. I strongly recommmend Kings Land of Hawaii Island.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a one bedroom condo at the HGVC right on Waikiki Beach. It was a well decorated, clean, well appointed condo with an incredible view of the beach and ocean in two directions! I highly recommend Lagoon Tower.There were restaurants all around us if we didn't feel like cooking, everything was very convenient . The concierge in the tower was so helpful in suggest and arranging tour companies for us. Everyone we came in contact with was service excellence!If you are planning a trip to paradise, this is the place to stay! Hilton Grand Vacation Club at Hilton Hawaiian Village on Oahu.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The stay was average because the staff doesn't treat guests like owners. The location of the property is great because it's steps away from the ocean which helps because you don't have to be in the room very much. They need a friendlier staff that treats every guest the same! They put so much emphasis on whether or not you're the owner!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a wonderful time at the Hilton facility. We sat through a presentation to join the Hilton Grand Vacations Club to get the exceptional price for a week in paradise.The presentation is quite easy and the honestly, the cost is very reasonable. We didn't join, but it was tempting ...We had a two bedroom unit that was very well appointed with enough space to lounge, eat, sleep, watch tv, or relax on the balconies.The staff is wonderful! I can't say enough nice stuff about every person we met at the Hilton facilities.We bought quite a few supplies from the ABC store which was pretty reasonably priced considering it was the only game in town! If you can pack an inflatable float for the water, I would recommend it. The ones they have at the ABC store are small. But they happily inflate them for you ...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed 4 nights at the 2 bedroom condo, lagoon facing unit. It was super! We had a great view of the lagoon and the beach. The village has everything you need. The kids loved the lagoon and pool. We will definitely go back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We're HGVC Owners and stayed in the Lagoon Tower this trip. Great views and friendly staff.The village itself is awesome. However, the Lagoon Tower is starting to show some wear and tear. Overall, this HGVC property is worth the trip...and worth every penny.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Awesome stay at the Lagoon Tower !!! We were there from April 18th-29th. Staff was friendly and made you feel welcome. Aloha !! Was the first word we heard. We stayed on the 23rd floor ocean view, Beautiful view plus great Sunsets !! The Village made everything convenient for your stay. Short walks to restaurants, ABC store,Starbucks, and anything else you might be looking for. I enjoyed all the pools !! Super pool had pool service so we went there most of the time. Kalia pool and Tapa pool were nice and the least crowded. Enjoyed the entertainment at the Tapa bar at night !!! We used Charley's Taxi for our transportation to and from the airport. Price was good !! We rented a car for 2 days and explored the North Shore. Awesome time up there. Went to Ted's Bakery for breakfast and it was Soo good !!! Weather is perfect everyday!!! Sunset Beach was great place to swim and do a day at the beach !!! Tropics Grill in the village was a good place to go for food and drink. Loved the beach at the hotel !! Would definitely come back to relive paradise all over again. Big Mahalo out to the resort manager John Reagan. He made the final 2 days enjoyable for my family and I. He went the extra mile for me. Can't Thank him enough !!! Mahalo to all of the Lagoon Tower personnel who made our stay a great memory for us all !!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Really enjoyed 1 week vacation with my children and grand children. Safe and easy access to shopping facilities. Relaxing atomosphere. Fire works on Friday night was very exciting and hope to see again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We bought points at a NY vacation presentation to use for a week in Honolulu.Stayed in a two bedroom suite with a city view/ 16 th floor. Rooms were nice and comfortable with a kitchen setup/living room area. We were obligated to attend 90 minute presentation that resulted in a 3.5 hour session. We ask for time to investigate offer and got a reprieve oil next day. We declined after reading many negative reviews on-line.Great week in Hawaii, but very expensive. A/C not cool at night in bedrooms. Parking was $29/day for self park.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After booking this as a hotel on-line we were pleasantly surprised to discover that we had been upgraded to a 1 bedroom timeshare suite I the Lagoon Tower with lovely views of ocean and lagoon from our balcony. Although a large property, management. Has seen to it that the grounds invite tranquility. Many Japanese visitors were there with their adorable and well-behaved children while we were there. Our room was spotless, the bed and linens comfortable and the hotel amenities were enough to enjoy a visit without leaving the grounds.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location and amenities. Facilities were excellent. Staff were very helpful. Flexibility to eat out or cook in was great. Location was excellent for first time in Hawaiian islands. Easy access to airport to fly to other islands during our stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enjoyed my holiday with girlfriend and sister.The resort was wonderful with the staff being very friendly and attentive. I will definitely be back and will be recommending my friends to joined my on my next visit

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have a family of five which makes it very difficult to find rooms large enough. The Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village was amazing. It has recently been redecorated. It is so nice and modern now. The bathroom supplies are really nice. Loved the shampoo and body wash. The lanai's are very big too. The resort grounds are great. So lovely. There are many shops within the resort and the ABC shops provide necessary supplies. The coffee shop Lapperts is great. Love the cinnamon scrolls and the coffee is great. Made it like Australians like! The location is quieter than that of central Waikiki Beach but it isn't too far to walk. It is a very busy resort but has all the facilities so you don't have to leave at all if you don't want too. I will definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Relax and take in all the beauty that surrounds you. Take a nighttime walk on the beach, or have a nice dinner at Tropics. You can do a lot here without actually leaving the resort. Whether it is shopping or dining you will find something that tickles your fancy.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a beautiful and well appointed resort..staff and service outstanding. My mother in- law stayed here while we stayed in Waikiki Hilton Beach Resort across the road. The rooms were well services and maintained. The majority of this hotel is time share style accommodation, so be wary booking hotel through third party accommodation providers. The resort is on the Hilton Hawaiian Village property which provides all amenities, great for families, shopping, water sports, beach etc..The only negative here is staff push the 'time share' thing..small negative. Resort is highly recommended with friendly staff and A+ for cleanliness and location.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I can not think of anything about this facility that could be improved. The accommodations were top notch. Everything we needed was provided in our room. All staff were friendly and helpful. This was a totally relaxing and enjoyable vacation.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a great family resort with fun pools, lagoon with activities like canoe, paddle board, snorkel, and other items. It was very family friendly and nice rooms. We really enjoyed the fire works show from our lanai on Friday night.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had four nights at Waikiki and stayed in the Lagoon Tower of the Grand Vacations complex. Our room (for two adults) was clean, comfortable and plenty of hot water. It was a basic room with no balcony - we chose this as it was a cheaper option. The rest of our family, daughter, son-in-law and two grandchildren, aged 5 and 2, had a very large two bedroom suite with lounge area. Their balcony looked over the lagoon and out to the ocean. The Hilton Waikiki is a great place for children with kid friendly pools, shallow in some parts, and with three water slides, which our five year old grandson loved. The lagoon is also a great place for the children, with paddle boats (for a cost) and the beach is also lovely and very warm. We ate at the Tropics restaurant on a couple of occasions and the meals were enjoyable though perhaps a little expensive. The staff were, on the whole, friendly and helpful, although we did strike some on the front desk who were, perhaps, having a bad day! It is an easy 10 - 15 minute walk to Ala Moana shopping centre and about 20 mins to the busy downtown area. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a very large resort and therefore very busy, the pool was quite crowded. We did only use the one pool because it was more suitable for the children so am not sure what the other one was like. Fireworks on the Friday were an added bonus and the kids loved them.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Big let down on the Studio room. Just another hotel room with the exception of a sink and a small dining table. The resort and grounds were amazing but I was extremely disappointed with the room. No balcony, no furnishing outside the bed and small dining table other than just a plain and basic office chair. One person can use it while the other sits on the bed. Great idea on that one. The room was just another standard hotel room when it should have been up to the standards of the Hilton Grand Vacations Club.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We LOVE this hotel so much that we ended up buying the Grand Vacation. I will always stay at a Hilton, so I bought into the chain. I visited Hawaii in August 2015 and this hotel was booked, so I was actually depressed, but ended up staying a different Hilton downtown which wasn't as nice but still beautiful and closer to the action. I will always stay this hotel if I can as I love the rooms, view, service, eating options, multiple pools, semi-private beach, I could go on and on....I do wish is was a little closer to the downtown core, but a quick taxi, bus ride or a lovely evening walk will get you there no problem.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton's efforts to host as many visitors and events as possible on one property has dramatically reduced the overall comfort and enjoyment of this property. The noise levels of the events on the front lawn of the Lagoon started as early as 7 am and continued late into the night, our windows reverberated from the noise, we literally had to up the TV VOLUME to 70!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton grand Vacation at Hilton Hawaiian Village is a nice place to stay. It offers many things to do and it is fairly closed to a lot of restaurants. It is located on the best of beaches in Hawaii. It does get pretty busy at check in time, so be prepared to wait unless you are a Hilton Honors member.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed Lagoon Tower - had a one bedroom plus, they should have screens on the patio doors because the birds like coming in to the units. Otherwise it was excellent.We are coming back here in December fir Christmas and New Years.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a connected room and the sound of the next door was horrible. All night long I had to keep TV on to erase the sound from the next door. Everything was good except room facility. Wall is too thin and connected room door was also with lots of docs between.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very nice accomodations. Service was to be desired---it was more like pulling teeth to get answers to questions for suggestions for things. Do your research for places to eat and things to do ahead of time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Needs renovations, noisy, busy, fitness center way to small for resort size. Fitness center is always crowded & old equipment & not clean. Lots of options for eating but overall doesn't provide the value you pay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Kalia Tower in the Hilton Hawaiian Village Complex was very nice and modern. We stayed in a city view side room which we enjoyed, but next time may try the ocean view for a little less traffic noise although when the sliding doors were closed we could not hear any noise. The grounds and ability to use any pool was great.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in the Kalia Tower for this trip. Farthest tower from the pool/beach activities, but fit our room needs perfectly for the points required. Suite w/ King bed and living room w/ pull-out couch & kitchenette was perfect. View of ocean & Rainbow Tower from 15th floor the tower was phenomenal--2 balconies w/ orange birds visiting. Took more advantage of the activities this time. Luau was excellent--great Hawaiian buffet and exciting show. My 5 year-old daughter loved the Lagoon and lagoon pool with 2 water slides, though had to wear floaties as a new swimmer. Tried stand-up paddleboarding (SUP) on the lagoon--fun but surprizingly tiring. Also enjoyed the Benihana on property, though not as kid-friendly as my local one--no kids menu, coloring, or hats, & had to buy a full-portion meal. Grocery prices at the ABC store on-property weren't as steep as I remembered, and grocery stores were farther away than we wanted to venture. Atlantis submarine tour was fun, though a bit pricey and got a bit queasy. Wife & daughter took a Hula lesson on the green, though had to go back to the room for our DVD rental card to join it. Very central for exploring the rest of Oahu. Made day trips to the N. Shore/Haleiwa, Dole plantation & Sea Life Park with our rental car, but mostly stayed on-property. Already looking forward to our next stay!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The newly remodeled rooms in Lagoon Tower look great. Everything is new and clean. We had an ocean front room. Enjoyed the sunsets and watching the ocean activity . Truly enjoyed our stay and will return soon.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Best amenities, everything you need in one place, Fireworks , you can eat from several different restaurants ranging b in price from $5.00 to 45.00 per person, the bar staff was excellent, the pool staff was excellent

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My husband and I booked an ocean view room for an absolutely ridiculous price but we were happy to pay if we could see the ocean. Upon check in, after waiting almost 30 minutes in line to check in, we got the keys opened the door and say the hotel next door and that was it. If you walked on to porch and looked left you could see the ocean. That is not an ocean view room and was absolutely not worth the money. You're better off staying anywhere else in Waikiki. There is pretty much nothing good I can say about the Hilton.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a very beautiful place, very central, close to beach. The staff is very friendly, kind and generous! The lobby areas are very open and refreshing. The rooms are very open and accommodating! We loved our stay and will be back soon!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Too many people. Could not even get loung at pool. Have to rent a chair just to sit on beach. With a high resort fee this should be included. We felt food was ok but not great. Lots of kids there. Our room was by lawn area and events like a convention were there one evening. Loudspeaker was way too loud !

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great resort. Beautiful grounds. Great food. A little pricey but it's a Hawaiian resort. Never had a bad meal. Drinks are awesome. Beach chairs are pricey and crappy....they need to upgrade that. You always feel like you are in paradise while strolling through the resort. Very traditional Hawaii but not dated. Tropics bar and grill was delicious. Amazing abc store. You literally never have to leave the resort for anything if you don't want to.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family was in Hawaii for my nephew's wedding. The HGV Lagoon tower one bedroom suite was perfect for our needs. We were also able to entertain other family members staying at other hotels for some afternoon snacks and a chance to catch up without going to a restaurant. Our other family were impressed about the amenities and are now planning on going back to stay here at their next visit. Love the fireworks on Friday night.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My concerns are crowding, pool temperature, segregation of nationalities. Your music events on the garden centrally located are pleasant when the amplifiers are not so loud. One night a group with boisterous speakers was so amplified that I could not enjoy my room at all. there should be a limit as to the noise level. We have had to put up with construction noise but the amplifiers are not regulated to respect the other guests. The roped off lawn with keep off signs is off putting. when I have grandchildren that want to run off steam they are not supposed to run on the lawn? That is is not inviting. When you have events I can see the need but not for off times.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Grand Vacations offer excellent facilities - arguably nicer than Marriott in certain locales but the massive Hawaiian Village is simply TOO BIG!! There are at least 7 towers on the property with another under construction and there just isn't enough room to maneuver!Only 2 modern lagoon-style pools are on property and they are PACKED! Thank God for Duke's Lagoon and the massive beach to offer some relief. Get there early for a chair.Check-in around 3-4pm on a weekend is K-razy packed so be prepared for a long wait - especially at the Grand Vacations check-in which covers the Kalia, Waikikian and Lagoon towers. I counted 4 staff checking people in at prime time! There was literally a line to board 3 elevators in the Lagoon tower at 4pm on a Saturday!!Other than that, staff is friendly and surprisingly patient considering the mayhem. Our room in the Lagoon tower was fantastic and completely renovated. Highly recommend Lagoon tower for closest to pool and beach. Kalia is significantly back from the water.No presumptions here but be prepared for a significant number of foreign visitors at this resort. Oahu is most popular for non US visitors and HHV attracts a lot of them.In summary, Hilton GV has the right moves on most properties but due to a variety of factors they are working hard to maximize their waikiki property for profitability at the cost of visitor comfort. Sure there's 20 restaurants but there is very little open space in an area (waikiki) which is already dense with tourists! Biggest beach in Waikiki, decent proximity to central areas and renovated rooms are a plus. Just expect a lot of fellow travelers in limited areas.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Wonderful property, amenities and location. Great for family vacation, with varieties of activities and pools. Friday Fireworks were a plus and the beach is terrific. Although we stayed in Kalia Tower, which is farthest from the ocean and we did not see the ocean, we still enjoyed morning coffee on the outdoor patio area. Rooms were very good.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I am 60 years old and have travel a lot in my life and this is the best trip I have ever been on! And, it was my Honeymoon! The hotel was excellent, the staff was wonderful and willing to help you and the people of Hawaii made you so welcome! Hope to go back soon and stay for at less (3) weeks this next time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our stay was excellent to say the least. We were treated like family the full time. For my birthday we went to The Bali Restaurant where we ate on our honeymoon 3 years ago. The Tropics was another fun place we ate.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at The Lagoon Tower, part of Hilton Grand Vacation Club, at Hilton Hawaiian Village, in Oahu. We had stayed there once before and just loved it. We still love the resort. It is right on the beach. There are many restaurants and shops, and a variety of activities. The pools are great. The staff is so friendly. Everywhere we went in the resort we encountered friendly people. Our only complaint is that the livingroom furniture in our condo was extremely uncomfortable and not very attractive. I just don't know what they were thinking when they redecorated.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Lagoon Tower in a 1 br plus. The 1 br plus rooms are on a high floor facing the Lagoon pool and have a corner view of the ocean. I heard only the 2 bedrooms have the front facing ocean views. Nonetheless the views were spectacular. Yes, the resort is pricey but you get what you pay for. Besides, everything in Waikiki is pricey. The Hilton VIP experience card did save us some money from some of the businesses on the resort (especially the 20% discount that the Dairy Queen provides), the boat and umbrella rentals, etc. Overall, we have a fantastic stay and would love to go back again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a one bedroom suite with balconies - full kitchen. Very well equipped, clean and nicely decorated. We enjoyed the resort - the fireworks - CJ's Deli, Bar by the Water, ABC store well equipped. Very comfortable bed

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: this is the classic hotel for time shares people ,kitchen,pool, no breakfast,and no charter to the airport also Im a spanish speaking person and not 1 channel in spanish also the parking is extra if you have a car for rental I believe 29 dollars a night

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a 2 bedroom Apt in the Lagoon Tower for 12nts, sleeping 2 adults, 2 older teenaged girls & a 3rd older teenage friend for only 5nts. We booked thru a booking website which would only allow 4 people on the booking even though the Apt could sleep 6, but Hilton were kind enough to not charge for the extra person utilizing the sofa bed, which was great. Apt was very modern, spacious, with large flat-screen TVs in both bedrooms + living room. Kitchen was well appointed, with electric oven, cooktop, microwave, dishwasher (& plenty of washing powder provided!), filter coffee machine (coffee provided) & large pantry. We had 2 balconies, one overlooking the Starlight Rooftop Luau at night! That was very loud & ran from about 5.30pm-8.30pm so for us, with older teenagers, that didn't disturb our sleep. Keep it in mind if staying with younger children & ask to be at the other end of the tower. Oh & at 7.45pm every Friday night there's an amazing fireworks display which you have a perfect view of from your room (if it faces the lagoon, as ours did)! Again, very loud but incredible, & can't believe they do it every week!Restaurants around the resort complex include a number of Japanese restaurants, a pizza restaurant (eat-in & take-out), a pub-style bar/deli, an Italian restaurant, a fish & chips shop (eat-in & take-out, with HUGE number of choices & very cheap), a couple of bars (big shout-out to Cindy at the Tapa Bar!) & Pronto Pickle joints serving poolside snack-type foods, plus ice cream & coffee shop. Had to walk to main shopping area for more choice of better restaurants though (15min walk). ABC stores on-site provide limited supermarket & alcohol supplies + some pre-prepared meals, as well as touristy souvenirs (cheap but good Hawaiian shirts!). Save all your receipts from every ABC store purchase & redeem them for a free gift before you leave - spend $100 & get a coffee mug or shopping bag, or $300 gets you an excellent beach bag, towel or t-shirt!We were charged compulsory resort charge of US$30/day which entitled us to 2 bottles water per day, DVD rental (which we didn't use), cultural activities & morning yoga classes (which we only did once), family movies by the pool (which we didn't do), some sort of photo (which we didn't do), possibly free access to their Atlantis underwater viewing submarine (which we didn't do), free wifi (only worked in the room, not in public areas) which everyone got anyway I think! So quite a rip-off for us, but if we were more organized we could have got more benefit. Take note! Use what you've paid for!Biggest negative was being hassled about doing a 90 min Time Share "information session" & "receiving a free gift of a whale-watching cruise" every time we asked the concierge for anything. Particularly as we didn't find the concierges very knowledgable about most things - like shuttle bus times to & from Waikele Outlets ("Come back whatever time you want" but actually 2.30pm at earliest), or car hire ("What? What? Oh you mean vehicle rental") or what time to check in for a domestic flight between islands (WAY WAY WAY too early!).Overall though it was a fantastic place to stay, a perfect home away from home. I would highly recommend Hilton Grand Vacations Hawaiian Village to families wanting more space than your average hotel room, plus the benefit of full kitchen facilities.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My fiancée and I had a lovely stay in the rainbow tower, ocean view room. The room was perfect very clean. Staff were exceptional. The only downfall was that we went during spring break. Which made it extremely busy. Thank you to all the staff at the Hilton.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have come to this location for years and have never been disappointed. Perfect location on the beach. Do miss the Penguins though. We watched them many times when my daughter was young and fussy. The Tapa bar is the best-great Mai Tai.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We love this resort! The recreation and amenities are exceptional! The resort is close to shopping, pools, slides, great restaurants, beach, park, etc. We have been coming to this resort with our grandsons for the past 2 years. We decided to buy additional timeshare ownerships here as we want to come back every year for the foreseeable future.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I’m back at the Hawaiian Hilton Grand Vacation property for March break with my family for 11 days. Surprising, we’re back in the same suite as last year … unit 770. The suite is great ... spacious, free laundry (down the hall), amazing Paradise pool, concierge service, etc. The noise this year weren’t too bad compared to last year and they have since renovated and fixed the elevators.However, the only complaint I have is housekeeping where they missed cleaning our unit twice. On 2 separate days, our beds were not made and the room was not serviced at all when we returned in the evening. Both times we called housekeeping. The first time, it was already after dinner time (around 8 or 9 pm) so we asked for fresh towels since it was too late to get the room cleaned and we had to put our kids to bed. The second time, we came back around 5 pm and the beds were not made and the room hadn't been cleaned. We asked for someone to come and cleaned the room while we went out to dinner. There were other misses as well .... where they cleaned the room and did not clean out the coffee maker or left the dirty dishes in the dishwasher and not run it. I had to run the dishwasher in the evening in order to have clean dishes for the morning breakfast.We stayed at this same building last March for 10 nights and didn't encounter the same problem. A suggestion … a door sign that indicates the room needs to be made up. Many hotels and cruise lines have a double sided sign indicating “please do not disturb” on one side and “please make up room” on the other side.We’ve just booked another stay for next February. Hopefully, we won't encounter the same situation again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We've been going to Honolulu annually for 16 years even before we have children. This resort is in a great location right on the beach compared to many other hotels that are across the street from the beach. The lagoon in front of the resort is also perfect for kids. The hotel has a kids pool with long slides, apparently only 2 hotels in Honolulu have this. Our kids just love it. Being a resort village, one has access to all the amenities right on site. It's about 10 minutes walk into Waikiki in one direction and to the Ala Moana Mall and Walmart in the other direction. Extremely convenient. Lots to do, see and eat. We had stayed in the hotel side of this resort in the past. This year and last year we stayed in the Hilton Grand Vacations because we wanted a suite with a kitchen and there's also a complimentary laundry facility right on the floor. With 5 years old twins, the Grand Vacations rooms and amenities just make more sense. The room rate is the same as a similar sized room on the Hilton Hotel side but those hotel rooms/suites do not have a kitchen. The kids' pool just happens to be right downstairs in this building too so it's very convenient for us. The front desk, bell and concierge staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The cleaning staff are not that friendly. You're greeted with a lei/mac nut necklace upon arrival. The room is well appointed and looks like a very nice condo. We had a one bedroom suite with a pullout sofa bed in the living room. It's about 700 sqft. The room is nice and quiet. The one qualm I have is the water pressure from the shower head is very very weak. Also, during our 11 nights stay, 2 of those days the cleaning staff didn't come to clean our room. The first time, we came back after dinner to find the room unmade. It was too late to have someone come so we just asked for some fresh towels. The second time we came back around 5 pm to find the room unmade so we asked for someone to come up to clean while we went out to dinner. This didn't happen when we stayed last year. There's a resort fee and as a part of this, you get access to movies and games rental. There wasn't much selection whatsoever for games or movies that are appropriate for kids under 10. Luckily we brought our own ipads with movies and games, and we could also access Netflix through wifi, My husband wanted to use the gym while we were there. There's only one small gym located in a separate building at another end of the resort. It doesn't have a lot of equipment so just be aware. There's also a kids club on site but the fee per day is high. We ended up hiring a baby sitter from happykidsmaui.com for 2 evenings. We used them last year as well. The sitter and the over service from Happy Kids were excellent. Overall, we had an excellent stay and have just booked our trip for next February last night. :)

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There are so many people this place you were just constantly bumping elbows. They also have dozens of people sitting around trying to sell you timeshares and the more expensive version of things you get it. Beware of the never-ending up sell. This place is OK but it's not that nice for the cost. I sort of felt took.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Got a great rate on a spacious 2BR condo-style room - perfect for a. Family of four. Located in the grand waikikian lagoon tower, right on the heart of Hilton Hawaiian village. It's all families and very crowded, but that's Waikiki. Our room on the 4th floor above the back/beach entrance was rather noisy with all the commotion outside and a seeming endless "beeping" of either buses or construction equipment backing up. And the elevators often had a line. Other than that a great family destination!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Could not enjoy lanai due to pool noise during the day and maintenance activities at night. The only time we could enjoy the lanai was early morning before the pool opened. Activities sign-up was a 3-ring binder that was not kept up to date and no one seemed to know how the process worked. Not worth the cost, if I wanted noise I would have vacationed in NYC, Hawaii is supposed to be relaxing not crazy...it was crazy

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent place to stay for couples or family and friends. Most rooms can accommodate six, with two bedrooms and a foldout couch. Balconies in each suite afford an awesome beach view or resort view. Facility has many restaurants including Japanese, Italian, luaus, and more traditional American cuisines. The resort also has its own Hobycat for venturing out on the ocean. It has its own private lagoon and several swimming pools. And plenty of shopping. Parking is expensive but convenient. Everyone on staff was friendly and knowledgable. This is a great place to vacation!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Totally pleased. Hilton staff, room, services, grounds, restaurants all are great. Being a Hilton Honors Member for many years you know you can have confidence in the Hilton Brand and rely on Hilton to provide Star Quality care for its members no matter where you choose to stay anywhere Worldwide.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I have been coming to Hilton Hawaiian Village for vacations at least once, and up to three times, each year. We have been Lagoon timeshare owners for 10 years, and now we own a Lagoon penthouse, a Lagoon one-bedroom, and a Hokulani one-bedroom (1 week each). We always enjoy everything in the "Village!" The staff are always helpful and courteous, the rooms are always clean, and staying in a "condo" has all the convenience of a "home." We wouldn't stay anywhere else on the Island of Oahu! Not even the 5-star hotels.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stayed in the Lagoon Tower this trip at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and it was a great place to be. The room on the tenth floor was very spacious and overlooked the lagoon and Rainbow Tower. It's so nice to open the balcony sliding doors each morning and step out into the breeze with ocean and lagoon views. The fully equipped kitchen is so helpful as we stayed for a week. This was an owner's rental and we were able to get one housekeeping visit as our stay was for 7 days. There is laundry on each floor with 2 washers and 2 dryers. The room was very clean and the decor was appealing. You get dishwasher and laundry detergent as well as a small bottle of dish soap included. There is a very large screen tv in the living room and one in the bedroom. A round 4 seater dining table, a sofa bed, patio table and chairs, etc. The staff here are always pleasant. You will receive a free gift bag if you hand in the voucher given at check in. This is a time share hotel so they will try to get you to go to a presentation. I was traveling without my husband this time and they prefer couples over singles so I wasn't asked to attend. The resort is full of things to see and do. There are several pools to take advantage of. One with slides for the kids, an even small pool that starts very shallow for younger children, a super pool, etc. There are restaurants, including a Round Table Pizza (good for take out). There are Friday night fireworks at the resort as well as outdoor sunset family movies on the grass (take a mat and snacks!) There is a rooftop luau above the parking garage. It sounds fun and the crowds are cheering but I have not attended. Charlie's Taxi offers $29 airport rides if you are staying at the hotel. Grab some samples at the Honolulu Cookie Company near the ABC Store!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Nice being down at the end of beach. Easy to walk everywhere . Car rental on property. Many places to eat from $ 20.00 on up in the walking area. Good taxi from hotel Charley's. $ 29.00 to airport. Will go back. Thanks

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon tower and had an ocean front room. The view was fantastic and the rooms have been refurbished and are lovely. Huge TV has been added to the living room. But, be aware!! The parking fees are $29 per day!!! Parking fees were almost as much as our car rental, and we are owners at Hilton Grand Vacations. Hilton should be waiving these outrageous parking fees for owners at least.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Customer service on the phone were not very nice. It seemed like my call was a burden. Receptionist kept on telling me I was in the wrong line and to go to the other line next time. Well, there was no one else in line and there were no labels. Hotel room was clean. Bell Desk was really helpful. Elevator was really, really slow. It takes about 15-20 minutes to get into an elevator around check out time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We made reservations through the on-line system about eight months ago and paid the $52 fee. (Yes - owners pay $52 to book if not your home resort & week) We were excited to finally get there and check-in. We checked in and they told us they have 2 double beds ready in the Kalia tower. My partner had a print out and it clearly showed we booked a king size bed in the Kalia tower. The front desk told us this was impossible and we showed them the paperwork. A front desk manager came out and told us only renters can book bed type and not owners. We almost lost it at that point as we have owned our timeshare with Hilton for years. She told us she would talk with the main manager and text our cell phone once ready. After about 10 minutes, we got a text to go back to the front desk. We got upgraded to the Lagoon tower and she apologized. It was kind of ironic that at the pool a couple from Australia asked us how timeshares worked there.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: From check in to concierge to tours and activities, housekeeping, pools, everything was great. You can stay at the villiage and get everything you need from the most beautiful beach to the pools, restaurants and all of the other amenities. They are very helpfull in helping plan itineraries and activities. My first trip and will definately go back to the village. Great time, hated to leave. Tip, if you stay at Lagoon check in at the Grand Waikiian lobby. Much easier.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Just returned from a wonderful holiday at this amazing resort.( please bare with me for the " But ".. We stayed in the Lagoon tower, a 1 bedroom apartment for 3 adults. Booked last April having read lots of good reviews, then of course just before we flew out, i did the usual thing i guess we all do, i looked again, and all i could see were peoples gripes and negativity . so spent 10 hours on the plane over there convinced we d get the worst rooms, next to the building work !!! How wrong we were....!! It is just awesome. The lagoon tower has had some dodgy reviews in the past, but in our opinion, its the best tower in the quieter part of the resort, had its own check in and was close to everything on site. Yes , there is another tower being built but it is away from the lagoon tower and we were not bothered by it. there seems to be some snobbery about the lagoon tower, and its reffered to as the "timeshare' accommodation, but it was just great , we cant fault it. Our apartment looked like it hadnt been used before it was in such immaculate shape, obviously newly refurbished from top to bottom, spacious, lovely , modern furniture full sized kitchen and sumptious bed linen. The sofa bed in the lounge was for our adult daughter and unlike most sofa beds, this one had a proper bed mattress, not the thin foam type you usually get in hotels. We had a view of the paradise pool below,the marina and partial lagoon ,sea views from a good sized balcony. All the balconies are well spaced apart from each other . We were not hassled by timeshare sales as previous guests had mentioned, yes there were vouchers for "free" prizes and " 50.000 honors points " ,in the apartment but they clearly stated in the small print that it was time share promotional stuff and you had to attend a presentation so we never attempted to claim our 'free gifts " !! Every staff member we encountered was friendly and courteous, the room attendant/maid did a great job and topped up our towels and toiletries daily. Yes, its a huge resort, but with lovely gardens and pools, ornamental waterfalls etc, and yet everything was so clean and tidy. We are fortunate to be able to take our holidays anytime and i guess that in school holidays , the place is packed full, which is why we avoid those times. There is so much space to wander around the resort both on and off the beach and pool areas, it never felt crowded and never had to wait to be served at any of the bars or restaurants, unlike when we went for a walk to the Moana Surfrider Hotel, supposedly a 5 start hotel where we encountered surly staff, had to wait to get served and saw they had a rammed full, squashed pool area, no thanks, couldnt wait to get back to the Hilton Village ! A great resort, both family and couple friendly brilliant location, we couldnt fault it and i would love to go back BUT..our problem has started since we returned, i booked and paid back in April thru a high street, well known travel agency, who use via expedia , on check out, 5th March , i was told we had to pay USD $2777 approx, whoa, i said, its all pre paid by agent and expedia, heres my reciept , the clerk said, oh , yes, that fine, so off we went to start our reluctant journey home, on tuesday, i was checking my credit card statement, and to my horror, the hilton had charged me that amount after we had left. So, since then, i ve been battling to get it refunded, yes, its an error i ve been told, and it will be processed, but will take days to come off my statement, at which time its gaining intrest every day, and fluctuating exchange rates will likely leave me out of pocket even today, its still on my visa account. Suffice to say, this has spoiled an otherwise truly wonderful stay in Hawaii. Apparently, they had us down for 2 rooms in error, a system glitch by someone,some where but our agent and expedia rectified that back in April and even when i emailed the Hilton just before we went, ( i explained it was my husbands 50th birthday and was a surprise ) i was asked to confirm how many rooms we had booked,as their system said 2 so i confirmed then on 7th feb that we had only the 1 apartment. So still they charged me AFTER check out, without my consent, fingers crossed i get my refund this week as its AUD $3997 , so lets see how good the Admin team are at this resort, as everyone else has been brilliant

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Good staff and terrible staff are working together in this hotel. I feel many kind of service are getting worse every year. But,we stay every year because good location.For shopping and relaxing near the beach or poolside.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: It's fair to say that Hawaian Village is more an experience than an accommodation. There are an array of activities, a choice of towers, a lagoon and of course, the beach. It feels a little detached from the rest of Waikiki, but there is still not a sense of seclusion. The staff is helpful and well trained, but the massive size and population of the place makes the service somewhat impersonal. The room furnishings show a little wear, but the common areas are well maintained. In short, Hawaian Village has many faces. Make it a joy or a burden, it's your personal approach that will dictate the quality of your stay. HV has many loyal guests who return over and over again

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The entire experience was excellent. The check in staff made sure we understood the information we would need during our stay, took the time to take our photos, and showed us to the elevators. The checkout staff ensured all our questions were answered. Staff were always available to answer questions and made sure we understood. Staff were kind, pleasant and professional. The room and grounds were clean, beautiful and comfortable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: While any trip to paradise is an experience, a trip to Hawaii probably tops them all. All amenities one would like to experience are available within the Hilton grounds, including tours, beach, pools, restaurants, bars and the weekly fireworks show. Rooms and staff are fabulous, with upgrades constantly being added. A fun and relaxing time for the entire family.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a great time here at the Lagoona Tower at Hilton Hawaiian Village. We love he time share experience with full kitchen amenities and separate bedroom. Makes it feel like home but still on vacation. As members we were treated very well.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Nowhere else can you have a magnificent view, beautiful room, enjoy lots of activities and then go for meals and drinks without ever having to drive!! That is perfection to us. There were at least 2 live bands playing every night (no cover charge) and fireworks on Friday (no charge) - pretty impressive and fun.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Kailea Tower in Hilton Waikiki complex is a very good choice for location as it is close to beach, beach walk, shopping, and great restaurants. No rental car necessary. Shuttle and local bus system is excellent.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Magical. Fantastic facility. Sparkling pools. Walking distance to everything. Superior service. Highly recommended. The Lagoon Tower is ideal as it is away from the main road, views of the ocean from most rooms, wonderful amenities right there.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The rooms are old and needed updating.. We did not have a view of the ocean so this was very disappointing. If you are in Hawaii having that view is important.. The kitchen needed to be upgraded and the furnitures.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: From beginning to the end, the experience was very enjoyable. Walk around and enjoy the landscape and cleanliness. Meet the friendly people working there. There is always a smile on their faces. Must be a great place to work. Rooms were very spotless and everything was in its proper settings.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Have stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village before -- this time we chose the Lagoon Tower which is managed by Hilton Hawaiian Village. The room was small, the three speed A/C had only one speed - noisy - The addition of the fridge in the room was a nice touch - handy to have -- but that was the only redeeming feature -- will be back to the Hilton Hawaiian Village - but not this tower

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enjoyed three nights here. Great having a kitchen with two bedrooms and bath. Lots of shops in walking distance. Complex has plenty of activities. We did have a problem with the configuration of the bedrooms. Had called months in advance to the hotel to request two double beds in second bedroom. Was told that was all they had, wrong we had two twins. Our room had a create view from balcony but was next to road and parking garage and the bus pick up for tours which started beeping at 5:30 every morning.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After just one stay in the Kalia Tower we decided to join HGVC. The property utilized all of the Hilton Hawaiian Village yet is furtherest from the action. It is quiet and the service is excellent. We would highly recommend this location to anyone that wants a great view and awesome accommodations.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The hotel room was dirty and dangerous with electrical wires and mold. She were sent to a total of 7 different desks in this huge resort to solve simple problems. Every one was happy to give us directions to the next desk. They charge for everything. If you leave your towel to long by the pool they pick it up and charge $20.00. The hot tubs were every thing but hot. With no enforcement on kids orvthe amount of people in the hot tubs. Every pla e was dirty like a motel 6 not a Hilton.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Keep in mind when reading these reviews that under this listing for HGV at HHV there are actually two separate properties - the Lagoon Tower and the Kalia Suites - each with different locations, facilities, layouts, and furnishings which are part of the larger HHV (Tripadvisor does maintain a separate listing for the Grand Waikikian). The Kalia Suites is farthest from the beach but houses the spa and fitness center, the Grand Waikikian is newest, and the Lagoon Tower is closest to the beach and oldest...but is in the midst of a complete renovation. We stayed in the Lagoon Tower.I cannot praise this property highly enough. We LOVE that it is right on the beach, that it is an easy walk to the rest of Waikiki in one direction and Ala Moana in the other, that 90% of what we want to do on Oahu is less than a 20 minute drive away, and that the suites themselves are large and comfortable with full kitchens and with washer/dryers on each floor. And that most of the rooms have great views of the ocean and Diamond Head or the harbor and the pool next to the Lagoon tower has awesome waterslides and hot pools. And that there is a Lapperts downstairs offering amazing Kona coffee starting at 5:30 (for those of us with jet lag) and Hawaiian ice cream all day. And that Honolulu offers some of the best food we've ever eaten anywhere in the world thanks to the fusion of Asian, Polynesian, and European heritage and ingredients but when we are just too exhausted to do anything else we can just go down and eat at one of the many HHV restaurants.We've been bringing our kids and parents to the HHV every other year for 9 years now. This year for the first time we splurged and got one of the few oceanfront (not just oceanview) rooms at the Lagoon Tower - and it was completely worth it. Are there nicer places to stay in Waikiki if you are just a couple - absolutely. But once you have kids (and/or parents) with whom you want to stay there is simply no place better.Lastly a note for all those Hilton Diamond reviewers who complain about the HGVC at HHV mistreating them. For whatever reason Hilton has made a corporate decision to treat the HGVC as a completely separate entity. Neither I nor the Hilton reservation staff can see my HGVC reservation in the Hilton system. HGVC stays don't count toward my elite status and my Hilton elite status doesn't affect my HGVC room selection. Marriott doesn't work this way - even though MVCI is a separate company (just like HGVC). Marriott tracks my MVCI reservations in their system, my MVCI stays count toward my Marriott status (most importantly my lifetime goals), and MVCI resorts 'care' about your Marriott elite status.So please, please, do complain to Hilton corporate about their decision to ignore us when we visit HGVC properties. But HHV is just following Hilton's policies and procedures.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very nice clean and spacious room. For a Hilton Honors Diamond member you should choose the Hilton Hawaiian Village instead. There are no typical Hilton Honors Elite Benefits here. When we went next door to the Hilton Hawaiian Village it was a much better experience. If you want a time share presentation stay here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our room was beautiful and very comfortable! We had everything we needed to cook a few meals and relax. You can rent movies from a Redbox-style kiosk which is very convenient. The pools and beach were quite busy, especially with families, but that was to be expected. We went to the Starlight luau, which was lovely!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have stayed in this resort 10 times and would not ever stay anywhere else. Everything is top notch here! Easy access to anywhere on the island. Very clean. Very helpful staff. On site shopping is great.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stay at the Kaliia tower,which I think it was a great choice is really close to everything within feet of the main pools, maybe 150 feet or less to the beach. We had a room with a king size bad with a really beautiful view of the beach and the whole property.even though we had a side view. In fact we had a great view of the fireworks they have every Friday..the room was very clean at least out room was. They.came by to clean everyday that we were there. Their Cleaning stuff do a great job. Everybody was very pleasant and helpful when we ask for assistance at the consierge desk.we will definitely we love to go back the only hesitation is the 11 hours plus fight from New Jersey...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Friendly and accomadating staff! The location is within walking distance to great restaurants, downtown shopping and the mall. Charlie's Taxi provides flat rates to & from the airport. The Resort has something for everyone in the family to enjoy.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location, beautiful ground & fireworks every Friday night. Easy walking to lots of places to eat. Great pools with happy hour & right on the beach. Good access to a lot of shopping & close to the bus route.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The size of this property was initially overwhelming and we didn't expect a "village" in its literal sense. It took a few days to become familiar with the various parts of the village and even then I don't think we covered it all. The village itself is a very busy place with constant flows of guests walking the streets - not so much the beach surprisingly. If it's a relaxing time your seeking I probably wouldn't be considering the Hilton.We had a 2 bedroom suite which was absolutely perfect for ourselves and our 3 teens. On average the size of the suite is probably bigger than the size of some people's average 3 bdrm home. The main bdrm was luxuriously huge and the ensuites were adequate. Our suite had been recently renovated with a contemporary modern touch and the cleaning was tops! - thank you to our maids.The swimming pool areas were small and given the number of guests this property accommodates, they appear far from adequate. Our kids chose to swim at the pool area where there were pool slides. This pool is located on a dark side of the building so wasn't an appealing place to sunbathe or relax. The other main pool area often looked crowded and the seating area is very squashed looking.Both reception and concierge were very helpful and nicely pleasant with socially engaging conversations with ourselves and our kids. Any enquiries/requests made to both reception and housekeeping were answered and met straight away. Our welcome with leis and beads on arrival was a nice touch and Honolulu-like...aloha!We ate within the village at the Tropic restaurant a few nights. The menu wasn't that great but the service from staff was really nice and went out of their way to accommodate us - thanks Brian. There was live music each night as well which were really good and made our night. It's expensive and there are cheaper but still nice places nearby you can wonder out to.We felt the beach was a bit of an overstatement. Although I think that's because we're spoilt for beaches in New Zealand. The sand was gristly and felt hard underneath, i.e. you could wriggle down into the sand if you wanted to. Overall the Hilton Grand vacations is a nice property and we found all staff to be very helpful. Some staff were looking to help us even if we hadn't asked them - that's awesome. I had read in other reviews that people regarded Hilton visitors like a factory-run business - we didn't find this at all and staff at all levels from ground-staff upwards were all so pleasant and helpful. We would visit again for a stop-over. Oh! and the luau was fantastic well worth a booking - entertaining and a great meal. Kia ora! from NZ

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was an important stay for our family. So I tried to contact them more than 3 times (2 emails, 2 phone calls, and leaving a note) just to confirm a room type, as we purchased "ocean view" two bedroom suite. Long story short, we got a room facing hotel construction hearing the noise all day long. You could see the ocean, but hardly. Please remember that this hotel made another category "Ocean Front" that is actually the ocean view. Furthermore, we had a lizard in the room that scared all of my family. FYI, I am a Diamond member of Hilton HHonors program...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were a little hesitant of the ocean view if there were buildings in front of the lagoon tower, but they worked it out just perfect that you can see the view to iconic Diamond head and still some of the beach. We were lucky enough to see the birds eye view of the luau's below us too. Be aware if you are in a middle room the elevators are extremely loud. As these are some of the older buildings be aware of construction and some rooms needing some freshinging up.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Lagoon Tower, Hilton Hawaiian Village is an excellent place for a vacation any time of the year, our vacation to Hawaii was in January for a two week vacation, the various activities at the village are many and various

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed here during the holidays for a week. Overall it was a good experience. The only things we didn't care for was the slow internet, the onslaught of young children inundating the hot tub, and the early closing of the Lagoon Tower pool area. Also, though the room was comfortable, it could probably use a nice remodel soon.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: 3 bdr Penthouse had old, tired, worn and DIRTY/stained furniture and drapes. Cigarette burns in carpet. Not what I had expected a Hilton property would actually rent out. Stayed at a Best Western hotel in San Diego that had better/cleaner furniture and more comfortable BED. Room was not worth using my future points. Description of room was ocean view.....room had maybe 10% distant ocean view, 80% was next door condo patios (you can wave to them) and 10% harbor view. So really, write up should say PARTIAL OCEAN VIEW. Complained to Resort Managers about all my complaints and wrote letter to General Manager.
