No one has authority to help you or change your room or at least give back points that you borrowed to stay in a less than expected room. So we had to stay in this OUTDATED, INADEQUATE DINGY ROOM. When people rent a 3 BDR PENTHOUSE you don't expect to get dirty furniture with stains and uncomfortable beds with sheets that barely fit the bed, inadequate kitchen with not enough pots and pans..you have to ASK for everythig....what's up Hilton?

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Although there was a lot of construction going on at the resort, this is by far one of the best places to stay for a family. The resort is a compound of shops, pools, restaurants and rooms that are within walking distance to the main shopping areas in Waikiki. The food is good, there are major restaurants within steps of your room and the spa/fitness center is first class. We like to stay here because our kids are older now and they can walk into the town or take a quick UBER to the University area for nightlife. I like the beach walk to the shops - when counting steps daily it helps to be able to walk for coffee, upscale shops (NOT CHEAP), and fun eateries. Other resorts on the beach are nice but I like the Hilton compound, as I call it, because there are so many pools and the nice lagoon to choose from.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our experience started with Shizuko at check in made us all feel welcome she made sure we all got our lais detailed amenities avail to us from where to park and movie rentals , she is warm and amazing shared travel tips for our next trip to japan , we stayed in lagoon tower 11th floor she gave us a great corner room. I own. I have to honestly state that she was so detailed we were able to enjoy amenities from the start!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I like The Hawaiian sky,sea and wind. The view from The Lagoon Tower,calm mind. This time was my family and friend's family. They also stayed. We also want to stay in The Lagoon Tower. We can't wait our next vacation.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: we have been owners at HGVC for over ten years and we loved it. Since the sale to Blackstone occurred a few years ago, the quality of property upkeep and service has significantly been reduced. Furniture in sitting area is proportioned for small people. I am 6'2" not overly tall but feel as if it is being designed for a diminutive sized person.We were here for 9 nights, 11 in total on the complex. We had housekeeping on day 5 and could get no flexibility or assistance in early/late checkout or luggage transport from Tapa Tower to Kalia after night 1 or from Kalia to Rainbow tower for our final night 11. I would not buy into Hilton Grand Vacation at this point in time and can only hope it improves again with time. It use to be great and we use to love coming here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Had a excellent time great room with view of ocean Fire works on Friday night were awesome and the sounds of the ocean were relaxing food at this resort is very good resort is within walking distance to everything

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This hotel has a 30 DAY cancellation policy. My pet fell ill 1 week before our trip and we had to cancel. The only way out of the one night room +tax penalty was a DOCTOR note that said we couldn't travel. Veterinarian note would not suffice. Hotel was fully booked and I have Diamond status with Hilton and it still was not enough to waive the fee. Over $400 down the drain in addition to the vet bills. No thanks, I'll go elsewhere next time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: the front desk clerk was very rude to us. We just had a horrible experience upon or arrival after a 6 hour flight. We end up switching to another clerk whom was very helpful and nice. She checked us in.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are Hilton Grand Vacations Time Share owners and are glad that we are. We utilize our benefits to the max! We have stayed in HGV properties throughout the world. Highly recommend the timeshare ownership.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautifully appointed rooms with lots of space.Fantastic views of the ocean and lagoon Ideal for watching the sunset from the lanai.Easy walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping centre with a good choice of restaurants on the premises.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My husband and I enjoyed the stay for our wedding on the beach and honeymoon. So many activities and views to enjoy. The rooms were quite nice with a balcony onlooking the lagoon and Oceanside. We can not wait to go back......................

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Flew into Honolulu on a holiday and stayed in Honolulu for 6 days. Upon an early arrival in the morning, check-in staff insisted on a 4pm check in time, so we hung around the shopping just around Hawaiian Village. Ended up sitting next to a fish pond with security wondering what we were doing with the fish in the pond for hours.I booked a 2 bedroom at the Lagoon Tower. It had an apartment style setting and the quality of the room was true to its Hilton name. The site was well maintained for a time-shared property. There were 2 balconies at the room we stayed at, one facing the man-made beach, and the other onto the rooftop of the car park where there are shows happening every night. Every Friday, there is also fireworks at the man-made beach and the view was just to die for. I spent a day sleeping outside on the balcony on a high floor and it was just awesome all rounds.Here are my standard pros and cons:Pros:- Convenience of food and shopping (ABC store) within walking distance- Very discreet room service (ninjas in action)- Super friendly staff (sorta like something out of Disney movies - lilo and stitch comes to mind)- Discount vouchers for Hawaiian Village offered on check in- Nice sun tans on the balconies (but I did get a heat stroke after spending the whole day sleeping in the sun. Serves me right for being an idiot)- Laundry rooms for washing clothes- Great for families who want a "controlled" environmentCons: - Can get expensive in the Village (hence most guests are in their 30s-80s possibly due to their sheer amount of wealth accumulated on their pension funds or massive credit card bills)- Got bitten by ONE mosquitoes/sand fly at a high floor. I can't imagine what a lower floor would have to go through- Parking can be confusing (after the first time, you should be right)- Random people yelling in the middle of the night (not Hilton's fault, more like crazy tourists with brain problems)- Time shared property so you will get asked to attend their seminars (a lot)- Noise level can get out of control outside of normal sleeping times (easily fixed with closing windows and turn on the air con)- Self Parking is $24 a day (got given a pass to go in and out of car park during my stay) I think for the amount of $ paid for the rooms, this should really be included.If you are interested in my experience please read on (or you can choose to not be bored to death).I was there during Holoween and it was quite an experience. Hilton had something set up in front of the hotel lawn. It was great for photos and Facebook.Just a note, get a rental car to drive around. Walking downtown or to Ala Moana can be a challenge in 30 degree celcius heat/ 86 fahrenheit. Every time I walked around, it felt like I am being showered in my own sweat. That meant having to wash or buy new clothes. I guess those hawaiian t-shirts that I wear around does look "unique" in Australia.This hotel is quite close (15 min walk) to Ala Moana shopping centre or strip mall as you Americans call it (nobody strips). It has every shop (I can think of) under the sun. A short walk the other way is downtown and you will find all the big named brands like Gucci, LV, etc. I'm pretty sure my cracked credit card (due to overuse) is a testament of the sheer amount of things you can buy. Looking forward to my replacement credit card soon.Hilton Honors Gold did make a difference as we were offered to access to Executive lounge.Hope you enjoy this hotel as much as me writing this review.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite (2 adults, 3 children) for 9 nights in the Lagoon Tower. The room was enormous and had plenty of room for us. Having 2 bathrooms was especially good. The kids loved the pool with waterslides and the lagoon, both of which were easily accessible from the bottom of the tower.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a lovely, largely time share, hotel located right on Waikiki Beach. On the grounds of the Hilton Hawaiian Village, there are numerous shops and sights, including Friday night fireworks. There are several restaurants on property but in addition, there are some incredible restaurants within an easy walk. The rooms have kitchens, refrigerators for your leftovers, and stoves & microwaves. There are lanais that allow for a view of the sunsets while sipping a glass of wine.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at one of the two-bedroom suites during family summer vacation this year (2015). Very clean and well kept hotel. My Diamond status with Hilton didn't matter at all with this hotel, no consideration for upgrades or access to lounge - which was somewhat disappointing, but overall we were pleased and would recommend for stay. The hotel is located right on the beach and shopping is abundant on site!! We really liked our room - full kitchen and two bathrooms were a must for us because we have three little ones. The sellers were not overly aggressive and we considered becoming an owner/member. Overall - very good experience at this location.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Always welcomed by friendly & helpful staff when we visit! Love the convenience of shops and restaurants on site. 2 ABC stores & 2 Starbucks make the mornings and late nights. Unfortunately, the Poolside service leaves a little to be desired (slow & inattentive service).

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Lagoon hotel is located just footsteps from Waikki Beach with access to pools and the lagoon. Very near restaurants and shopping and also near transportation. There are many things to see and do but you can also just sit back and relax and read a book. The staff is prompt and courteous and will try to assist you to fix any problem you may have. Since the building of the Grand Waikkian behind the Lagoon they have been connected by stairs and ramps and hotel registry for both are located at the Grand Waikkian, somewhat of a bother.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Overall, we had a fun time at this resort. The village has everything you need, but is a little more expensive then the rest of Waikiki. For a Hilton resort I expected more in the customer service realm, but I think they have gotten so big that they no longer have the luxury to care about its guests individual experiences. Here's my pros/cons if you're debating. Just as an FYI for management: We stayed in 1168 and 1166 at lagoon tower while there with our family during Thanksgiving week.Pros: rooms are a nice size and can provide lots of room for a big family with children: living room, balcony and bed room(s) with great views-fully capable kitchens with dish washing detergent, trash bags and paper towels.-cleaning crew comes once mid-week-The front ocean front suite at lagoon tower was great for Friday fireworks. -The resort has several fun pools-each have their own cool feature so try all of them. The tappas pool was the best for babies because it has a shallow area with bubbles. The lagoon pool has lots of slides and it was really fun, but the water was super cold.-The village has several restaurants that were coco enemy, but most of them lacked quality and reasonable prices so I would else where for dinner. Lunch was convo enemy to have there. I recommend pronto pickle for breakfast. -DVD rental: free unlimited DVD rentals during your stay. There were lots of current movies available.-They provide towels for pools but you have to return them to get a new towel rental card. Each card is $10. This was a hassle, but I understand it.Cons:-There was mold all over our shower head cord in 1166. It had been there a long time. It was easy to wipe off too because I did it. --Cleaning crew turned on one of the stove burners and left it on high. It was the one with an empty tea kettle. We found it hours later. -Hotel customer service lacked initiative or desire to please customers. The feel I got was that the staff there let the location of Waikiki and name of Hilton say it all. They made no attempt to make the guests experience memorable like other resorts I've stayed. Examples below:-We tried to get a taxi at lagoon tower and we had to interrupt 2 hotel staff members whose job is to find out where we want to go and then whistle to the taxi in line. They kept talking even after we arrived and stood next to them and they made eye contact with us. Finally after a couple mins, my husband, annoyed with them, interrupted and they kindly got us a taxi.-They are doing renovations, so before you book, call to ask what week they're renovating each floor. At Thanksgiving they were doing the 12th floor and it was SO loud. We had a baby who was woken up. We called several times to complain. It woke us up a couple days and our neighbors came to us because they also had a baby woken up. The front desk gave us $50 credit on our first complaint, but then apologized for every call afterwards. They were supposed to be moving down to the 11th floor soon. -There are two hot tubs at lagoon, but despite having signs that say a max 9 and no one under 5 yrs old allowed, I never saw it without those rules broken. At one point there were 25 people in both tubs and several people had floaties in their arms, so yes they were under 5. -The rentals for the tiny lagoon are CRAZY expensive. A paddle board for 1 hour is $41 with tax. Just go to the beach down the side walk and it's $25. I think it should be more reasonable prices for guests who are paying to stay here!In summary, it's a beautiful place that provides everything you need in the village, for the right price of course. It was a lot of fun, but I wouldn't expect a lot of extras besides a place to sleep and shower and cool pools near by. This place is massive and has thousands of guests each week so expect crowded pools and average to less than average customer service.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Ocean side of the Kalia Tower , you can see beautiful sunset . Scenery is the best . Friday you can see the Hilton fireworks from the room . Because it is close to the road , such as easily bus is available .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Perhaps the title says it all. This was an RCI exchange and the unit was magnificent; even had an up close and personal look at the Friday night fireworks from the lanai. The 2BR unit was newly renovated; we were the first guests to use it since it was done. This is a great place to stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The service is despicable from start to finish. Check in, operator, room quality, security, valet were all disappointing. You will be treated with total disregard at every step. Forget service, you will be lucky if anyone answers the phone.I was so frustrated with this train station of a hotel, I decided to cut up my Diamond status card and my Hilton reserve credit card. I plan to stay the heck away from this Hilton and all Hiltons.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very nice hotel but is the furthest from the beach. Service was excellent. Rooms and kitchens were very well equipped. Complimentary washer/drier on each floor was nice. No charge for detergent. Small pool within the hotel was nice if you had small children.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stayed in HGVC Hawaiian Village with my wife for a week. We come back here at least once a year because we love this place very much. The whole village is beautifully landscaped, with several pools, bars, restaurants and shops just within the village. When you walk around the village, you feel very relax and calm. It's like paradise. I think the management has to control the vehicles coming into the village as it might spoilt the serenity of the place.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Kalia Suites and were very impressed with the resort. Large rooms, nice view and well supplied. The staff was very curtious. Tons to do on site and in the area. We will definitely return.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I had a wonderful vacation in Oahu, Hawaii. We stayed at the Hilton Lagoon Tower. The room was immaculate and the staff at the hotel was great. Not only the Concierge staff had great suggestions, but even the bellman we spoke to gave us great advice on where to go and what to see. I am a Hilton Grand Vacation Club Member, and the Hilton staff treated me and my family like royalty. We definitely will stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Wonderful location right on the beach with plenty of pools, hot tubs, and a lagoon that you can go paddle boarding in. Lots of amenities right on the hotel grounds. I loved the early morning yoga, thai chi, and body sculpt classes.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We brought our family to the Hilton Lagoon Apts for a 3 night stay in Waikiki. Being local we chose the Lagoon Apts because we have stayed there before and enjoyed our stay. The two bedroom unit was very spacious and comfortable. We had a view of the "great lawn" and part of the lagoon and ocean. We were on the 9th floor which was high enough to enjoy the great view. The Hilton is a great place to stay with a lot of restaurants and bars, shopping, shore activities, where you don't have to leave the complex to enjoy yourselves. There is a lagoon that was recently cleaned up making the water clearer and enjoyable. If you are into stand up paddling the lagoon provides a safe venue where you can't get blown around compared to the ocean. We didn't go to any of the restaurants however we cooked in the unit which provided all the comforts of home. We had a very enjoyable stay at the Lagoon Apts.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was a beautiful trip. we stayed in a two bedroom suite and there was plenty of extra room for the four of us. There are so many things to do on grounds and in walking distance we choose to not rent a car. all of the excursions have pickup right outside the hotel so we didn't miss having a car. The beach is beautiful but very rocky on the lagoon end and the lagoon had a strong fishy odor. i got in it once and that was enough for me. It is also very cold. I would suggest bringing your own floats for the pool or beach. they are available to rent but you can buy them at them many tourist shops for 2 dollars. chairs and umbrellas have to be rented at beach as well, none are provided.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: All in all a great place to stay. We had a few minor issues that were resolved quickly. The location is excellent with lots of facilities near by and on the property 22 acres. There are several restaurants on property as well as nearby. If you can't find something that suits you then you aren't looking.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Kalia tower which is set back from the ocean but ocean/lagoon view was incredible. Service was great and resort has everything you need. We enjoyed Friday nite fireworks from the room. Gym and pool in the tower was very convenient. Another great time trip to Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: visited the hilton grand vacation club at lagoon tower in October. was so pleasantly surprised to find our 19 th floor two bedroom plus had only been finished the day before. the decor is Devine, the colours are so fresh and clean, but still with the tropical island feel. the wooden table, to the new carpets ,to the contrasting prints on the wall, every detail was perfect... I was so excited to enjoy the new refurbished lagoon tower, now it not only has the best location of all towers but also the best decor. well done hilton...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village has Timeshare Apartments as well as Hotel Rooms. The timeshare suites in addition to bedrooms and bathrooms have kitchens which enable you to eat many of your meals in your room saving you money and time on your vacation. We vacation there without a car and can walk to Sam's and Walmart to pick up many items at competitive prices to those on the Continental US. There is a supermarket two blocks away which has fresh fruit, vegetables, meat and fish to enable you to pick up additional items you need routinely during your stay. There is a laundry on your floor for you to do wash your cloths for longer stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the 2bdrm ocean front unit. The experience was unforgettable. We will come back again and again. Excellent location, great views, beautiful sunsets, great beach and ocean activities. Nice restaurants, close to the Hale Koa and their brunch. Very good fitness center. Pool is well designed and family oriented.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Lagoon tower is old. We hope newly plan for other tower. We don`t have to reserve the Lagoon tower in the next time. They has old inside of room and outside noise. We have an idea for reservation other towers in the next tripe because of the Lagoon tower situation.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was the first time that we would be using our new Hilton Grand Vacation Club points. We were so excited. We were greeted with a lei and were able to check in with ease. We were then escorted to a concierge who proceeded to give us a bunch of basically worthless stuff. Coupons, a reusable bag and other junk. He then tried to get us to visit the newest suites in order for us to buy more points. Really?! on our very first visit? C'mon, are you really that desperate to sell more points. Not cool. Our 1 bedroom premiere suite was just ok. The living space was quid small. We felt cramped. The dryer was awful. We had a lot of laundry to do side we had spent a week on Kauai and Maui. The stupid dryer kept stopping itself no matter what setting we tried. It took 4 hours to dry 1 load. The washer and dryer were tiny. We used used to the small stacked washer and dryers from other condo we have visited but these were TINY. The bathroom was okay but a bench in the shower would have been nice. Also, a bath and a half would have helped. They were smart to put the bedroom in the back corner of the unit. It was always very quiet and we were able to get a good night's sleep. The Hilton Hawaiian Village has several pools but they all close really early. No good. We were gone all day each day touring the island and all it had to offer so we wanted to swim in the evening. We couldn't swim at all since each time we went down to the pool, it was closed. All of the restaurants were way overpriced but we did find a nice happy hour at the italian place. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is Very Crowded. Be prepared. All in all, it was an average stay but for the price we paid, it should have been amazing. We will probably not use our points to return.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: multiple check-in locations (Hawaiian Village vs Grand Vacation vs Kalia tower. Yet can only use one. Clear airport cabs don't know where to drop off. Nobody checked until completing wait in long slow line, exposed to wind, rain and humidity. Then walking to different check-in a starting over in the line. Checkin was slow. Room nice and big and clean. But as expected given the $$$ price. Bellservice gave wrong info on cabs/shuttle. On check-out Hilton computers were down. No receipt. Said they would email receipt. Still don't have a receipt. Towel service person gave poor info and had poor attitude. Well below expectations for a Hilton.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Staying at the Hilton was an experience beyond words. Excellent in all phases of hospitality, accommodations and more. A first class resort with first class "aloha". My wife and I enjoyed the staff and their caring attitude. The ocean view was spectacular and the Friday night fireworks display was breathtaking from our lanai. The pool was great with excellent service from the staff. The resort is only walking distances from many restaurants, stores and Honolulu's major shopping center at Ala Moana. Simply awesome!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is an absolutely amazing resort. If you are the type that enjoy cooking yourself (and saving a ton of money as the places around here are pricey) this is the place for you. Make sure you get a suite with a kitchen. Top notch amenities and service. Would definitely recommend it! A lot of people ranted about the luau but it was okay. It is on a rooftop deck and surrounded by buildings. It is not an ideal backdrop for an event like this. We saw one at the Marriot in Maui last year that was spectacular.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I recently spent a wonderful week at the Hilton Hawaiian Village at Waikiki Beach in Honolulu. It was a delayed honey moon. The service and all other amenities at the hotel were simply super. The parking prices arwe a bit high, but everything else was perfect!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Came as part of grand vacations experience. The place is located right on the beach and has everything you need right there; shops, restaurants, convenience stores, bars, and entertainment. You could stay for whole vacation and have fun.We found it busy and crowded. Beach is beautiful, but a lot of people. They do have a rental car booth on site and we were able to leave and explore. This was great and highly recommend going out and exploring the island. With GPS the roads are easy to learn. There is a lot of traffic, but there is something about driving around Hawaii in a convertible. Can't beat it.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were offered a stay in this hotel to attend a sales presentation. The staff and whole organization was great and we enjoyed our stay. The location on Wakiki Beach is amazing. Be sure to stay for the Friday fireworks display by the Lagoon. You should hear the echos from all of the buildings.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is an amazing property, right on a private beach with Lagoon for the children to swim in. There is plenty to do and enjoy. We were there during the renovation process of the Lagoon Tower and we received one of the newly renovated rooms, that are stunning. The only major issue we experienced was the construction noise from the renovations of the remaining floors during the day. If you are gone all day, there is no problem...... The staff is fantastic and so helpful

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We recently took a cruise in Hawaii on Norwegian's Pride of America -- which was great. At the end of the cruise, we stayed in Honolulu for 4 additional nights at the Hilton Grand Vacation Club's Kalia Tower. Our suite was spectacular with a fabulous view and was very well appointed. The location in the Hilton Hawaiian Village had everything you could want or desire. The property staff was very service-oriented and responsive to all of our needs. We enjoyed having easy access to a separate pool area right in this complex as an alternative to the additional pools on-site. It was a bit more quiet and truly relaxing. My wife enjoyed a spa treatment at the Madara Spa and we got great suggestions and help from the concierge on-site. This was one of the most pleasant and enjoyable hotel stays we have had anywhere and we have traveled extensively at luxury properties like Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton. This was even better!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We booked two 2 bedroom sites, ocean front at lagoon tower. One was room #567 on 5th floor and another was #467 on 4th floor. Both got the same exact floor plan and located north west corner of the lagoon tower but views were totally different. #567 had beautiful view if ocean right in front of the room but #467 had palm tree view with ocean back ground.I would recommend to book higher floors.The hotel was really family friendly. Small kids were happy about pools with slides and parents were also happy because the pool was close enough to watch their kids from pool lounge chairs.It was very helpful that they have a waiting lounge with lockers, showers with amenities, bathrooms, kids play room, lounge space and soft drink station for the people who are waiting for check-in or have time to kill before heading to the air port after check-out.Unfortunately, the hotel itself is very old and out dated. It seemed any renovation has done for a while. They had flat TV and free wifi but there were no USB plugs, of cause, and electric plugs were not enough in each room for all of the family member's gadgets. The carpet and armrests on the couch were worn out.Over all, this would not be my first choice in Wikiki.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have stayed at the Lagoon Tower every year since 2004. We have always had a great experience with the staff as well as our room. I would recommend this resort to everyone who is looking for accommodations in Honolulu.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful part of the Hilton Hawain Villlage with numerous shops, restaraunts, pools, and a nice lagoon area with a nice beach and several beach activities. Had a large one bedroom condo with a great ocean view. Truly a 5 star property with something for everyone. Fireworks on Friday evening were enjoyable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had the southeast corner, three bedroom, three bathroom unit. It had a wrap around patio so that even though you were not ocean front, you had two different ocean views. The bedrooms were large and comfortable. The kitchen was small, but large enough to cook. I cooked every night except the last night and was able to do whatever I needed or wanted without any problems. The only thing I didn't like was not having the washer and dryer in the unit. The laundry room was right next to our unit, so it was convenient, but you had to share with others on the floor. In Hilton style, everything else was great. It was a fantastic unit.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Always enjoy a staycation here at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Lagoon Tower. We know people come from all over the world to enjoy Waikiki and the beach so it's fun to play tourist and enjoy it too as a family!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This place is one of the nicest resorts in Waikiki! We stood in the Lagoon tower due to the need of the full kitchen. Place was very clean, modern and well equipped. Free internet in the Lagoon Tower is a real plus! Resort had plenty of restaurants and shopping so that there is no need to leave unless you want to. Three pools to choose from, a lagoon and the beach are right on the property. Although the resort is very large and has many people, it never felt crowded. You could find a place on the sand at the Lagoon and not have to sit near anyone. This is great if you have small children that need to run around. Definitely a place that I will return to!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Lagoon Tower was my choice for a week vacation. This was my second stay at Hilton Hawaiian Village...the first being at the Grand Waikikian. I had a roomy two-bedroom suite with an ocean view. The room was nice, but it was clear that the property is in need of renovations. The furniture had very noticeable chips, scratches, and scraps. I found a 1/2" hole in the bathroom wall at the paper dispenser. The sleeper sofa was quite worn. On the positive, all appliances worked well, though the main television required some maintenance (sound with no picture a couple of times).I had added an additional two nights onto this stay. This required moving into a different two-bedroom suite because the ocean view room I originally booked had no availability past the originally book six nights.The second room was even roomier, but again, the need for renovations was quite evident. I found trim around the floor to be badly in need of replacement. The sofa was also worn, and the tables had similar chips, scratches, and scrapes.The front desk was adequately responsive to any concerns. The AC unit in the second room malfunctioned, and it took about one hour for this to be corrected. It turned out to be a very minor problem, and the repairman was very efficient.Concierge was helpful for all of my needs. The cleaning service was very good.You will need to be prepared to pay premium dollar for items (food and otherwise) at the stores and restaurants in the village, but this shouldn't surprise anyone. There are plenty of places to purchase food and souvenirs within easy walking distance of the resort.Overall, the Lagoon Tower is a nice place to stay. However, if you are more interested in a more luxurious location, including having in-room washer/dryer and whirlpool tub, then choose the Grand Waikikian instead. In spite of the fact that I was closer to the water by staying in the Lagoon Tower, i will definitely look to the Waikikian the next time. I'm sure that once the upgrades to the Lagoon Tower are completed, I will reconsider choosing it.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a two bedroom ocean view apartment from our HGVC points. The pool and Lagoon were both comfortable and kid and adult friendly. The view was magnificent, and the room itself was lovely. One disappointment was there was no washer or dryer. This is not typical for timeshares and especially not for Hilton. Too bad as we had dirty clothes from our prior visit in Kauai.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The staff were awesome, the room was good. We were next to the elevators and the noise was noticeable but nothing different from any other room next to the elevators. The room was very clean and everything worked. The Hilton Hawaiian Village has plenty of activities and the lagoon was awesome. The pool near the Lagoon Tower was a big hit as well. The Lagoon Tower is away from the main village therefore less crowd and quieter. If you're a HGVC member you can't beat the price. We'll definitely return on our next staycation.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We love the Hawaiian Hilton Village and the complex of hotels. We stayed at the Lagoon Tower and their service was exceptional. The restaurants were nice but pricey. The beach atmosphere is magnificent and the views are spectacular. The composition of the guests is very cosmopolitan with lots of Asian tourists.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I was pleased with this resort very clean and beautiful, with all the things needed for a nice stay. Walking distance to many restaurant's and public transportation. There was loud construction (jackhammers going off at 9AM) that sounded like they were in our room . This work continued for all day so we requested another tower and that solved the problem. If you want to enjoy the hot tub ,it was overfull with small children unsupervised .The sign says max 9 but I counted 18 at times ,half young children.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This Hawaiian Village consists of 7 different towers and we stayed in the Kalia Tower for 7 nights. Any of these towers would be an awesome location for a vacation in Honolulu. You are close to many restaurants, entertainment, a wide variety of pools and special spa treatments. Our unit was a one bedroom with two queen beds and a full kitchen, living room and small dining table (we sat 7). The view was of the mountain and was very interesting every morning with cloud coverage and great photo opportunities.The village pools were clean, clear and accessible from every location. There is a small poll on the 4th floor by the spa, but was too full of kids for the size. This should really be an adult only location. There were small kids in the hot tubs and were not the appropriate age and the lifeguards passed by without handling it.The parking garage is pricy at $29 per day so don't rent a car if you do not use it every day, take the local bus.There are several good shopping areas within walking distance as well.Don't forget to sit on the beach or lagoon at sunset every night and Friday night there are free fireworks at dusk.Overall a great place to rest and relax.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This place has it all, and has the best, biggest beach on Waikiki! Our room was beautiful, the view is magnificent and the lush landscaping underscores the tropical paradise we visited. With many pools, a themed shopping area and countless eateries, its tempting to never leave the ground!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Checked in yesterday after 15 hours of travel to our ocean view room. Needless to say, if you room is xx20, it is NOT oceanview. You look right into another hotel, the noise from the blower at the hotel is a high pitch squeal and Hilton stands by it saying it is oceanview. We travel two times a year, and NEVER have experienced this. Certainly not what we paid for. Hotel wants to blame the owner we rented from. It is NOT the owners fault that you rate this room that way. We would had been better off with resort view at least then the place across the street isn't looking at me sitting in my living room. Will be looking to take the loss and leave the property. We are Hilton Gold members and a hotel would not get away with this. Looking to move out as soon as we find something and lose our prepaid money. Never again will we use HILTON Grand Vacation Club for our travel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Before staying here be sure to understand that Hilton staff have their "hands tied" if you have any issues while at the property. In other words they can not make any changes to your stay (i.e.: not correct room type, air conditioner does't work, elevators are very slow, etc.) With all the options at Waikiki you should really consider them all before booking.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family of 4 enjoyed a 7 night stay at the Hilton Hawiaan Village timeshare. We had a 2 bedroom / 2 bathroom with living room and kitchen - ocean front. The timeshare was really nice. The only complaints I had was the pool and spa area closed at 4pm daily. I would recommend this place and I would stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Kalia Suites - Hilton Hawaiian Village was an excellent place to stay. The staff was friendly, the room was very clean and tidy, and the location right on Waikiki beach is perfect. The Hilton Hawaiian Village also is the only hotel on Waikiki beach to have fireworks each Friday night which was a nice little perk.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Both guests and staff were very Aloha-minded and we enjoyed the vibe. Rooms are very nice and elevator lobbies, tower lobbies all highly functional and pleasant. Resort surf instructors and SUP lagoon is really fun. Lots of pools and poolside food and bev service and jacuzzis and restaurants, convenience stores, clothing, gifts on site.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are in Kalia tower for a week at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Sitting on our balcony, having just had coffee and breakfast, overlooking a rainbow strewn sky. It's pretty damn nice.The room is lovely, a one bedroom with an ample living room. There's even a kitchen with a decent coffee maker. We made dinner here one night, a nice option. There are great restaurants within easy walking distance. On a slightly longer walk there are shopping malls, and even two Apple Stores which we are absolutely lacking in our little rural corner of Montana. The service is lovely all around the village. The restaurants within the village are definitely lacking, as you would notice reading other reviews. I highly recommend Goofy Café and Dine immediately north of the village. Very casual atmosphere, delicious, creative food.We were at the village last year at Ali'i tower, loved that as well, and we plan on returning again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The suite and amenities were outstanding. We used to live there and I was a little disappointed not in the hotel but Waikiki itself. It's gotten way too crowded and the loss of the old International Market Place will be a great loss to the aesthetics of this area. High-end stores will never replace the Market Place.We attended the Hilton Luau. I cannot say it was great. I can't even say it was good. I can say don't waste your money. The food was not very good and the entertainment left a lot to be desired. Granted it was inside but the show should not suffer because it was raining or there should have been a refund.Hotel pools are very crowded and some guests don't understand politeness.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The resort was great, they had friendly staff and our suite was great. Gripes were about how early they closed two of the pools, the closest ones and one of them with the slides) and the towel service for the pools closed at 5 or 6 as well. So if you went to the large pool that was open till 10, if you didn't have a towel (we didn't know this service closed) you're out of luck. Also the fitness facility needs updating and needs more equipment. You can exercise outside by the ocean, but many of the days we were there it rained quite hard. They need more full body equipment and kettlebells. Other than these gripes, we were very satisfied with the Lagoon Tower :)

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We enjoyed our stay here, and I bet we would even more if we had little ones. This resort seems geared towards families, but I never felt like I was at Disney and missing out on fun because of it. We had an ocean view room in the Lagoon Tower (the timeshare building) which was lovely, spacious, clean, and the view was solid. We spent a fair bit of time on the balcony with friends taking it in. We also had a view down on to the lagoon, which has lots of rentals available for lazy boating. I've never stayed at a complex like this before, though I imagine lots of beach resorts are similar. There was lots of included shopping, restaurants, coffee houses, convenience stores, and amenities. That meant that nothing we needed was too far away, though it absolutely came at a premium. Prices were actually kind of outlandish at times, especially the bars.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village has so much going on and it's a wonderful place to stay. Activities for all ages. Many restaurants for different tastes. A good place to shop for all of your souvenirs. And a few convenience stores as well.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The location is perfect. All the Asian artwork is perfect. The main pool is a work of art. The grounds are v. peaceful. I staid in the Lagoon Tower, and my room, looking out onto the dolphin area and out to sea was great. The only let down, and it is a major one, is that the quality of food at all the onsite restaurants was just "ok", but the prices being charged verged on the outrageous. To be expected, perhaps, but still a disappointment. The problem is that, unlike Honolulu, there aren't many nearby alternatives on the Big Island.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a great place to stay, and it is right in the heart of where you want to be. There are great restaurants on the property, as well as within walking distance of the hotel. The pools are big and clean and it is right on the beach. There is a freshwater lagoon on the property and even some small water slides. Everything in Hawaii is pretty expensive, but they are not over the top at the restaurants or bars in the hotel. There were a few areas that could use some updating, but mostly was great.The worst thing about the area is that it is not the beautiful, iconic Hawaii that you see in movies, it really is the big city with a beach around it. It is very much like putting downtown Los Angeles closer to the ocean.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: A lovely facility with very friendly front desk staff who are very, very professional. It is a great location, an easy walking distance to the Ala Moana shopping center (for those who don't mind a short walk).

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I was convinced to book the Hilton in Oahu at the Hawaiian Village due to the persistence of the sales team. Not a bad deal $799 for 6 days. I was specific that I could only travel if I had a business center access. Having stayed in Hilton's around the world, I was shocked to learn that the HIlton Business Center here is NOT 24-hours and you have to PAY FOR USING IT. Coupled with a sluggishly slow internet connection in the rooms, the inability to work while traveling at the HIlton Hawaiian Village was incredibly ridiculous. As a single mother who owns my own business, I can only travel with my children when I am certain I can use a business center or internet connection during prime business hours on the mainland. The sales team lied directly when they told me the business center was 24 hours. I mentioned it to the hotel and I was given another wifi password - which was also sluggishly slow. Top that off with this is the only HIlton I have ever stayed at that had no room service, and you can call the vacation frustrating. On top of that the food on the property is super expensive and pedestrian. If I wanted to go to an overpriced Benihana or eat hamburgers and hot dogs, I could have stayed in NY or LA. The food here lacks the cultural emphasis one would wish for on a Hawaiian vacation. Also, the luau that were were given tickets to as part of the package was c classic rubber chicken style hotel event. It was held in a conference center and not on the beach so it really had the feel of a obligatory business dinner in a cheap hotel, not a rich Hawaiian flair one would except. Thumbs way down. I will not ever return to this Hilton hotel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My first Hotel choice for Honolulu & Big Island are the Hilton. City within a Hotel, walk to beach, dining, shops, entertainment. Great service, rooms, amenities, location. Family & business friendly. My family have has been staying at the Hi Hilton for 20 yrs, we love the Hilton.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Kalia Tower (8/23-8/28/15) and I must say the room did not disappoint. The overall room was decently cleaned a few sand pebbles here and there, the bed was comfortable, the couches and dishes in the kitchen were clean. The room was beautifully updated with crown modeling, flat screen tv, the room had 2 lanai's. We were lucky enough to stay in an ocean front end unit and it was so worth. To be able to wake up and see the ocean every morning was just amazing. My only compliant is the bathroom did have a smell of cigarettes so not sure if a prior guest smoked in the restaurant or if it was bad venting system. I highly recommend the tower, the lobby is small and never crowded, there is a starbucks in the tower which is convenient and you can literally walk out the room on to the main road. The pool is pretty small, the spa was a little disappointing in terms of amenities. There is an onsite Luau which is very convenient and if it rains it will be moved from outdoors to indoors conference center. The tower is convenient to the ABC store. Overall I can't wait to stay again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: It was a hotel that you can enjoy the Oahu vacation of 7 days. The entire family was happy. Location also facilities we were satisfied. Once in two years is a hotel that you want to visit. Next time I look forward to again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The service is still quite nice. However, the accommodations just not living up to what had been in the past. . As owners since 90's, the view is still spectacular and the rooms are large for hotel rooms. However, the workmen just spatter, slap paint and leave irregular bumps on walls. You cannot call and get a call back even when promised so just keep calling if you want anything - until the xxx shows up just keep calling. Instead of the one suite, received an attached room for the 2nd bedroom. The pools have missing tiles and since Hilton had to open the beach, anyone off the street comes into the pools now. Also stains on the cabinet tops so we just wiped them down. The HGVC does give small bottle of dish soap and paper towels so you can wipe them down - nice touch .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I visited the Hilton Hawaiian Village hotel in 2007 and really liked my experience. Granted, back then I was a HHonors Diamond member and was upgraded to a very nice suite in the Tapa tower. But then, after a stay at the Hilton Seychelles property (see my review on tripadvisor) during which I was downgraded (yes, downgraded) from an Ocean front villa to a regular villa, I swore to switch my business over to a different brand and I did. 8 years later, I decided to see if it was worth giving back my business to Hilton. The short answer is: no. This year, I tried the Hilton Vacations Suite at the Hawaiian Village which is the time-share property in the Hilton Hawaiian resort. We arrived at around 10.30pm after a very long day (we flew all the way from France - no less than 13 hours on two different planes) and pulled into the main lobby driveway with our rental car. There was not a single staff member to help us out with our luggages or with our car (we wanted to valet park). We waited a good 10 minutes. Finally, someone showed up and asked us what we wanted. Ok, if we stop on a driveway where you are supposed to stop to valet park, what is really the purpose of asking us what we wanted? Anyway, we kindly explained we wanted to valet park. The staff member gave us a receipt and drove our car away, not offering any assistance with our luggages. We made our way to the main lobby where someone - who did not bother to ask the simple questions they train clerks to ask, like "how are you today?", "where are you visiting us from?" - asked us for our name. We did show our reservation print-out and were told we had not stopped at the right place. Hilton - word of advice : when people book at your facility, kindly tell them in an email where to stop and where to check-in. It is nasty to have to stop in one place (after 13 hours on two different planes) only to be told it is the wrong place. We were told to check-in at the Kalia tower, which we did. There, a clerk checked our booking and gave my friends key cards to their room. No polite questions, no information about the resort, not a single nice word welcoming us to the resort. I found out that my booking was yet in a different tower - the Lagoon tower. We asked the clerk if I could also have a room in the Kalia tower. After twenty minutes on the phone, he finally said no and I was sent to the other side of the resort to check-in at the Lagoon tower. Needless to say, by that time I was pretty furious and thought: "now I remember why I said: Hilton, never again".I arrived at the Lagoon tower and found out, with horror, that my room was right next to an elevator. As in, the door that you would not believe is a a door leading to a bedroom. You would think that that door (room 1071) would lead to a janitor closet. No, it was actually the door to a bedroom. Amazing! And what happened to my online prefrence "away from elevator"? Ah, sorry, this is Hilton standard. I opened the room and discovered what Hilton calls a "studio". Needless to say, this is just a more fancy way of saying "bedroom" with a kitchinette. The room was SO outdated. I had read the reviews here on tripadvisor and unfortunately, they are all true. Those studios are really dated. But you know what, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom was decent, the kitchen area was neat. So, apart from the decor which is really old, I have no major complaint about the "studio" except that I paid $260/night + taxes: I am afraid to say that this is clearly not worth it. As in, not worth it at all. In the lobby of the Lagoon tower, they had displays of the future makeover due to start in september 2015. The rooms will be beautiful then (and the room of my friends in the Kalia tower was truly beautiful). But there will still be one major issue with the studios in the Lagoon tower: no proper windows. So, you feel really cut out from the world in those studios.Otherwise, I really liked the Lagoon tower. It has a "vintage" touch which makes it, in my view, the best tower on the property.Lots of people complain about Honolulu and its gigantic resorts made of concrete. I do not. Do people realize that when these resorts were built, they also embodied a dream, that of affording nice vacations to a larger spectrum of the population? This is what I love about the Hilton Village. It is definitely "inclusive", whereas newer resorts strive on "exclusive"-ness and truly sabotage the dream of vacations in Paradise for the mainstream that represents Waikiki and its big resorts.The resort itself is really nicely located, in the heart of everything you could possibly want. Shops, beaches, restaurants, excursions, you name it.I love the fact that the resort is like a small city. I like the fact that it is crowded. I like the fact that it is anonymous and that you can blend in, without any expectation on the part of the property. You come in just as you are.I would have loved to find a note in my room saying "welcome back", given that is was my second stay at the resort. It is good practice to acknowledge returning customers. Is Hilton aware of this? Apparently not.The resort has 2 ABC Shops where I bought fresh fruits in the morning for breakfast ($7 for a small cup of fresh fruits is a bit steep but I guess this is the price to pay in this location). I had coffee at the Starbuck's stand in the Kalia tower.We tried the Benihana restaurant on property which was decent.I found it unacceptable to have to pay for lounge chairs around the lagoon (they will nickel and dîme you).I do have to acknowledge the cleaning staff who did my room. Wow! Cleaning was always impeccable. Great job. Thank you very much.3 days was not enough. I wished I could have stayed more but my next adventure awaited me (a cruise around the Hawaiian islands).Upon checking-out, the clerk was really cold. She did not offer any assistance for a cab or with my luggages. She handed me out the bill and I was the one to say "good bye". I got barely a smile back.All in all, I really liked my experience at the resort. I have highlighted the deficiencies above. My main complaint goes to Hilton as a brand: they just do not - as in NOT - have any proper regard for their customers. I felt like a cow ready to be milked. What a shame. Will I switch my business back over to Hilton? Hell, no. I have one more stay coming up at a Doubletree in Anaheim and I expect nothing short of the worst in terms of customer service. Aloha and Mahalo!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a memorable experience as owners due to excellent facilities and location. The view of luau and movie was a nice touch. We would appreciate having washing and dryer in the room next time. Overall excellent experience at this location. My daughter said that it was very very fun!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The location, views (ocean front), and room size were all great. But the suites need to be refreshed. Furnishings were dated and beat-up. Hallway and suite entrance had a smell. But the lobby area and the surrounding Hilton Hawaiian Village and pools were beautiful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Kalia Towers in Waikiki were very clean. The staff was super friendly. After travelling for many hours and being hot and tired (wearing jeans on the plane to stay warm) the cool lobby and friendly staff made the early arrival a little less painful. They also had my wife and my room ready early so we could go in and change into more comfortable clothing. The location is a great base to come back to after sightseeing around the different points on the island. I loved having the pool and spa on the 4th Floor available for relaxing at the end of each day. Even though we had to take two double beds, they ended up being VERY comfortable and worked just fine for the two of us. Our holiday was great. Mahalo.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This hotel is located just on waikiki Beach. It is a magnificent complex - almost a village in it self. The hotel is a bit old but very functionalThe pool areas are a bit small for such an amount OF people The restaurants on site are good but not greatThomas

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stay more than 13 times in Hilton Hawaiian village. I pleased this hotel, because we can enjoy　feel easy and no need to worrying about to where we go tomorrow. We can enjoy long vacations without going to crowded Waikiki. We enjoyed pool and sea and fireworks in Hawaiian Village and northshore foods and　Kailua　beach by using Rental car.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: All the shops and restaurants you need on the property. Nice lagoon as well as right on the beach. Very busy - close to downtown. Takes 45min to 1.5 hours to reach the golf courses. Recommend the Cabaret show.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed for 2 weeks with our children. The only redeeming feature was the pools that the children loved. It was so crowded with people, and you could never get a lounger as people would be up first thing and leave their towels for hours on end. I would not recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed for a four-day and three-night experience at the Lagoon Towers and the Hilton Grand Vacations. It was a great experience. From the time of check-in to check-out, the staff was wonderful and very accommodating. Our comfort and pleasant experience was of importance to them and a high priority. The view was spectacular and the facilities were excellent. The pool and jacuzzi was also another highlight to our trip, along with the option to enjoy the sandy beach at the lagoon. The location of the hotel is perfect and adjacent to other stores and restaurants. The Ala Moana Shopping Center is a few minutes from the hotel, as well as, the heart of Waikiki. Everything is within walking distance and accessible to our needs. Our room was fantastic. We had a two bedroom and there was lots of room, including a kitchenette. Very impressive. I highly recommend the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Service was excellent and the staff was extremely helpful. I was having a medical procedure and had to stay somewhere near. The whole thing was not easy but the hotel made it oh so manageable. The staff was helpful and the room like being at home but better.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I visited Oahu ,HONOLULU on HAWAII with my family ,wife and daughter 4 years old on summer vacation from 7/11 to 7/19 . We stayed Kalia tower of HILTON HAWAIIAN VILLAGE. Our room was 17th floor mountain side. View from my room was excellent. We could see Diamondhead from lanai and check rainbow on mountain everyday. At the 4th floor of Kalia tower There is the pool. This pool was vacant all day.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed for a week in a two-bedroom condo that was very nice and suited us well. The staff is all impeccably trained and are friendly at every turn-- whether it is the bellman, the desk clerk, or the towel guy. Seriously, they are spectacularly friendly. But, there are approximately one million guests within the Byzantine complex that includes the Grand Waikikkian sharing the pools, lagoon, services, and eateries. This, your stay becomes a series of lines and crowds to navigate. Remembering you're in paradise and that your normal fast pace won't work here is a good start to enjoying yourself.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: It was a descent place. If you don't expect too much inside the room than I wouldn't worry. Lots to do in the area, and plenty of places to eat and have fun at night. I was only there for a couple of days but enjoyed it.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great Location, Way too big and too busy to give the attention we usually experience from HGVC. Concierge staff should indicate whether they would prefer to assist American or preferred nationality. Overall, the family enjoyed the pools and lagoon. Also, lagoon tower being older, only has 3 elevators. Needs 6, you spend lots of time waiting on elevators,

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Overall this is a great property for travelers of all age groups. Every amenity is available on site including two "ABC" convenience stores. It has a town feel by the beach. We traveled with family from the age of 5 to 70 and everyone enjoyed our time in Hawaii and in particular at the resort.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Just came back from a one week stay at HHV. I stayed in a 2 bedroom unit in the Lagoon tower. we had a garden view room, which was really ocean view (ocean to my left plus city view) and diamond head to my right balcony plus city view. the accommodations were great. The pools were crowded but my kids loved them. The beach was rocky!! I was so disappointed! I would rather have stayed further down on Waikiki where the beach was nicer. The resort is HUGE and crowded, but it was a lot of fun with a lot of nice activities (canoe rentals, paddle board rentals, beach chair rentals, etc). All the staff were great. I would recommend to stay as long as you don't use the beach for swimming!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Lagoon Towers is the oldest of the HGVC towers but it is also the most spacious when compared to the Kalia Tower and Grand Waikikian Tower. The Tapa Tower, Alii Tower, and Rainbow Tower are for hotel guests, unlike the HGVC towers which are time-share properties with owners who can stay for a few days to a week or more. We love the Lagoon Towers where we have a Premier Two-Bedroom Suite, which overlooks the Duke Kahanamoku Lagoon, the Ala Wai Yacht harbor, Ala Moana Beach, and the rest of the Pacific Ocean. Although the facilities are dated, it does not detract from our vacation. But the three elevators do present challenges as there are times where we waited for 20 minutes before we could get on an elevator and at other times, it was express all the way, both going up and down. Go figure! Anyway, we usually go for a week around July 4 because of the fireworks show sponsored by the Ala Moana Shopping Center. The show is above Magic Island at Ala Moana Beach Park - it is the largest Independence Day show in the State. We have attended the show at the beach but there is just too many people and too much traffic getting out of the park, took us two hours one year. So it is just great to watch the show from on high at the Lagoon Towers. We have eaten at many of the restaurants and like to have one dinner evening at Bali Steak and Seafood - service and staff are just great, and food always onolicious! In addition, Hilton Hawaiian Village is the only Waikiki property that has a Friday night fireworks show, albeit only about 5 minutes, but it is still an event to behold!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent 12 nights at a 2bedroom plus at the lagoon tower. Prior to arrival, I had requested for a higher floor and quiet location away from the elevators. Guess what's? They stuck us on the 10th floor right across from the elevators. As Elite Premier members who own at this property, we were very unhappy. Our suite faced out to the lawn and had a full view of the parking lot where luau happened five nights a week, from 5 to well after 10 PM. I placed a call downstairs as soon as we got to our suite and realized we had a bad location. The front desk staff were oblivious, unapologetic and utterly useless. One lady I talked to told me that's the only location for this type of suite, which I think is a lie. But being that it was 11PM at night, I did not argue with her. A couple of nights during our stay, they had catering functions on the lawn and it was party full-on. Wednesday movie nights were also loud. We had two preschoolers with us on this trip, and luckily they were so tired every day they went to bed despite the racket outside. On the plus side, the location is pretty convenient. We walked to Ala Moana mall and to the main drag. Both ways about 15 minutes. The kids loved the lagoon. They were however disappointed when the pool police came and told us we could not use any floats in the pool. Don't eat at the restaurant by pool. They charge $11 for a California roll and $11 for a beer. I also got attacked by a pigeon while eating my food. We loved the other restaurants at the resorts. CJ's, Round Table Pizza, and the Japanises restaurant by the gigantic bird cage that offers half price sushi between 5-6PM. The beds were really comfortable. We only had housekeeping twice but they were very generous with the toiletries.The lagoon tower has three elevators, of which one of them was always broken. Plus they don't have a service elevator. From day two on, we had to press the elevators to go up first, then go down to the lobby. Otherwise there was no chance for the six of us all getting in. It's bit of a joke that some of their staff on the 3rd or 4th floor did not want to use the stairs and made the crowding situation worse. Anyways, that's Waikiki for you. Hot, crowded, touristy. But the kids loved it, and we had a great time inspite of these issues. Will go back next year but prob will make a very lengthy phone call to the hotel front desk first about the suite location.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent a week at Kings Land on the Big Island and one week at the Lagoon in Honolulu using our Grand Vacations Club membership. We took our entire family of 13, including grandkids and close friends in several rooms at both locations. We had a fabulous time. Often times the family would rather stay at the resort than to go site seeing around both islands. The Hilton Resorts here offer so much its easy to stay and enjoy the amenities and facilities than to drive around. This is our 5th visit to both locations.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were looking forward to spending a couple days at the Hilton Village. We stayed at Lagoona TowersThe grounds were great. There is a lot to do. However, the room was another story. The room looked like something out of the 60s. Elvis might have liked it but I found it dated. They only had three elevators for 24 floors. One elevator never worked properly, There was no freight elevator so the bellboys were constantly using the second to bring luggage up to the rooms. So there was one elevator for the rest of us. On busy times the wait could be 45 minutes. I could not use the stairs because I am handicapped. Fix your elevator!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had another wonderful stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Lagoon Tower. The room was outstanding and the resort was wonderful. Our children enjoyed the lagoon and pool so very much. The gm facility was also outstanding.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had a one bedroom suite with full kitchen and direct ocean view for 10 days. Can't imagine being in a hotel room for that period of time. The washer & dryers on each floor were great to have. The unit was very spacious and we were able to host several friends for dinner and view the Friday night fireworks. The grounds of this resort are amazing with many pools to choose from .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our 4th stay at the Grand Vacations Suites. The resort is great for families with young children with the best pools, slides, lagoon pool and onsite activities in Waikiki. The down side is that the resort is enormous and has thousands of rooms and hosts conferences (for thousands of people!). When this occurs there are people everywhere and the activity is frenzied. Poolside chairs become a premium and there are queues everywhere.The resort is also getting tired and one of the 3 lifts breaks down at least every second day so there are queues just to get to your room. Coupled with the building not having a service lift the poor housekeeping staff & bell guys also try to squeeze in to 2 lifts that service a 24 floor building - this part is outrageous.Apart from that, the suite sizes are decent with decent size kitchen, dining, living and bedrooms. Updating is definitely required with beds & carpets showing age.I have listed a lot of negatives, but must stress that in previous years our stays were great. Our daughter enjoyed kids club in previous years (when she was 5-8) and we still love Tropics Bar, the private beach, lagoon and proximity to Ala Moana shops. The crowds & age of facilities got to us this visit so I'm afraid we're ready to move on.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This time at the HGVC timeshare in HHV, I stayed at the Kalia Tower. It felt a little older than the Lagoon Tower and the 1 bedroom PLUS just felt smaller - not by much, but it may just be the lay-out. I was not up-front (as far as the ocean and the view) but at the back of the HHV facility. I didn't spend as much time enjoying the entire facility as I had in April at Lagoon Tower. The staff seemed to be more friendly but that may be because Lagoon Tower was undergoing a lobby and elevator renovations then. Overall the 9-day stay was perfect and the only disappointment that I had was that my Wi-Fi went down one day but as soon as the tech worked on it the Wi-Fi just flew. The facility is always fun to be in and there is plenty to do without even leaving the premises. Even if you do leave there are plenty of restaurants, beaches and malls adjacent to the premises on both sides. To the west there is the Ala Moana Mall and the Ala Moana Beach Park with restaurants galore on Ala Moana Blvd. To the east there is Fort DeRussey museum beach and the Beachwalk with more restaurants and the Royal Hawaiian Shopping Center plus the remainder of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My husband is a Diamond member and upon check in we were told you pretty much get what you book when it comes to HGVC so don't even think about complimentary upgrades no matter what your Hhonors status is! You do however receive 2 complimentary bottles of H20 and 2000 bonus Hhonors points. Now about the Kalia tower. It is definitely the furthest tower from the beach but the closest tower to the parking structure. There is a Starbucks on the ground floor and has its own gym, pool & spa. The recently renovated accommodations were perfect for my family of 3. We reserved the 1 Bedroom Mountain View Suite (w/ sofa bed, full kitchen, 1 bathroom) and received exactly that. It was modern and had unworn furniture. Next time I would definitely pay the extra $$ to get an ocean view since we are in Hawaii. The gym was fairly small for the size of the tower but has all the cardio and weight equipment one would need. But if you're a runner, don't bother w/ the gym, there's a great running path on the strand. The pool seemed empty whenever I passed by it on my way to the gym but was open fairly early if you need to get towels. Housekeeping is daily and did a good job despite the fact that I forgot to tip them one day :(This is my 2nd trip to the HHV and my 1st was at the Ali'i Tower (see my review) which I prefer over the Kalia but obviously more $$. Also, by booking w/ HGVC you don't pay the $30 daily resort fee like you do w/ Ali'i. However, at the time I made the booking it was Kalia @ $389/night or Ali'i @ $750+$30 resort fee/night. Back in December the Ali'i was only $450+30/night.I found the beach area closest to the lagoon to be better since it tends to be more rocky once you go past the dock. Beware that when renting equipment at the lagoon, you can only use them @ the lagoon. So if you are looking to go in the ocean be sure to rent from the vendors near the park @ Hale Koa.Food @ HHV was just okay, definitely not gourmet. Although it will be expensive wherever you go, you have more options elsewhere literally w/in walking distance. Do venture out!!!I would still definitely return to the HHV.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After reading comments about the Lagoon Tower, I was somewhat hesitant to come. This was especially true when were checking in and we were given the number to maintenance ( in case there were problems!)We were pleasantly surprised that there were no issues during our 10 day stay. Our room appeared to be clean. Comfortable bedsThe only things that you could say were negative were the outdated carpeting/furniture and the tower only having 3 elevators. On a couple days one was out of order, which made things more frustrating. As we were on the 6th floor, we ended up just using the stairs to save time.All staff were friendly and helpful The grounds were well kept.We found prices for restaurants and shopping a "bit more reasonable" outside the village. Either way, expect to spend $$$$$$

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Older building and definitely due for some renovations, but if you're staying in Waikiki, the Lagoon Tower rooms are some of the most spacious rooms you can't get. It's great for families that like to keep dining costs lower by buying groceries and eating in the room. Proximity to the beach and pools are key. The valet is much improved over the last few years and getting in and out of the hotel is much easier than the snarling traffic through the main part of the Hilton Hawaiian Village, where stretch limos block roads for no good reason other than they're too long.The elevators are slow and often so crowded that you may have to wait for another car or two during peak times. The building used to be residential years ago so it doesn't have a service elevator. Housekeeping and other staff use the same elevators, and oftentimes I wonder if their frustration with waiting for an elevator exceeds the guests. But...whatever...you're on vacation. Take a chill pill and roll with it. It is a little annoying that some guests are unaware of the etiquette of queuing for a lift. Some guests make a beeline for any open door even when there is an obvious line in the lobby. Those who do that seem to be older, so I suspect it's a cultural thing that they expect to go first based on seniority. Lagoon Tower is the best solution for my family when we travel to Honolulu. When staying here, it's like having one foot in and one out of Waikiki. You don't have to deal with much of the Waikiki traffic, but you're still central.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent location and facilities. Everything from beach to food to shopping is nearby. However, the early check out and late check in time is always a drag for international jet lagged travelers. Really need to beef up the housekeeping efficiency. Otherwise, after the first day, which is usually wasted, the rest is all so nice...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enjoyed staying here. Great view from room facing water. Option of pools, lagoon or ocean for swimming. Cleaning staff very helpful. Fireworks display on Friday is fantastic. Would highly recommend and definitely stay again when in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enjoyed having a full kitchen and washer/dryer. If it wasn't for those amenities probably wouldn't like it as much. Service and cleanliness ok. I would probably stay here again depending on rate and room type.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
