review_body: Beautiful place.Staff is excellent.If you like Waikiki you will love this place. Land os next to beach and is on I believe 30 acres. Has everything and is definitely Hilton quality all the way. Rooms and Hotel lovely and well kept.Expensive but good. Not far away from anything. Great vacation

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I have been members of the HGVC Lagoon Tower since it was renovated in 2000. We have always loved the location and the rooms and looked forward to spending two weeks. This year we arrived in mid May and found everything to our liking in the room we had except for a sticking front door that didn't always close securely. This was mentioned to Maintenance, but the problem was not taken care of. In the middle of our second week, our room was burgled while we were on the lanai and some beach items were stolen. Either the door did not lock securely due to the sticking problem or someone used a card key to get in the room. Luckily our ID, money and jewelry were in the room safe. We immediately called Hilton security and they called the Honolulu police to investigate. A report was taken, but no suspects were identified and since there are no surveillance cameras in the hallways, elevators or stairwells there was no way to determine who may have burgled our room and there was little chance of solving the case. This invasion of our privacy so upset us that we cut our trip short by 4 days and returned home even though we love the Islands. I strongly recommend that the Management of the Lagoon Tower consider installing some security surveillance cameras to help ID burglers in the future because I am sure that there will be future burglaries. Although the Lagoon Tower is our home resort and we have always considered it the place that we want to stay when we go to Hawaii, we are now not sure if, or when, we will return. The burglary has destroyed a cherished remembrance of ours of Hawaii. I considered not writing this review, but decided to do it, because there is a security problem at the Lagoon and it needs to be addressed.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We chose to stay at the Lagoon Tower Ocean view. We're very near the paradise pool with the slides. Im so happy we stayed here. Honestly the hilton hawaiian village is the best resort in waikiki when you have kids. This suite comes with a full kitchen, so anytime they're hungry, you can just whip up something. It saves a lot of money too. The staff are so friendly. Love them. There are times, im too in a hurry to clean up the pans, they'll do it. Sheets are changed. Its so clean, so worth it. The room is so spacious. Sofa bed for kids is a Full, so big enough for toddlers. Best 6 days!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: August 2014 Trip. Family of four 2 adults 2 children. Stayed for 9 nights/ 3 nights lagoon tower 6 nights grand waikikian both 1 bdrms. Rooms: lagoon tower was spacious however grand waikikian was considerably smaller and lacked the views the lagoon tower had. Although the grand waikian is a newer building with in room laundry we prefered lagoon tower for room size, view, and location in the resort. Amenities: pool area with slide was extremely crowded with not enough lounge chairs for guests and the pool itself was small considering that this is the pool that most families would be attracted to. When on vacation I dont mind paying a premium price for poolside lunches however most of the food (pronto pickle) was premade and not good. We are Marriott Vacation Club Owners and DVC Owners and we find that their poolside food is expensive but very good so we don't mind paying the extra. Most resort activities were extremely overpriced and if you just walked down the beach other resorts / beach services could be had for a considerably cheaper price. We did alot of sightseeing on this trip so several days were spent away from the resort and the one positive was coming home to a well appointed condo type room. We are returning to oahu next year and will be staying down the street at the outrigger.(like location /dining etc) We feel that the hilton hawaiian village is overpriced in regards to amenites /food vs quality and would not stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We did the same trip last year but a bit earlrier, 5 days on Oahu at the Hilton Grand Wakikian, did it on points and booked a 2 bedroom premier room, we were on the 24th floor and the views was great! It's a great place to stay while on Oahu, has all the amenitites one would want. Rooms were appointed very nicely, then were off to Hawaii staying at the Hilton Kings Land! A great 2 weeks!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Just got back. Had to leave early due to Hurrican Ana. Will definitely return. The employees are very nice and willing to help. Very enjoyable week. We enjoyed all the shopping and restaurants in the village.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Location location location. Enjoyed the lagoon tower and the public meter parking across the street. Got a bit of walking every night as I dropped off family and guests at the lobby. I was lucky to get a full week stay as some days became available from others that canceled. Did not get a view of the lagoon this time but still enjoyed the 2 bdrm unit w friends. We did several sight seeing adventures together and always appreciated settling down for the evening at our unit. It was very hot for this time of the year but we had the beaches and pool just a few steps away. Only negative vibe was the remodeling facelift in progress. We were not made aware of prior to our booking but still worthwhile memories.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great experience. Very helpful staff throughout resort. Good location for walking in and around Waikiki. Beautiful Resort. Pool areas are beautiful but need some more shaded areas for people who do not want to sit in sun all day. Stayed in Lagoon Tower 2 bedroom unit- excellent accommodation and beautiful view!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at this resort many times. Great location - well done. Staff is great. The main pool areas don't have enough seating and with adding another tower, you can expect the "green ares" and pool areas to be even more crowded. They introduced a new system to keep people from holding pool chairs all day - but it doesn't work when they don't actually use the program.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at the Lagoon Tower. Very courteous staff. Clean room. Grateful for the kitchen. Loved being able to walk to restaurants and the ABC Store (stocked with any item you may need in a pinch like water, milk, bread, macadamia nuts, etc.) Kids loved the lagoon and the koi pond. Loved that we could call guest services and they would reply to any and all needs. But tipping the delivery person each time we found something missing got annoying. I understand not stocking every kitchen with a cookie sheet, but a spatula? Housekeeping left us with only the toilet paper on the holders and didn't restock dishwashing detergent or paper towels. And what hotel these days doesn't have an ice machine? (Unfortunately, the ice maker in the freezer uses the same distasteful, unfiltered water that comes out of the tap.) The pools are all in the shade...so they are cold most of the day until the sun peaks around the buildings. The evenings are LOUD. We tried to stay on San Diego time (3 hours earlier). With the rooftop luau happening next door most nights, the outdoor band playing at the restaurant bar, and the "movie on the lawn" replaying after it ended (the first time) at 8pm, it was hard to get to sleep. The back-up beepers on the tour buses and delivery trucks at 3,4,and5am were a lot of fun to try and tune out too! Not a bad vacation, just not ideal. The place is nice. The location is great if you are looking for a busy week and lots of nightlife. If you are looking for a relaxing week of quiet and don't mind calling guest services every day with another request of something that should be available, but isn't, then you'll really enjoy this place. Oh, and the "free" DVD that came with our stay was so scratched, it wasn't even watchable. I don't know that we'd stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We loved the hotel for where it was as close to beach area. Our room didn't have a view of the ocean as we had requested but other than that we enjoyed the place. We used the travel people to handle the tours and everything went good and the guides were very knowledgeable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at the Lagoon Tower and could not have been happier. Great ocean view and view of the Great Lawn and the lagoon. The room was very clean, plenty of room. Plenty of supplies. Nice bath. Convenient to everything. The entire village is located on the beach and there is plenty to do every day. I would definitely stay here again!! Highly recommend.There is a fee for parking in the garage, but it is convenient and there is plenty of space. You can come in and go as you please.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was my second stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and I can't wait to visit again. The atmosphere is very inviting. The pool area, beach & lagoon were great. We tried the restaurant and were pleasantly surprised. The resort is conveniently located so you can walk to many other restaurants and even the Ala Moana Shopping Center. We have only good things to say about our accommodations!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The two bedroom unit was very nice and spacious with a spectacular view of the ocean. It was our first time staying at the Lagoon Tower and we enjoyed it. The Lagoon Tower is located very close the pools and the ocean for easy access.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hotel did not meet expectations of a Hilton property! The smoke detector was beeping upon arrival. There was no room service... Excuse given... we had to be staying a minimum of seven days. The interior decor is outdated... like something from the 60s vice a resort. Elevator wait times exceeded seven minutes... at times I took the stairs when I got tired of waiting.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family stayed in the Lagoon Tower. It is closest to the paradise pool and the lagoon, but the rooms are outdated. There is no restaurant, convenience store, or fitness center in the building, and we have to share the laundry with the same floor. There are stores and restaurants within Hilton village so it is not a big issue. The Grand Waikikian tower is more luxurious with in-room laundry. Fireworks on Friday evening are awesome. The lagoon is fun but the rental fees for gears and water sports are way too expensive. Overall Hilton is good place to stay and it is away from the more crowded Waikiki beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: 1 bedroom unit was spacious, beautiful and quiet with great views! Coming back! A bit out of our normal budget but worthwhile in the end. Have stayed at 2 other towers in the Hilton Village Resort. Which have all been very good but the Grand Vacation Suites far superior. WE booked this being the only room available and SO VERY GLAD we did!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our family of four stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village for a week in August. Everything about our stay was perfect! Our suite was huge, clean, quiet and an awesome location. Not too close to the beach and not too far, but with a beautiful ocean view. The pools were crowded, but there was plenty of room at the beach and lagoon. Housekeeping was attentive and thorough and hotel staff were extremely helpful. Looking forward to returning next year!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just spent a week at the HHV and LOVED our experience. We stayed on the 21st floor on the resort side and our room was CLEAN, spacious and the bed was VERY comfortable. The linens were quite nice too. Even being in a "resort view" room, when standing on the lanai, you can see the ocean and Diamond Head. At night, with the light sparkling, the city was beautiful and we could sit on the lanai and watch the sunrise in paradise!!After reading a few other reviews regarding stays at the HHV in Aug. 2014, I'm surprised by the comments regarding the following: *Japanese overrunning the resort - while there WERE many Asians, I did not find that they were "overtaking" the resort as Pam S stated. Of course, I was in paradise and didn't mind sharing the experience with everyone!*Overcrowding in restaurants, pools and elevators - we never had to wait for an elevator for long and only once was the elevator so full we waited for a second one. Of course, we were in the Kalia Tower and not the Lagoon Tower so maybe that made a difference. We totally LOVED our experience with the Kalia Tower. I believe it had been remodeled recently and the Lagoon Tower is due for its facelift next year...Tapa Tower is going through theirs currently, I think. I could be wrong. Our pool, on the 4th floor, was not crowded, there were PLENTY of lounge chairs, and it was very clean. We ate at the Tropics 3 different days at different times and NEVER had to wait for a table. We ate outside next to the beach each time.*Check-in being slow - we arrived after 9pm and there wasn't much of a wait at all. We used their valet service and our bags were brought to our room within minutes. Our tower had its own check-in/check-out but we didn't know that until we checked in through the main lobby.We all agreed that we'd stay there again on a future visit and it was WELL worth the price paid. Having all those pools, the lagoon, the ocean, all the restaurants and 90+ stores to shop, all on the resort grounds, made for an amazing vacation. Additionally, all the places that are within a short walk...we went for breakfast at IHOP, Eggs & Things (twice) and one other place close by that was featured in Hawaii Five-0. We ate at the Tropics Bar & Grill 3 different times...I'm obsessed with their Kalua Pork Nachos...OMG they were so good. So good that we are planning on making them Labor Day weekend...we bought some Alaea sea salt, hickory liquid smoke and banana leaves. They'll never taste as good as they did while in Hawaii though.Friday night fireworks were a great way to start the weekend! They were pretty good too for being a weekly feature!To sum up our stay: good food, good shopping, good accommodations = GREAT VACATION at Hilton Hawaiian Village. We will recommend HHV to all our friends and families and we WILL be back!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were extremely disappointed in our stay at the HGVC - Lagoon Tower. Unless you are a Japanese tourist, stay away! This property which was once a great place to stay with a family, has completely been overtaken by Japanese tour groups. The lobby, elevators, restaurants, pools, were way overcrowded which was not helped by the fact that there was loud construction during our stay, including the main lobby. The furnishings, decor and overall room conditions in the Lagoon tower were completely substandard. After staying at Grand Hyatt in Kauai, the Lagoon Tower was like staying at a Motel 6. The pool area (Paradise Pool) was a complete joke - there were absolutely no chairs available and the pool had way too many people in it to even enjoy oneself. Waikiki overall seems dirtier than what I recall and homeless issue clearly has created an unsafe tone. Tropics Restaurant was only brightspot, while expensive, it was good and good service. Honestly, we could not wait to leave to go home!! Go to Kauai or Maui instead and don't even bother with Oahu.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is an amazing place to stay!!! There's so much thats special about it that it is too hard to pick anything in particular to brag about! We stayed here in July and didn't want to leave! It is a big and busy place so be prepared for that, but its safe and clean and kids are welcome there. I want to go back there someday and enjoy the luxury that is there. The only disappointment was having to go home.... The staff are all very friendly too....

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stay at this vacation club hotel with our family of four every Spring break and we love it! It is an oasis at the best location in Waikiki. The Hilton Hawaiian Village is comprised of multiple hotel towers and vacation suite towers that share several pools and spas. My kids like the salt water lagoon where they are able to SUP, kayak, or just lay in the sand. The rentals are a bit on the pricey side, but so is everything else in Hawaii. The hotel suites are comfortable for a family of four. We like having the two bedroom unit with two full bathrooms, a living room, and kitchen. It gives us the option of eating in for some meals. When we don't feel like cooking, there are multiple snack bars and restaurants right on property. A big plus for this hotel is that it is located walking distance to other Waikiki attractions and shopping. The two main drawbacks for this hotel is that it gets very crowded especially during holiday weeks and that the Lagoon tower elevators can be a bit slow accommodating the large crowds. For our family, that's a small price to pay for staying at such a great vacation club and location.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have the HGVC ownership and stayed in lagoon tower this year. Our two-bedroom unit was nice clean and comfortable. I have no issues with the property itself. It is located on the beach and has a salt water lagoon which our kids enjoyed. The equipment rentals are pricy though.This part of the beach is not that nice. There are construction pebbles/ stones right on the water. The food is average, but you get a lots of variety. We ended up buying the groceries from ABC store which is located in the Village itself, and cooking our meals for some days.The check-in staff was not friendly but worked efficiently to check us in. The Concierge staff is however very PUSHY on getting you to attend their timeshare presentation. Their one and only aim is to get you to attend their presentation. They are not helpful at all for any other questions you might have.I also found the salt water lagoon very marshy and stinky. Expected it to be very clean, but it is not. There are other better located property on the beach, such as Surfrider, which you should consider seriously as it is located in the much nicer part of the beach. I had heard bad feedback about their Luau, so we did see that, instead went to a show in Maui which was much nicer. Luau here is very loud and is on top of the parking lot. You hear cacophony during Luau show, so I recommend leaving hotel property around that time and find something worthwhile to do outside.I may probably stay here again as we got to make use of our timeshare.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had just spent a week in Kauai and made a 3-night stop in Honolulu on the way back to San Francisco. As HGVC members we were able to use points to book a Premium 2-Bedroom Suite in the Lagoon Tower. This was our second stay. We had done this previously as well on a trip to the Big Island with a break in Honolulu on the way back. The check-in experience was decent and we were able to get to our room pretty quick.We were not disappointed. The unit was overlooking to lagoon and had full ocean front view with two balconies. We were on the 10th floor, and being just a few days after July 4th, had the front seat views of the Friday Fireworks in the evening. When we arrived we ate outdoors at the Tropics Bar with nice views of Waikiki Beach. Our kids are in their late teens and had plenty to do exploring the Hilton Hawaiian Village properties. My wife and daughter had spa treatments at the Mandara Spa, while my son and I rented an Ocean Kayak and got out into the Waikiki waters. It was all good. The Tropics bar is my new favorite.There are many pools to choose from, and quite a few restaurants. We had breakfast out on our balconies. Since I had a car I decided to go get Pizza for our Fireworks Friday night balcony viewing from Papa Johns that was about a mile away. Foodland is not too far either and became a place to pickup ready-made sandwiches for our hike up the Diamond Head Crater that we did the next day. My wife and daughter spent a few hours shopping in the retail area and my son got a small dancing hula girl dashboard ornament.We did the obligatory HGVC timeshare viewing. It was good and informative. We found out that certain less than popular time slots were being given $150 Hilton Hawaiian Dollars to be spent onsite. We took one of those and got refreshed on all there is to know about timeshares.We had dinner at the Bali Steak and Seafood Restaurant. While the food was good, the seating and table location etc. was less than ideal. the manager was not willing at all to consider re-seating us. Given the really high prices, I was hoping for a better experience.All in all a good visit. We still love coming back to Hilton Hawaiian Village and will continue to make it a family stop when we are visiting Hawaii

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The elevators are so SLOW in the Lagoon Tower. TO many people for the small pool you have. Concierge didn't speak very good english and Hawaii is a US state. Not enough toilette paper was given for the two bed room condo we had for a week. Plus the guy that cleaned our room didn't speak ENGLISH either. Very disappointed with the staff and the amount of English they spoke. WAY TO CROWED of an are for a Hilton hotel in my opinion. I would not stay at this location with Hilton again unless some serious changes took place. The room was nice and so was the view but it took forever to get to the room. Took to long to get towels at the beach area. We waited for over 10 min. My overall experience of this property I would not go back.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stayed at the Lagoon tower in a 1 bedroom/1 bath unit. Very nice and at the end of the busy section of Waikiki. If you have not been to Waikiki, expect a lot of crowds. Similar to Vegas, but without casinos and with a beach. The unit was very beautifully decorated and very modern, with granite counter tops on kitchen and bathroom. Nice balcony overlooking the lagoon and the beach with a table and four chairs. Beautiful furniture all around. The area outside the hotel is very busy as this is part of a 5 unit complex owned by Hilton and there is always a lot of traffic of folks trying to register at all hours of the day. The only two areas of improvement are the parking with a staggering $27/day and the other item is that there are only 3 elevators to service 28 floors. At times trying to get up or down floor can take 20 minutes just waiting for an elevator.As for parking you can park in the public parking at the beach which is within walking distance for only $12 per day.We enjoyed our stay and will definitely recommend this place.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village Resort is a world-class vacation destination that is centrally located in the heart of Waikiki and offers excellent amenities; from water sports, pools and spas, beaches; great restaurants,shops and entertainment, particularly the Luau and fireworks display, first-class customer service that makes your visit most welcome and memorable. I highly recommend this resort to travellers going to the Island of Oahu.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very well maintained and run property. Cant beat the locations. But do not count on the Concierge to provide you with any help! They simply do not listen to what YOU want, and have some pre assigned places and activities THEY want to sell you. Roy

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There were 18 of us on a family holiday including 10 children under 10. We were very pleased with our stay at the HVS. We stayed in the lagoon tower at the vacation suites.. The pools were great, but we had most use from the lagoon and the beach in front of the hotel all of where very clean.. Quite pricey to hire the water toys around the lagoon. We were lucky to be given lots of blow up water toys for the kids by guests that were leaving the resort the day we arrived. Overall a very enjoyable and relaxing week in Honolulu Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is a wonderful place to visit. You several different places to stay on the village. The best room we have ever had was a diamond head corner room. It had two lanais, one facing the ocean the other Diamond Head. There are fireworks every Friday night and they are shot right outside your room. Very impressive. The place is clean and has numerous places to eat. If you are a Hawaii 5-0 fan this is where it is filmed

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I just spent 7 nights at the Hilton Grand "Lagoon" Tower in Waikiki. It was great and the accommodations were super. The young staff that helped with beach rentals always went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed and very personable young men. If you are looking for a great place to go with family and friends -- this is it.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I'm writing this review from the balcony of my 2-bedroom apartment in the Lagoon Tower which I purchased via VRBO for a great price! It is just paradise and our family of 4 (20 year old and 18 year old with Mum and Dad) are having a fantastic time. Enough room for us all to spread out. Apartment is spacious with a queen bed in main bedroom and 2 x doubles in 2nd room, plus large balcony, full size kitchen and lounge area. A knowledgable and experienced staff have made us very welcome and helped organise activities. Yes, it is a busy place but the hotel is obviously used to the resort being full and service is not compromised. We have been able to attend all the hotel's activities that we have wanted - hula aerobics was fun. A big village but guests well catered for..... Off for a happy hour cocktail now ...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location. Thought it was crowded until we visited the other end of Waikiki. Hilton was less densley populated. Our children were older and really enjoyed the lagoon and beach area. Friday night fireworks were right off our balcony. Short but amazing!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just got back from 8 nights at the HGVC in the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Love the place, been there over 10 times in the last 8 years. This time was the worst; we got our one cleaning on the second day there, that left 6 days of having to call for dry towels, new rolls of toilet paper and not getting new dish soap, even though the bottle was half-empty. We are not dirty people but with the sand and traveling with two children, things get dirty. If you're not able to clean, provide a vacuum cleaner in the room. I think with all the money they made selling all those units they could afford to offer cleaning every other day at least. The other thing, they shut down the store in the Lagoon tower and they have the store open in the Grand Waikikian, but talk about robbery, the prices there are ridicules. The ABC store nearby is a little better but not much. I appreciate wanting to make a profit but common, I bought three Cokes and a bottle of water and it was $20, stupid me!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were on the 22nd floor of the Lagoon tower and it was perfect. The view of Diamond Head and the Ocean were breathtaking. Beds were comfortable. The furniture is aged slightly but no big deal. Try the pizza downstairs from the tower it's not bad and not expensive. Great place to stay at.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Service at this facility IS simply outstanding! Honestly, each day we were greeted with smiles and warm alohas! The staff was very attentative to our needs, and the room was certainly more than adequate, despite some of the reviews I've read about the Lagoon Tower. We've been HGVC owners for almost 10 years now, and we consider ourselves to be pretty picky when it comes to hotels. We would come back to the Lagoon Tower in a heartbeat! Don't let the negative reviews scare you! Great stay, excellent location, impeccable service!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have stayed in many of Waikikis hotels over the last 40 years. The Grand Waikikian is by far the best place to stay in Waikiki. Its on the Beach and Lagoon. The convenience of a fully equipped condo with washer and dryer with all the amenities of th e 5 star Hilton hotel made this stay most enjoyable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After being at Aulani in a room for 4 days, we all liked this much better. One bedroom for hubby and I and pull out sofa for teenager, and chair with ottoman as a bed for small child. I never saw a bug while I was there! The patio was spacious and nice table for 4. Bed very comfy and nice down comforter. 2 flat screens. Access to free washer and dryer on every floor, which was never busy. Nice to have kitchen to reheat leftover restaurant food (LOL). Very clean, great service, and even scored a 2 hr later checkout after having to beg a little bit as they are booked 100% year round, as our flight was at 10pm. Liked Tropics for breakfast, a short walk. Italian restaurant AMAZING. Roundtable Pizza great to pick up and bring back to room (5 min walk). Nice shopping all around, kids enjoyed pools with slide, and we rented paddle board at the lagoon. Only downside SO CROWDED AND COULD NOT GET A POOL CHAIR, and you have to RENT lounges and umbrellas for beach and lagoon, cost for 2 chairs and 1 umbrella $68 for the day. That is lame. Bathroom very small and decorating a bit dated, but overall GREAT EXPERIENCE.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful resort. Staff was very friendly and the room was large and comfortable. Pool areas were too small and overcrowded. Stood in line for 20 minutes at the pool snack bar, finally gave up. The lagoon area was nice but you had to rent chairs and umbrellas. Overall we had a nice stay however it was just too busy to truly relax and enjoy Hawaii

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: But we probably would not stay here again. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment on the 3rd floor of the lagoon tower which overlooked the lagoon. Beautiful view, especially of the Friday night fireworks. The room was kept immaculately clean by the maids each day. But the rooms were noisy in that we could hear everything that happened outside in the mornings - kids running around, cars and busses coming and going. The beds and pillows were comfy though. The hotel staff were fabulous and very accommodating. The hotel grounds are beautiful, but we chose to stay here because of the pools it boasted. The pools really aren't THAT BIG and when they're full to the brim with other people you aren't that keen. The lagoon looks great in photos, and it was nice, but it's cold and kinda smells a bit weird. The ocean on Waikiki beach is AMAZINGGGGGG! Once we spent some time in the ocean, we didn't go back in the pool or lagoon again. The ocean is warmer than the pools or lagoon, and renting long boards etc down on Waikiki beach is cheaper than at the Hilton. It's a slight walk to get to the main shopping drag and other bars/restaurants. The Hilton is the closest hotel to Ala Moana mall though, a short walk. But you can get a bus from further down for $2.The Hilton is great for families, but next time we will be using air BNB or staying at one of the other many hotels closer to the main Waikiki beach.Make sure you make reservations at the restaurants, you can't just turn up....you'll be given a beeper and sent away for 40 minutes.....not just at Hilton Hawaiian Village, but most restaurants and bars in town. The hawaiian pizza at Round Table pizza is yummy....and The ABC stores on property are great for drinks and snacks.We use Air BNB to find our apartment for the second week, which we cannot speak highly enough of and definitely recommend to families who are seeking more than just a hotel room, for a fraction of the price of most hotel rooms in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Currently staying at in a one bedroom suite in the lagoon tower with our two children, one of whom still requires a high chair to eat safely at the table. We arrived on Tuesday and immediately phoned guest services who advised that high chairs are only provided in resort restaurants! We escalated our concerns to the duty manager who advised "he would sort something out the following day." We never heard back and on phoning again we were advised that they would need to hire one and asked us to contribute fifty dollars towards the cost of this. They explained it was a "liability issue" - surely it's a greater liability not to provide a high chair? We have a kitchen, a cooker, a table, four adult chairs and the only way to feed our baby is either on our knee or on the floor. On Wednesday we asked to speak to the general manager, needless to say, neither the general manager or the assistant general manager have called. They were both busy in 'meetings.' However, we did get a voicemail message stating no high chair would be provided by the resort! Clearly only a family resort if you are prepared to eat breakfast, lunch and dinner in the resort restaurants! If you intend to feed your baby in your suite, please be aware of this risk and liability issue - you may want to stop at walmart on your way here, where you can buy a booster seat.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We've been Owners @ HGVC for 10 yrs. & are very pleased with the quality,cleanliness,service & location of the resort. The resort is beautiful,our only concern is the size of the pools -they are too small to accommodate the number of guests.The beach is beautiful & clean ,but is also becoming more crowded.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at the Lagoon tower in a two bedroom suite. This is the only way to go. The suites are all updated and very comfortable. The location is superb in that it is only steps from the ocean, the lagoon and a super pool with great slides for the kids. The restaurants on property all serve excellent food. The location is within walking distance of the large shopping center or next to the bus line that will take you anywhere on the island. Thoroughly enjoyed this vacation due in large part to the accommodations.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The disappointing start was simply that checking in was difficult due to the confusion of which location you must check in at, do I check in at the main location or the Lagoon location, sadly the bellmen sent us in circles because they were obviously unsure. Also, unfortunately the hotel reservations we made 6 months earlier were messed up, we ended up getting placed in a low grade room paying twice what the room was worth. Excellent recovery in that the hotel management and the concierge team did an excellent job in correcting the reservation issue by upgrading us to a room of better quality than the one we had originally booked at no additional cost. Side notes. The room service food is not worth the price or the time, the Rainbow Lanai has the best breakfast buffet I have ever experienced. The concierge staff is knowledgeable and extremely helpful in coordinating any and all vacation needs. Closing note. While disappointed at first the stay at this hotel was impressive and helped to create a honeymoon that neither my wife or I will ever forget!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed from June 12th thru the 17th on the 22nd floor of the Lagoon Tower. The room was perfect for a family of four with a full kitchen, 1 bedroom and a sleeper sofa for the 2 teenage girls. Yes, the property is very busy and there are a lot of people but there is something for everyone and the resort is in close proximity to other shopping and dining that you can walk to in a very short time/distance. Every single person we encountered at the Hilton (check in, maid service, concierge, bell man, hospitality suite, etc.) were all extremely friendly and accommodating. We also appreciated the use of the hospitality suite prior to our late departure. I would definitely recommend the use of the Hilton's concierge service as they helped us book a helicopter ride, shuttle service, Luau, rental car, dining, etc.. RJ was the concierge person who took care of our family during our stay. Thanks again. My family and I will definitely return again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We paid $1800 for a 7-nights-8-days hotel package Hilton Grand Vacation 2-bedrooms suite at Lagoon Tower at Honolulu, via a HGV promotion. Our vacation was 5/21/2014 - 5/28/2014The Hilton stay experience is certainly above 3 stars but also not stars. Thus 4 starsPros:- Price is good, because it is located in Honolulu downtown and next to Waikiki beach. Four adults can sleep in the two bedrooms suite. ($1800/7/2) = $128 per couple. Two more adults can sleep in the sofa in the living room. Perfect for a family of 6 at this price. If we have to pay regular price next time, we want to try other hotels.- Fully furnished kitchen with blender and a rice cooker (because of plenty of Japanese tourists). We prepared our breakfast every morning, saved money.- Two bedroom suite is big; hotel comes with free laundry at each floor- Next to Waikiki Beach- Inland "Beach": perfect for kids and elders who want to swim safe and still enjoy beach experience- Near downtown with plenty of restaurants around within walking distanceCons:- I do not understand why bathroom does not have vent ...- The AC in our room was loud- The wait time for the three hotel elevators is horrible; its software program algorithm needs to be updated to serve hotel guests from 20 floors in the least amount of time- parking is expensive; $25 self-parking per dayNote: HGV standard: there is a mandatory $7.5 per day hotel clean-up fee even though they don't clean up our rooms daily.1. Would we come back to Honolulu again? Certainly.2. Did we have a great time at Honolulu, Oahu? Certainly.3. Did we rent a car? We did. Car rental is cheap ($170 for 8 days); car parking is not4. Would we stay at Hilton Grand Vacation Suite again? Probably not. However, HGV will be a great choice when a group of at least 6 people, or with kids and/or elders, because of kitchen and inland "beach"Next: review restaurants at Honolulu, Oahu ...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: we booked a premier room in lagoon tower. we were put on fourth floor right above pool. very noisy, we called to ask for another room and they said no sorry. then the next day construction started the floor below us, my husband asked for another room again, they quickly said sorry you should have known about construction (was not on HGVC website) then the next two nights they cut the palm trees at 9pm - right at our window level. we asked to change rooms everyday, always quickly told sorry we can't help you. we have been owners with hilton grand vacation club for 15 years. we have never experienced such an UN grand HORRIBLE vacation. place was over CROWDED, lagoon was like cement. won't ever go back. Thankfully our second week we went to maui stayed at The Kaanapali Beach Club by Diamond Resorts which was amazing...wish we owned there.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in the Lagoon Tower June 13-19. The room was nice with a fully equipped kitchen and good amenities ie... Free Wifi, PS3, Cable Television, Ocean View. My family enjoyed all of the amenities and the property. No real complaints. Id been there before and I knew what to expect from the area. Otherwise a good stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great access to the beach with multiple pools and a lagoon with water equipment available for rent; surf boards, kayaks, paddle boats. Plenty to do in a very family friendly atmosphere. Experienced some problems with the room, but for the most part these were addressed fairly quickly. It would be nice to have a little more cookware in the kitchen. You have to get creative to actually prepare a meal. A wide variety of shops, restaurants, and activities to fit almost any taste.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are HGV owners and found this to be one of the worst properties we've ever stayed at. It was extremely over-crowded. The beach was substandard. It felt like someone crushed up sea shells and scattered them on a bed of concrete. It was painful to walk on the sand without shoes. There were never any chairs available at the pools unless you were willing to get there before 7am. Parking rates were exorbitant. Family activities were non-existent. There were hairs from the previous guest in the shower curtain and on the bathroom floor.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We arrived at our hotel on a Monday at 2:00pm. Our room wasn't ready and we were told at the counter that it would be ready at the latest 4:00pm. We were told they would text us when the room was ready. So we called the front desk at around 3:30pm and were told it was ready plus she apologized for not notifying us. On our way back from picking up groceries and plus other stuff we arrived to our room without incident, however, the dinner table was very sticky and needed to be wiped. Another thing is if you are a HGVC member get your Gold Hilton Experience Card ASAP (I wish we were told that!). You can get 25% off at Dairy Queen and tons of discounts at other places. Also DO NOT trust what brochure says on what discounts you will get. Just use the Gold Hilton Experience card you MAY get a much better discount then you expected!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was the 5th time we stayed at the Lagoon Tower. It is always one of our favorite parts or our vacation. The staff and rooms are wonderful and being on the Hilton Hawaiian Village grounds is a added touch. There is not a nicer Resort on Oahu then the Hilton Hawaiian Village.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: A valve of our bath tub was broken during our stay. Please check other rooms. There were only two staffs in the registration desks. It took a lot of times both for check-in time and for reserving room keys.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent resort to stay at while in Hawaii. Friendly and helpful staff. We did stay in the Lagoon Tower which are time share units. We had a late flight out and as an added bonus we were given a Hospitality Room to use to change and take showers in before we headed to the airport. Very nice

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I really love this location and am very happy when I visit I book a low floor room so i can feel like I am on the beach lagoon -- plus can skip the elevators and walk up and down --- its faster and good exercise

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family stayed here for a week and it was lovely. We had a great view from our balconies and the suite was very clean and the sheets very soft. The downsides are-you can hear the pitter patter of little feet from the rooms above as well as chairs scraping across the floor, etc. The beds are a bit wobbly and the internet access is touch and go. When you stay here you want an ocean view or partial view for sure. Otherwise, you will be above a busy road with traffic morning, noon and night. We could see a Luau from our room every evening and it was such fun to watch the dancing and hear the storytelling of the history of the Islands. (Minus the buffet) I agree with another reviewer that the furniture in these Suites is looking tired and dated. Time to renovate!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Good clean hotel ..was able to go shopping for food for the week and cook when wanted ..had valet parking thanks to brother in law ..I guess that was the only thing that wasn't cool ...the pay to park part..

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: For the Price They Should Have Better Furniture. The place needed up to date furniture. The picture online i saw looked nothing like the room at all. The pool area was very small. But the slide was alot of fun.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My husband and Ihave been here several times and we booked this trip 14 months in advance on an RCI exchange and were not disapppinted after the long wait. We arrived early (1PM) before check in time (4PM) and our baggage was stored with the bellman by the staff. We were given a pager and invited to explore the property or get a bite to eat. We were also advised that there was an owner's lounge in the next tower over that we could go to to get a cool drink and relax until paged. Check in was easy and fast and we were paged in less than an hour. We got room keys and stopped by the bell desk and they took our claim ticket and told us to go up, they would follow with the luggage which arrived right on our heels.The room, OMG, FANTASTIC! An ocean view, it looked to us like most of the rooms were ocean view. The suite was clean, well stocked and large! The furniture was so comfortable and when we had issues in the room (minor stuff, our ignorance) they were there within minutes to show us what to do.The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a self contained little world with a lagoon for families and the beach right there. There are numerous large clean pools with water slides and bars for the adults and two little delis for food by the pool or on the beach. We highly recommend the luau! HHV is a major player and all the attractions and acticvities have pick up locations throughout the property. We have stayed in many Hilton Grand Vacation locations and they are always wonderful but this one tops all.Activities in Hawaii are expensive so be prepared. We rented two chairs and and umbrella at the little stand on the beach, $60 for the day (some bright souls bought them and passed them along to others when they left for home) Sunset dinner cruise for 2, $240. If you have the time, rent a car for a day only (parking is $27 a night) and take a ride out of Honolulu and go around the island to the north shore. BEAUTIFUL drive! Don't miss the Dole Pineapple Plantation.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay. It was very beautiful and clean. Many things to do. The pull out bed was not great and the room was in need of being updated, but overall it was nice. The hotel, grounds, pools and beach were great.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: What a great place to stay in Oahu! The resort is large with a lot of guests but the service makes you feel that you're at a small, intimate resort. You never have to leave the resort but there's so much to do/see in Oahu that you should definitely make an effort to go an see as much as you can.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just got back from our best family vacation EVER at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in Honolulu. We LOVE this resort, it has absolutely everything you could ever need. It's located close to everything and the shopping and dining are great!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Location was nice, but construction and traffic nearby were a but noisy. I'm loyal to Hilton but there are few places that need improvement. Pools close too early and not too many food options nearby. Fireworks were great and service was always friendly and enthusiastic. Perfect for families

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The view from the Lagoon Tower, can be especially beautiful, you feel directly the smell of wind and Hawaii. This is where it was very good. On-site, many plants planted Yes, you will be able to feel happy just to take a walk. It is a great choice to eliminate the daily stress.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our first stay as new HGVC members and this trip was exactly what we wanted when we took the plunge last year. After reading tips and advice on another time share forum, I booked exactly 9 months out for a 2 BR premier in the Lagoon Tower. The location of this tower is the most convenient to the beach, lagoon and restaurants. The Premier units on the end have the best views of the water and a side advantage is the best view of the luau and fireworks show! While we only had one room service during our 8 night stay, guest services was always available to bring up extra trash bags, towels, toiletries, and pick up the trash bags. I have to say we are now spoiled by having the space and kitchen in this two bedroom for the four of us. I can't imagine "having" to stay in a "regular" hotel room in the future!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I'm a Hilton Diamond member, I've stayed at several Hilton brand hotels around the world. When I booked this hotel for our honeymoon, I thought that this would be the excellent quality of service Hilton usually provides, however, I was negatively surprised. This has been my worst experience at any Hilton-Brand hotel. The room we got was incredibly small, close to the elevator, very very noisy. The staff at the check in was not able to accommodate us into any other room. There are much better value hotels in the Waikiki area for the price. It's also absolutely annoying to being constantly asked to join one of the time-sharing sales events in the hotel's pent house. Definitely would not recommend staying at this hotel, and would think twice while staying on another Hilton Grand Vacation hotel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our family stayed in a 2 bedroom condo at the lagoon tower during the first week of May. Our personal concierge was exceptional in getting us settled in, recommending activities to do and sights to see, and helping us make reservations to dinners/shows. The hotel room that we received was equipped with everything that you would need (i.e. kitchen pots and pans, utensils, etc.). However, the room decor and furniture was rather dated, with minor repairs and touch ups needed. For example, the little handle to hook the showerhead was loose and was about to fall off the bathroom wall. Room and kitchen utensils can be cleaner as well. However, the hotel's amenities was excellent and the "village" was very convenient. Great for family vacations.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Lagoon Tower ocean front room was worth the wait. Excellent. Only thing we didn't care for was not being told of the remodeling noise that always seemed to be happening when we needed to take an afternoon nap. Other than that, it was great.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our rooms are clean & spacious with a balcony over looking the beach and a lagoon. Inside the village are restaurants and shops and entertainment place. You don't have to go out of the village, all you need is there.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The views are to die for, the beaches are lovely. The resort is Freindly & Comfortable. This is the first vacation we have taken, where we were not ready to head home after our 8 days in Oahu. Rainbow Lanai has a great breakfast, and our night time walks on the beach were memorable. The Polynesian Cultural Center was a real highlight, and check out North Shore Tacos- the best mahimahi tacos ever.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This place seems to don't have the better good place from our children. I live the weather nice, the warm sunshine and wind which is refreshing and clean in the metropolis and we make realize how to miss this good environment.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I'm currently staying at the HGV - Waikikian and am disappointed in the cleanliness of the room. I had to call and ask to have the couch cushions cleaned which they did within hours but the stove was not cleaned as requested. The appliances are in need of a good scrubbing. I recently staying at Kingsland on Hawaii which was much better. We also were not told about the owners lounge when we checked in.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our apartment in the Lagoon tower was fabulous. The kitchenette was lovely. Bedroom and Bathroom were very nice. Based on some of the recent reviews in Travelocity we were bracing for a tattered apartment. To our delight, the rooms were lovely. Wished the HVAC worked more consistently. We should have called when we realized it was not working...but we were too busy enjoying the vacation and slogged through the evenings when the room warmed up.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Kalia Tower with an ocean view, which was nice, but the noise from the street prevents you from even using you balcony. Every night there is some function on the great lawn with loud music carrying on to at least break up the sounds of the cars and motorcycles passing by!!! I will say that the sound proofing of the patio doors is very good so at least it doesn't affect your sleep. The room itself was okay, with ours not being a renovated room, but the passage doors do not lock and the furniture is very uncomfortable. (Request a renovated room if possible) The building is set back and far from the lagoon and beach, so if you have little ones, I would recommend staying in a different tower. Pools had much to be desired. The Kalia pool is small with no food or drink service and the super pool is not really super. The hotel touts it as the largest pool in Honolulu, but I doubt that since you can't even swim in it with the hundreds of other people in it. The paradise pool is the nicest pool with slides, but still small. All lounge chairs are very warn and need to be replaced.Shopping, restaurants and bars are everywhere, but I wanted a place to come and relax....Unfortunately this was not the place.Lagoon was very neat, with the kids loving the stand up paddle board rental.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This resort was so nice. It was a small city ......had everything on site. Shopping. Excursion. Eateries. A must stay for Hawaii. Their staff was beyond excellent !! The drinks were expensive and some bars are watered down too much. They have a great luxury taxi service always available and on site.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Lagoon Tower needs updating. Furnishings are starting to look worn and faded. The newer Grand Waikkian Tower, which is right next door is much nicer. Hilton needs to upgrade both bedroom and livingroon furniture.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a corner room with windows (sliding doors)on both sides. Our view on one side was the lagoon and the beach on the other. Since we arrived on a Friday, we got to see their luau show and fireworks. It was so much fun! We picked this hotel because of the reviews and we just wanted somewhere nice to stay before we left on our cruise. If we ever go back, we are definitely staying there again and staying longer!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We decided to stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village during Easter weekend. We rented a two bedroom, two bathroom suite in the Lagoon Tower. The room itself was spacious and clean. The bathrooms were fully stocked and clean. We stayed for four days total. Here are a few of the things we noticed during our stay:Positives:They have a special event on the grounds for most Holidays.The room was positioned with an excellent view of the Friday firework show.The beds and couches were comfortable.Quiet!Friendly Staff!!!Walking distance from Waikiki!Negatives:A tip is expected.It is very expensive to rent Anything!Keep an eye on your beach towel as people will take them and turn them in.Food is expensive but lots of variety.Parking is expensive.Holidays are very busy!You can occasionally run into a bum sleeping on the beach or begging along the sidewalk.Overall I would suggest visiting as we had a great experience...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The resort, while not listed as all inclusive, is like an all inclusive with all amenities, activities, and services available on the premises. The room was very comfortable and spacious. The staff was pleasant and went out of their way to make our stay a wonderful, relaxing experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The room was fantastic . . . clean, spacious, comfortable and all amenities were available and in working order. Great view over Magic Island and the Marina. The Hilton Hawaiian Village beaches, pools, restaurants were all very good and we enjoyed the parrots, koi and penguins on the property.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a 2 bedroom premier ocean view room at the Lagoon tower. The suite was HUGE and the view outstanding! We enjoyed both of the balconies, one with a table and one with lounge chairs. The convenience of all the shopping, restaurants, pools, and various activities right on property can't be beat. Snorkeling right off the beach was fun as was renting a stand-up paddle board and the turtle cove snorkel trip. Paradise Cove luau was great and we were very happy with the e Noa excursion to the Arizona Memorial. Fireworks the last night of our stay completed the magical trip

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I love this property. But there are caveats. What other people have said is accurate. It's a family resort. So, it's noisy. To be expected. Didn't bother us. Pools are busy. Hard to get pool chairs and no one is "policing" whether towels left on a chaise for 6 hours with no one in sight can really be reserved ???? All day? By the end we played the game the same way, and I'm sure, annoyed others. We did not eat at a hilton restaurant all week. Bought food from Foodland grocery and cooked. Also bought wine off-property. Groceries are expensive in oahu! What I experienced was a VIP package as a trial for full ownership. We were travelling with another family and wanted to be together as we have kids that can be left alone for awhile (girls have taken babysitting course) but not all night! And trying to reach a person beforehand to inquire about room selection: impossible. I understand why this is....to a point. But you know, if I am a paying guest at hilton, I know exactly what I'm getting and can request in advance certain things about room location. Not so with being an owner and to me, this seems backward. For holidays I want certain things guaranteed including type of room. Here you are only guaranteed the type of room if you buy this specific location, which is the most expensive. If a hgvc owner otherwise, it's dicey as to what you might get. That's the system so as long as this is not stressful, this might be a program to consider. But not for us at those prices! Would want to know I had my ocean view etc. this was a big reason that we did not buy after experiencing things, as we really felt that we could not deal with the lack of certainty. Anyhow many pluses to this kind of program and I can see how certain people may find this option appealing. And the property is well maintained, and kind of keeps you in, with all that there is to do. Friday night weekly fire works awesome. We did not do the hilton Luau..... Didn't feel we needed to as you can easily hear it all over the property! Great stay overall.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: stayed here 4/7/14-4/13/14. Upon arrival, we were misdirected where to check in by several staff. Once we found the Lagoon Tower our request for a King bed in our Studio room was not honored which I had confirmed the day before. Mari was very nice and offered us an upgrade to a one bedroom in the Kalia Tower two days later. Once we saw our studio room which was more like a closet with a mini fridge and micro, I was extremely disappointed. No balcony, no dresser just a tv stand with 3 drawers and a very small closet. The room barely had room to put our two suitcases against a wall with space to walk around them. Every studio I've booked has had sitting area with kitchenette. This was a subpar standard room, NOT a studio. Needless to say it was a long two days waiting for the one bedroom to become available which was a vast improvement over the" studio". They nickel and dime you for items that are normally free at most resorts. $32 a day to rent an umbrella, $15 for a beach chair, $8 delivery fee for room service on top of the gratuity. No housekeeping unless you book for 7 days but can request fresh towels. The property is huge with extensive dining and shopping options, and a variety of swimming pools. The lagoon is a nice plus. Nightly live entertainment at the Tapa Lounge was pretty good with room for dancing. Fireworks show on Friday evening was a nice touch. Central location with easy city bus and shuttle access. Overall I would not stay here again or recommend to friends. I prefer a more intimate resort. Stayed here to meet with friends from the DC area and because it was available through our Fiesta Americana Vacation Club exchange. Our friends had a two bedroom suite with soiled questionable stains on a lot of the upholstered furnishing. Could really use some maintenace and deep cleaning. Wood funishings were dinged, scratched and stained. Really well worn and overdue for an update. Not up to Hilton standards compared to other Hilton properties I've stayed at.. Our friends were disappointed as well. One bedroom had twin beds which is not what they requested and shared a wall with the master. So much for romance. They will not be returning either. They have a rooftop luau daily that can be seen and heard from some of the rooms in the Lagoon Tower which got irritating after a day. One morning about 8am they had a group out on the lawn below our room with bullhorns and microphones conducting a team building/motivational excercise that lasted several hours. I felt locating them in that area was very inconsiderate to guests trying to sleep in.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The HHV is a self-contained property that allows for swimming in nice pools, a lagoon, and the office, decent food options, and beautiful rooms. However, sending essentially all guests to the Kalia Tower fitness center is problematic given its limited capacity. Even at 7:15am in the morning all the few available workout machines were in use.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Had a two bedroom ocean front room. Excellent room with all of the kitchen items needed to cook meals in the suite. Overall a great resort with everything needed for a perfect Hawaiian vacation with a perfect location on the beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Too many minor problems for a 4star expectation. While the pools and the beaches were adequate, I felt like there would have been a price on the underpaid lifeguard to actually perform his duty. I would have gotten more success in asking for help from a complete stranger than bother with any of the staff who seemed too preoccupied with talking about aloha or mahalo.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton Hawaiian Village is truly the best place to stay in Hawaii with your family. Our two bedroom suite had fantastic views of the ocean, lagoon an.d the skyline. The resort had a variety of activities for both kids & adults; swimming, paddle boarding, surf lessons for kids & shopping, massages & relaxing areas for adults. A variety of restaurants meant you never had to leave.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay in the Kalia tower. The condo is really 2 hotel rooms put together and you definitely get that feeling - it was well appointed but just felt a little like an afterthought. The stove door dented the fridge every time we opened it and there are 2 separate lanai spaces - would have been lovely to have one large one to dine as a family outside.Pools are definitely crowded and I too wondered if all those folks were truly guests but my kids met some little friends so once we found lounge chairs we were settled in. The beach was large enough that I didn't feel as crowded as I did at the pools - the super pool is the worst. The one in our tower was never busy and we usually ended out day at that pool. The gym in our tower was never crowded either which was nice.Fireworks were great, the Luau was a good show but I agree with the others the food is truly awful, which is amusing since they rave about the chef - pretty expensive for just the show; but I am still glad I saw it. The linens were top notch as per Hilton and the staff was very accomodating,housekeeping was immaculate - any issues that we had were settled very quickly. I would definitley spend the extra money on the oceanfront view - we could lie in bed and watch the ocean!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Enjoyed the Hawaiian Village. Stayed in the Lagoon Tower. Great lagoon, great fireworks, great views and great beach access. Unfortunately the Pool appears to be accessible to anyone, including non-guests, which leads to it being very crowded. Made it hard to enjoy swimming and difficult to find a spot to observe our children while they swam.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Wonderful beautiful top notch place. Close to everything, restaurants, shopping, attractions. On site beach, play bay, and pools. Staff very friendly! Fireworks are beautiful. Just DO NOT do the Luau. You will be disappointed, in the food especially!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Grand Waikikian is a very nice and fun place to stay with family. The property is well kept as are the spacious rooms. The pool and beach provide lots of activities for the whole family. There are a variety of places to eat on property and nearby. All this makes for a great place for the family to get away.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The rest of the poor/terrible reviews are pretty accurate. The Lagoon tower is in desperate need of an overhaul. If you aren't on the side facing the Rainbow Tower, then don't bother. I found the service to be okay, prices higher than on Waikiki's main hotel strip and generally was unimpressed. The only positive was the beach. It is much wider than other areas and never felt crowded. We felt the hotel was a little isolated, and the food options immediately surrounding it are few. Prepare to walk, or to take $$ cabs.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: resort is nice and comfortable. Drink and food price is very high and bar wait service is extremely slow (15 to 20 minutes) to the point where I typically had to go to bar to order drinks. Plenty of non resort locations where this is not an issue.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village is a great getaway for a couple or family! There are lots of things to do in Oahu and many great restaurants to try! I would recommend having a car, though many restaurants and lovely beaches are in walking distance. I love going out to the Kailua beaches, hiking Diamond Head, and checking out the activity and surfing in the North Shore. I love Alan Wong's for a nice (and $$$$) dinner, along with Roy's in Hawaii (much better than the mainland version), and fabulous sushi! I'm ready to go back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Wonderful resort, but pools and hot tubs can not accommodate number of guests. pools were too cool and hot tubs not hot enough. Too many underage children in hot tubs. Our room had a beautiful view and staff were very friendly.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family has come to this resort for the past four years, but we will never come again. It appears to be under new management and it is absolutely falling apart. They seem to be trying to make a buck by holding it out as a conference/party center while still treating it as a family resort. As any fool knows, those two things cannot go together. There were, literally, three parties in one week hosted right on the lawn, that lasted until ten pm, followed by loud clanking clean-up until the wee hours. Then various, incessant construction projects would begin at 8 am. Try that with your jet lagged children! Sound relaxing? Maintenance issues are atrocious: There are broken slides, gates and chairs at the pools, the grass on the lawn has been destroyed and patched in spots, the lagoon was half drained most of the time we were there, and even many of the plants and flowers are gone (as are the macaws and most penguins). Much of this is due to the new overcrowding, I assume, including the fact that sunbathing conference nerds now race down to put towels and magazines on chaise lounges at 8 am to save them for the day. They may not show up for hours, but they've saved all the seats for later. No class. Furthermore, every door latch in our rooms was broken, as were some appliances. Service has gone downhill just as badly. Before arriving I called the concierge to ask for help with future dinner reservations - she offered to look on Open Table for me, but said I could just do it myself as well. Concierges at better resorts have bookings. We arrived at nearly 1 am to find one man at the check-in counter for the entire vacations resort, with no bellmen and no valets. We took our own bags up rather than waiting... and after waiting twenty minutes for a valet to show up I finally told him I was going to my room. He told me I could not leave, I had to be there to take my half of the ticket or they'd have a hard time finding my car in the morning, and asked me to keep waiting for a valet for who knows how long. I offered him plenty of solutions - put the ticket stub in an envelope with my name and room number, have it sent to my room when the valet finally arrives, leave it with the resort manager or concierge - I didn't care. It's just a ticket. He kept saying no, so I left anyway. Lo and behold they had my ticket in the morning, no sweat. I was the wrong tier room and was told there was nothing they could do to fix it. They attempted to charge me parking for days we weren't even there, etc. It's hard to imagine how this could be less relaxing. Honestly, just stay away...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location to Waikiki. Once you understand the traffic patterns it is easy to get out of town for a tour of the island. Renting a vehicle is a bonus if you want to get around the island where tours do not go but not necessary. Parking is at the hotel but expensive. Purchase food at costco or Walmart to conserve money.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I visited Hilton Grand Vacations in Feb and I have no complaints except that I had to leave. I stay at the Lagoon Tower and in the Tapa Tower!! Both Tower were beautiful! My room in the Lagoon was smaller but very nice updated, mini fridge and microwave was nice! Tapa Tower was amazing! Patio was a well used feature and the room was a lot larger, I had a garden/ocean view! Both Tower for Fab!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Awesome resort with much to do within walking distance. Different places to eat, hangout, listen to music, dance,or just watch the waves. Great for couples and families. Hilton always has a great staff and delivers excellent service!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great place to go, with lots of activities. Is expensive but there are some great deals especially for military retirees. This was truly a grand vacation at a premium facility with great staff who were always polite, considerate and helpful.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We moved to the Lagoon Tower and looked forward to all that went with it. Unfortunately we hit a weekend that they had a corporate event. Instead of a nice restful weekend we were hit with a corp party on Fri night that had not stop noise and other than being AT the party we heard every single song and noise to the fullest. The next day, Sat. they sat up for the next events. I called and asked if we should expect more of the same Sat night as we were up all night with the music and screaming the night before. We were assured there would be no entertainment Sat. night. Well that was 100% wrong. It's still going loud and strong and while I am glad the resort is making lots of $$$ and the corporation is having a great time, I am sad we are using our vacation time for the most unrestful time we have ever spent. This should have been free at best to put up with this non stop. Can hardly wait to see what we have to endure tomorrow night. What a waste of our time off.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stayed at this location before and loved it. I was offered a week vacation by HGV to listen to their sales pitch. I was offered a price for a week, but asked for an upgrade to a 2 bedroom which they promptly agreed to for a higher (double) price. When I went to reserve, they told me it was for a 1 bedroom at the higher price and weren't offering 2 bedrooms any more. They refused to honor my agreement and said that their notes didn't mention a 2 bedroom. They refused to listen to the recording. I always stay at Hiltons and Marriotts but this lack of trust is making me think of cancelling the two Hilton reservations that I have made for this summer.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location in Honolulu. Honolulu/Waikiki is crowded and traffic is awful. If you're looking for a place to stay in Waikiki, then this is a great place to vacation with family. Close to beach or use the great pool. Plenty of shopping and dining opportunities.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great location in Honolulu! Easy to walk around the City; there were trolley's's but we didn't use them. A few too many kids for my liking but the facilities were great! Fireworks on Friday and Saturday night were very nice and free!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stayed at this resort over christmas and new years. My wife was 8 months pregnant at the time, we had to switch rooms and asked if there was somewhere we could store our stuff until our room was ready or if we could have a early check-in. There answer was a simple NO. We decided to go to the outdoor pool until our room was ready. We had all our personnel belongings with us at the pool, watch, credit cards money iPods camera etc in a backpack. After sting in my pool chair and not even being there for 15 minutes someone had snuck up behind us and stolen our bag right from under our chair while we were sitting there. Security came and took a statement and brought us to the hotel manager on duty. We had roughly 15,000.00 worth of stuff stolen and the managers only response was a story of when he went to thailand and had his passport stolen. He had no concern of what just happened at his hotel to us and did not offer us any help whatsoever. I asked him how he would like me to pay from our stay now that my credit cards were stolen, his ran to the desk and made sure to put through the charges before my card was cancelled. I will never stay at any hilton hotel again. the fact is no one at their hotel cared about what happened or tried to even help us.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The location of the property is VERY good and has most everything you would need on property. Property is very good for a family or a couple. You will find it a little pricey but its HI. You can use it as a base to go anywhere on the island

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just completed our 5th stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and have already booked our return visit for October. We love the on-site variety of facilities and activities and we love the Waikiki location. We've rented a car twice (one day rental both times) to drive around the island. Otherwise, we walk and use the local bus to get around Honolulu and Waikiki. We geocache around Honolulu and so get to see areas that are not typical tourist spots. After a day of adventuring, we happily return to the HHV, which is starting to feel like a second home. Can't wait to go back!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
