review_body: Our family spent the weekend to celebrate my daughter's birthday with some of her friends. We had a excellent stay with the friendly service and large rooms to spread out. The kitchen was great for meals and the hotel was right next to the pool and beach. Lots to do and not enough time to do it. Planning our next stay already.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in the studio and had a great view of the ocean. The room was very nice and clean. Beds were comfortable. First time using our timeshare and we were very pleased. Wish they had a bar or restaurant down stairs but it is close to several bars and restaurants. The parking is pretty pricey but that was expected.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Can't wait to go back! Have wanted to stay at Hilton Hawaiian Village since first seeing it more than 10 years ago. Booked a room at the resort and upgraded it to a one bedroom condo for a week. We were put in the Grand Waikikian which is part of the Hilton Grand Vacations Suites.We were given the traditional Hawaiian flower lei greeting at reception. Check in was fast and easy. Hilton has an arrangement with Charley's Taxi so it was a $29.00 flat rate from the airport. The condo was clean, spacious, with a kitchen, washer and dryer. Upon arrival we were told which day housekeeping would come into the condo. I liked not having to get out of the room everyday for housekeeping. Additional housekeeping was available with a phone call if needed. Liked being able to have breakfast in the condo and snacks in the kitchen.Only negative thing I have to say about the condo was that the pillows were absolutely the worst I have ever had in any hotel. They were flat beyond saving. Asked for pillows that had some loft to them and were told there weren't any. Next time I'll try to bring my own pillow.Did not rent a car. Parking rates are very high at the resort. Public transportation was a bargain and we were able to go where we wanted on The Bus.There is enough to do at Hilton Hawaiian Village that you don't even have to leave the resort.We took a sunset cocktail cruise on the Spirit of Aloha catamaran. The crew was great and they did not spare the alcohol in the drinks.We liked the resort and our stay so much that we hope to go back before the end of the year. Will definitely book a condo again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I had room 467, 2 bedroom suite. It was wonderful for our 7 night stay. We spent $200 on groceries at the Walmart (We had a rental car). The suite had a full kitchen so it saved having to go out for breakfast & lunch everyday. We still spent over $500 on restaurants for 3 people. We had a view of the pool & a distance view of the ocean. It was noisy, because of kids playing in pool 4 floors below. I wanted a room on 6th floor. It was still a great experience because it was like having an apartment. If you have small kids the Lagoon tower is located by the best kid-friendly pool.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Sometime it took long long time to wait @ reception corner . Sometime it tooks 20 mins. to wait for the reception time. I think you should have idea to cope this issue. Some staff talk too much and it seems loose action we think. Please cut waiting time .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower and it was very hard to leave the room the views from the balcony were so mesmerizing. When we did leave the room it was hard to walk outside of the resort it was so tropical and .... Hawaiian. We loved that the resort is so close to Ala Moana Shopping Center. We often eat lunch at The Pineapple Room, delicious.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great hotel. Recommend you stay in either the Lagoon Tower with lagoon view, or the Rainbow tower (either side.) The other two towers dont have the view and are a bit further to the beach. Overall great hotel for the family- We will definitely go back again

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This Resort's location is excellent. It is at the beginning of the Waikiki Strip. The Staff are very friendly and helpful especially Grace in the arrival/front desk. The fireworks are a must see on Friday nights - best location is the beach on the left side of the Rainbow Tower. Laundry facilities are free which was a great surprise - yahoo. The Lagoon Tower is nicely situated for a more quiet stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were told we could come anytime. When we wanted to book the date we could not get the date we wanted and had to pay $150.00 to change one night. We chose the option for a "free" rental car but were not told parking was $27.00 per night. Too many things we were not told beforehand.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very ordinary but adequate accommodations- suites are very like Embassy Suites. Pools are small, chairs are scarce, and water was cold when we were there. Almost no swimmers, but ALL the reclining chairs were always fully occupied. This alone was a deal-breaker for us- we would not return. Overall, definitely not a luxury hotel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The overall facility is excellent however some of the furniture is soiled and needs to be replaced. The kitchen and bathroom cabinets have been replaced and yet the baseboards in the kitchen are deteriorating chip board.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed first week of the year and had a wonderful time. I had read a lot of reviews before booking our vacation destination and have to say I was not disappointed we certainly enjoyed our stay here. There were a lot of people but it was not bad like people say, your in Waikiki and there is plenty of sand an ocean for everyone. 1. Stayed in one bedroom in Kalia tower, all towers are short walk to beach and lagoon, was very clean and had full kitchen, stove, microwave, fridge, dining table, our girls slept on pull out sofa bed, not very comfy but adequate for a 3 and 5 year old but you would not want to sleep on it if your an adult. We slept in the king bed in bedroom so nice to have separate sleeping areas with kids! If you have family recommend staying in one or 2 bedroom suites, 1 bedroom suite was perfect for us as we need 2 separate rooms for sleeping plus there is more space/privacy.TVs and blu ray players (PS3) are in both rooms, so we brought some of our own mobile to watch, the tv in bedroom is a little small but we didn't really use it. TV in lounge is bigger and the free DVDs in the foyer is awesome, latest releases, no charge and loads to choose from.Loads of drawer space and hangers on closet as well as a good size safe. The laundry is not in room but in same floor so is close and good to be able to wash and dry clothes there so we were able to bring less luggage. The Kalia tower has its own fitness center, pool and hot tub on 4th floor, I believe all the towers do, so this is great. It also has a day spa that we did not use on this trip.2. Staff extremely friendly, helpful and even got an early check in, our room was well cleaned every day (they even put the girls soft toys in the beds for them) we were really treated like royalty and loved the amazing staff there and the beautiful clean rooms.3. Ala moana mall is close and has great shopping with all the major brands represented (girls love the Disney store) recommend stocking up with food form food land there as resort prices for food are pricey but there are plenty of great places to eat and there are also abc convenience stores everywhere, we had breakfast in our room and then ate lunch in resort and had dinner in room so was a great balance of some nice resort eating as well as dining in our own room making full use of kitchen etc...Parking is pricey, like $30 a day, recommend valet as is only a bit more, self parking I think is $27 a day. Valet is great and worth every penny, your in Waikiki so parking is premium and you just have to expect that and factor it in.4. Beach was great, crowded but still plenty of room to relax on the sand, everyone complaining about beach chairs and umbrellas, just buy them at abc for a few bucks and leave there, much easier and cheaper, we did that for the pool inflatables as well as sand buckets the girls loved playing with all these, when you leave pass them on to another family. the lagoon was great as well, not quite as warm as the beach which was quite warm and the best place to swim for that reason.5. This brings us to the pools, they are cold, and this is the only reason I did not give 5 stars, my girls were shivering in Hawaii! Pool temp is low 70s for sure, for me this is bad, it was the same last few times we were here as well, this is definitely an issue for us as it means the pools and water slides are not a lot of fun and only option for swimming is the beach. My 5 year old braved the water slides for about 6 rides but was shivering and lips were turning blue, I literally had to hug her in line to keep her warm, this should not be the case, the water slides are a great feature but who wants to land in cold water and then stand in line shivering? My 3 year old landed in cold water and it shocked her so she never wanted to go back in, was a shame as she was tall enough for slides so was excited until she landed I the cold water.Overall I might stay here again, we did visit the Disney resort and the pools were beautiful and warm so it is certainly factor in our future decision making, but it did not spoil our time as the girls love the beach so much so although was a shame not to spend more time in the pools we all did have a great time. Thank you for wonderful memories and great staff!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I could spend good time in HGVC in HNL. Two poitns which I wont to point out, Please provide Japnese language transration for new arrival non-Japanese movie although Chinese,Korean Thaioland etc availravle.Why you dont provide Japanese language transration ? We do hope to level up about quality of launge service item not only fro bevrage service but also snack service such as like kcokkies cakes etc.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower in February 2013 for 2 weeks with my 1 year old and 12 year old. Both kids loved the hotel property and paradise pool. The rooms were comfortable with a nice partial ocean view and view of the lagoon. The room had a fully equipped kitchen and we made a few meals in our room. There is a laundry room on each floor. We have been to Hawaii/Oahu multiple times and this is one of our favorite properties due to the amenities, proximity to beach walk, proximity to Ala Moana Shopping Center, and beach. The only problems we had with the room was the noise from the Luau and the fireworks show (since we had a 1 year old on a schedule) .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We took our family in Dec.2013. This hotel was beautiful. The location is perfect, the pools were great my boys had a blast they loved the slides. I loved that you have everything you need in just a couple of steps away no wonder they call it a village it is! Hilton Hawaiian Village totally helped make our christmas vacation the best vacation ever!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Staff service was flexible, gentle, heart warming, and with many brilliant smiles. Other customers were warm and friendly each other. Of course excellent hotel facilities, shops and good location were basis. I recommend this resort especially for the families as much as friends.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had our first visit in Hawaii for 8 days and not sure which building we should stay in, so we stayed 4 days at The Lagoon with an Ocean View and 4 days at the Grand Waikikian with the City View. Once you check in free orchid lei and macadamia nut lei for guys, but you have to ask the lady to lei you. She is not attentive as to who are checking in so you have to physically go infront of her and ask her for a lei. It's one of those Hawaii vacation that you really want to experience, to get lei'd. So they need to have some kind of communication from the desk to alert the lady, so each and everyone that checks in get a lei. For me that's very important because it is a symbol of "welcome to Hawai'i" and your vacation starts now feel. There were 2 adults and 2 kids so we opted for 1 bedroom with a King size bed for me and my husband and a pullout sofa bed for the kids which they love becuase they can watch tv as late as they wanted. The rooms in the Lagoon is more spacious than the Grand Waikikian. Eventhough the decor and appliances are newer and the washing machine is in the room at the Grand Waikikian my whole family would rather stay in The Lagoon (19th floor). When you down on the first floor, few more steps and you are already at the Lagoon, the beach and the swimming pool. At The Grand Waikikian eventhough you walk inside the building it is still a walk. The Village has restaurants, shopping area, ABC store (a very convienient store that has almost everything you need) and a rent a car place (National) which the cars are parked at the Hilton parking building. We rented a car and drove around the Island and stopped by at Walmart to buy food to cook which saved us a lot of money. Both rooms are equiped with everything you need, including a rice cooker, sponge and a dishwashing soap and laundry detergent. We would eat at the balcony and watch the beautiful sunrise and sunset when we were at The Lagoon. The City View is not that appealing at all, so spend a little more for an ocean view. My kids love the gated pool with the slides and at night the pool is heated which is awesome. I don't suggest going to the main pool which is not gated, eventhough it is bigger it is crowded and I smell pee everywhere becuase that's where all the "hotel guests" are staying and anybody who wants to use the pool. They give you an orange card to exchange for beach towel. The only bad part is that they did not explain to us that when you are done with the beach towel to exchange it to get your card back for a new towel the next time you go back in the pool, and to return those orange card when you check out. Upon check in you also get a card to rent free movies (great selection) which is great at night.The check out time is 10am and check in is at 4pm, they have a family lounge at the 8th floor to wait for your room until it is available. When it was time for us to change building I thought we had to wait for our room but surprisingly they were already ready and we did not have to wait at all which is great.At night if we open our balcony we can watch the Luau from the top of the Hilton parking lot. The only bad part is I hated the pillow and the bed for some reason everytime I wake up my back hurts. The blanket at The Lagoon is so thick, its nice the first hour but when I woke up I was sweating. My husband and my kids did not have a problem so I ended up sleeping on the pullout sofa bed. Overall so much fun but if we go back we will definitely pick The Lagoon with Ocean View.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Excellent hotel in all respects. Great open air lobby. Best beachfront location with plenty of activities both on the property and off in all directions. The best was to have restaurants, stores and a dessert shop on the property.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our room was spacious but not exceptionally maintained as I would expect it to be for the price. Also, very early check out and no mention of a room to use for convenience was offered to our party. I like the resort for convenience - shopping, food, pools and beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I am surprised about some of the reviews. Yes, the complex is large, and has everything you need onsite. Yes, the amenities are expensive, but it is HAWAII. Yes, the pools are crowded, but you can work around that. Plus the beach and lagoon are never too busy. We had 4 adults and 2 kids in a 2 bedroom ocean/harbor view. We were on the 22nd floor (of 24). I imagine the paradise pool could be louder lower down. Loved our balcony. Had a full kitchen, with an oven that appeared never to have been used! Newer appliances; older room. Comfortable beds. There is room service until 10pm and came in helpful on several occasions. Glad to have a kitchen to save a little money. Ate at 4 different restaurants on-site and enjoyed all. CJs has something for everyone. Staff very friendly and helpful. Used the washer/dryer. Stayed a week and wish it was two. Looking to maybe even buy in (resale). Great family vacation!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The hotel appearance is excellent, staff is very helpful, but the rooms could use some maintenance, and everything at the hotel is very expensive. Use other sources for activities and dinning. The beach is excellent but to use a lounge chair or umbrella on the beach cost you extra.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The facility did not have the views or the accommodations we are accustom to at Hilton Grand. When I made the reservations, I asked for certain things for the celebration of our 25th wedding anniversary, they had no idea what this facility had or they did not inform me that the facility could not provide the perks I was wanting.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After reading a few bad reviews I thought how bad can it be. I stayed at the lagoon tower ocean view 1 bedroom suite over looking the Marina and lagoon. The suite was spacious, clean and quiet. The kitchen is fully equipped, bedroom is spacious and the pull out sofa is a queen size and comfortable. There is a free washing machine and dryer on every floor which are maintained daily. It was clean. I stayed on level 16. Wouldn't recommend a low floor over looking the pool as all you can hear are kids yelling in the pool. Ala moana 10 minute walk. Lagoon tower pool is great. Mai Tai's are $5 around the pool, however the other bars around the super pool are $11 each. Pools are not heated, the beach is warmer. Overall yes it is busy but it was nice. Staff are very friendly so don't know what people are going on about..

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We arrived as a family of 8 with 4 children and 4 adults and immediately got our lei greeting, bags taken away and to our rooms rooms within 10 minutes. Fireworks started minutes later and then a movie on the lawn. Good greeting to Hawaii if getting there by 6;30pm on a Friday or Wednesday! Upper rooms in the Lagoon tower are amazing, close to facilities and the best is they are huge. Kitchen well supplied and now have rice cookers. No BBQ which we would have liked . Lagoon activites, esp. surf lesson good value, with USB photos much appreciated.Best beach in Waikiki

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Once you've stayed at a Hilton Grand Vacations resort, it's hard to settle or anything less. Stayed here for our wedding, and felt like we were renting a condo by the beach! Loved the space and amenities (full kitchen, dishwasher, etc.) in our room. The staff was super helpful, and the location was walking distance to everything. I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed a week at the Hilton Hawaiian Village in the Lagoon Tower, which is the older tower. 2 bedroom was spacious, full kitchen, nice ocean view, large lanai for sitting outside and looking at the scenery. The property has it's own beach area and a little more private given it's further away from the main tourist area. The resort has everything, including multiple pools and small kiddie slides. Very relaxing just staying on property, but if you want activities, they have lots of options that you buy and even a few free ones on property. I say the room is slightly outdated, mainly because we took a tour of their new timeshare, the Grand Waikikian, which had higher end appliances and furnishings, albeit the rooms were smaller. Overall, it's a nice resort and when traveling with a family of younger kids, it's nice to have a kitchen and the beach and pools just outside the door.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Just stayed for the first time in a time share that I purchased last year. Partial ocean view 2bedroom. Agree with other recent reviewer. Room is a little worn for having been "recently renovated". Kinda wish I had ponied up for a unit in the Grand Waikikian. Also, previous tenant left crab and God knows what else in the drain which created a horrible smell. Maintenance came and corrected right away. Resort was great. Not crowded.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We have stayed here at the Lagoon Tower before and the room we had was starting to look tired. Some doors were chipped, baseboards need painting and carpet needed cleaning or replaced, furniture needed cleaning. I think just over all the room needed a face lift. It was not up to my expectation of a Hilton brand. We stay at the Hilton Grand Vacation in Las Vegas, on the Big Island and Florida and they are always in excellent shape. Enough about the room. The customer service here is like I expect of a Hilton Brand. It is top notch. Everyone is very helpful and nice.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great place for vacation, great amenities, great restaurants & shops. Enjoyed our room which was quiet & clean. the pools & surrounding areas were just super. Wish hotels would charge less for parking.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our family stayed at the 3-bedroom accommodations. Unfortunately we hardly used it since our cousins were had us running all over the island. It was a huge waste for us. However here are the pluses:1) Mega room to entertain family and friends2) They even have a pantry to store more food stuff3) The washer and dryer is located outside of the room (you can use two if you like)4) Mega space and chairs to view on your private room balcony or the main room balcony5) The bottom room has its own fridge, which makes it awesome If you have little ones6) The usual full kitchen, dining table, etc.Would definitely do it again if we have relatives who actually commit to staying here or else it is a total waste of money.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have a lagoon tower studio booked for May 2014 , so during my recent stay I asked management if I could have a quick look to make sure it was going to be suitable for my stay because I have read that others have been disappointed upon checkin. having said that. the vacation club staff were wonderful, organising for me to have a look between checkins .well, I was pleasantly surprised, yes it is quite small, about the size of a hotel room, but it has a king bed , sofa, kitchenette with coffee maker, toaster and fridge and table and two chairs.bathroom is very small, but it will service us fine on our 3 day stopover to the mainland, because all we will be doing will be sleeping in it. it has no balcony, but two louvred windows looking down to the paradise pool. if you know what to expect you are never disappointed, so I just wanted to describe it for you.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at Lagoon tower six years ago and we found the space was very tight for a family of four with two teens staying in a one bedroom unit. The renovated units are much improved and spacious. The living room and eating area is spacious and so is the bedroom. I like the colour scheme. There are a few issues that management have overlooked. For example, very obvious paint chips on walls and corners, very cheap utensils and no can opener. I had to called front desk twice to request a can opener. The front lobby washroom is below a two star restaurant standard.Nevertheless, my spouse and I had a good visit and the concierge was very helpful with tour highlights and coupon books.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent one week at the Lagoon Tower, a HGVC property in Hilton Hawaiian Village.While the property itself continues to undergo improvements and expansion, management is not performing much-needed and critical upgrades to the Lagoon Tower.On arrival (room 2065) we enjoyed the excellent view and the slightly-better-than-average room furnishings. Mostly a very good impression.On the 2nd morning, we had been attacked by an infestation of termites. They were literally crawling all over the guest bathroom - in the sink, the tub, over the light fixtures and the counter. They were crawling their nasty little bodies into our travel kits as they hoped for a journey back to the mainland. All together distasteful.Upon complaint, management came in and sprayed poison (while we were in occupancy!) into the bathroom. This helped for approximately 30 minutes, and then the insects reappeared. On further complaint, hotel management agreed to move us.The second unit, 2365, had no such infestation. Unfortunately, it had a totally outdated air conditioning system (the same as the first unit) that had to run constantly in order to cool down the bedrooms (while the main room was freezing cold). The thermostats are old and outdated and could not be regulated to shut the A/C off and on even if a proper temperature was reached. To maintain coolness, you had to run the A/C and fan 24/7.To add to this, we noted huge amounts of mold visible in the vents. One person in our party (me) became physically sick day in and day out. We didn't put the "mold" together with the "sick" until the last day, when we were leaving. This could be coincidence - there's no way I can prove that the mold was the cause of my illness, but it's highly suspicious.Management never followed up with us to inquire if our new accommodations were satisfactory or if we were now happy. They never offered any compensation for the discomfort of the insects or the inconvenience of moving all of our goods. (We were using the parking valet - a simple gesture would have been to "comp" this service and it would have cost the hotel nothing.)This hotel is resting on its laurels and it appears to not much care as to the overall satisfaction of its guests. After many (many!) trips to this facility, I will never stay there again, although I will give the newer sister property, Grand Waikikian a chance to fulfill the empty promises offered at Lagoon Tower.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The concierge service was poor. Not many of them could speak English fluently. We felt we had to speak Japanese to get any attention. The pools are filled with kids jumping around. They should dedicate one of the pools for adults only.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is our third time at the Lagoon Tower. Our room this time, although very comfortable and clean, was not as well maintained as those we've stayed in before. The sundries store is well stocked, if a bit expensive. We cooked in our unit most days. We had sufficient pots and pans to cook meals. Our frying pan had damaged Teflon, but when notified the staff replaced it immediately. Grocery stores are within driving distance, but are not close by. Location is great-right on the beach. I would recommend this resort, but be prepared for crowds.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The exterrior is very beautiful, the interror seems to be worn down with worn furniture, average cleanliness in the bathrooms, not satisfied with poor Hotel air system, especially with slight humid outside conditions. Staff can use some quality customer care assistance.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Although we stayed ne day on Hilton Point 143,000, the second day cost us over $400.00. In Vegas a one bedroom suite was $95.00 per night. Big difference. However, being it was for m]our granddaughter's hula competition it was worth the cost.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian vacation was a dream come true. Everything was perfect. There's so much to do and the food is great. We even decided to renew our vows on the beach. We did not want to leave. I was so relaxed and still relaxed as I come back to the hustle and bustle of city life. Would recommend this resort to everyone.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We were in a 2 bedroom/2bath condo with a fabulous ocean view. The furnishings were a liittle tired, but we were told they were due to be redone, so that explains it. They were more than adequate. The prices of the restaurants and all beach rentals was astronomical. We bought 2 beach chairs and came out way ahead. I guess that's the price you have to pay in a city. Very crowded pool and beach as we were told August is a MAJOR holiday month in Japan. Lots of families. Our fault for not waiting until September. Live and learn. Better to stay on the big island at Waikoloa.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Friday night fireworks, penguins, parrots, hula dancers, beach front, multiple pools, acres and acres of fun, food, stores, and entertainment. Of courses its over prices and crowded its Hawaii… If you want to have it all in one place be close to the action and shopping this is your place. THE PRICE IS WORTH IT!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I was very lucky to get a room facing the Pacific Ocean. I enjoy the cultural show and the fireworks during my visit at the hotel. The under water trip in the Pacific Ocean with a small submarine touring the wrecked aircraft was a fantastic experience. The Hilton Hawaiian Village Hotel to me is self supplied where you could get anything without going out of the " village ". Being an Asian guest I think the Most of the guests were not quite friendly as in my country. Since traveling alone to attend an International Telecommunication Conference for a couple of days, I could not make the utmost enjoyable trip. The Waikiki beach was clean and well maintained then, and I wish I could visit Honolulu again sometime.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The cost of the VIP condo rental was good; the charges for chaise lounges, paddle boards, etc. made us feel like ambulatory ATMs. $30 for an umbrella? $15 for a chaise lounge? The stand-up paddle board charge was singularly abusive at something like $30/hour. I compare it to resort charges for ski equipment. In a higher-end resort like Breckenridge, I rent boots, skis and poles for my son for all day at about the same price as one hour on a paddle board. Although the room in the Lagoon Tower was spacious and adequately equipped and clean, it is years overdue for a renovation. The WiFi connection was slow at best and absent too often. The staff was pleasant and helpful, but there was no one around to enforce the rules around the pools. This included hot tubs with as many as 13 people (actual count at the Paradise Pool), some of whom were well under five years old. The hygiene problems kept me out of the hot tub after I saw that. I also question the total number of people in the pool. To me the occupant load seemed neither safe nor sanitary. The rules against throwing down a towel or a pair of flip flops to reserve a chaise lounge were blatantly ignored at every pool I saw except for the one adjoining the spa. Above and beyond the rules problem, there is an absolute shortage of pools and/or pool deck space to accommodate the number of guests. I know from TripAdvisor that the manager usually answers that the Hawaiian Village has many pools and restaurants. Yes, they have many pools-- but not have enough for to be comfortable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Room was old and in need of renovation (yet told it was recently renovated) Terrible restaurant choices. Literally had to leave the grounds any time wanted food. Pool beyond overcrowded. No chairs on lagoon or beach. For beach days we went down to Waikiki main public beach downtown. On-site Tropics Restaurant is cute but menu and food extremely poor. Room repair (service) was outstanding - replaced PlayStation. Concierge reluctant to help so went off-site to purchase adventures/day trips. Really poor execution for such a prime location and size of property.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I think that the Hilton Grand Vacations Lagoon Tower was a good vacation spot but they really need to figure out how to give better directions when checking in. The team sent me up the road then another group sent me back down the road leading to my calling my trip concierge with the thought that we would just sit for a min and let them come find us. I cannot think of a more frustrating experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: While the purpose of our visit was vacation, the reality was that we needed WiFi to check emails and conduct work from time to time. The internet access was horrible at the HGVC Lagoon Tower....actually quite shameful for a property of this caliber with Hilton. Everything is overly expensive and you should walk outside of the Village to get dollar-value bites and variety.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: No control of AC temperature; internet was spotty; television was difficult to turn off; some small dead bugs were in the picture frame in the bathroom. Hilton Hawaiian Village is a beautiful resort, so the offer we got to review a time share was great. We are still thinking about purchasing a time share, but less than perfect experience left us undecided .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: During the trip we stayed in the Lagoon Tower. The view was spectacular. Room met our expectations. The location of the resort was excellent. The lagoon was a joy. Our teenage daughter spent hours swimming there. Being right on Waikiki Beach was a dream.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Over the years, on many visits to Oahu, I have made the Hawaiian Village my home away from home. First by chance, and later by design.From the open air lobby to the beautiful pools and the magnificent beach, it has never failed me.The staff is welcoming in the finest Aloha tradition, yet exceedingly professional and most eager to please.I was fortunate enough to stay in the Rainbow Tower when it first opened. Condition of theproperty has always been top notch in every respect..Norman, the Captain and Concierge in the condo building, personifies Aloha in its finest sense.He was gracious, well informed, impeccable in dress and demeanor, , and shared many worthwhile suggestions for our extensive touring.I wouldn't hesitate to suggest the HHV to anyone.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very nice accommodations and quarters. Beautiful view of the beach and sky scrappers. I would definitely refer this to a friend or first time vacationer. The weather was great and nice air conditioning inside. The unit was very clean and very nice inside. Wish I could of spend more time there, but we had many places to go and visit, so didn't use many of their amenities.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Upon checking into the room, the freezer was broken, but the staff quickly replaced it. Upon checking out the hotel front desk staff gave us a extra time since we were here for my in law's 89th birthday. Thank you everybody.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: HHV is a beautiful resort. Technically you don't have to leave the property to enjoy the beauty of Waikiki Beach. The activities and restaurants are fun. Like most things in Hawaii, the prices are 10-25% higher than on the mainland. The grounds are well manicured and litter free. I own in the Lagoon tower which is a beautiful building, however, the rooms still have older tub/shower combinations and no laundry equipment in suite like other Hilton properties. Despite those shortcomings, I still think the location and amenities make it the best place to stay on Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our room was not fully cleaned, the internet was down, and the A/C distribution was uneven. The property is beautiful, but it needs some work. We stayed at the Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village - love the property - nice amenities for a family, but the condition of the room was just not up to snuff...

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The room decor was average, probably needs a style refresh. It was very clean, however. The bathroom had no exhaust fan, which was an issue with three people taking showers in a tropical climate. The coffee maker was old, and could not be set the night before to automatically brew in the morning (feature did not work). The bed was very comfortable. As for the bar/restaurant staff, they were just average in terms of helpfulness and prompt service. I find hotel bars and restaurants are very average in terms of service--it's like they feel the guests are a captive audience and they don't really have to try. I travel a lot for my job, and always have a better service experience at bars & restaurants off property, and this Hilton was no exception. The service at the Tapa pool was non-existent on a very sunny, crowded day. They could have made a lot of money serving drinks, but never came around. A staff member sat at a table near the pool and never moved or alerted wait staff, and I had to go to the bar for every drink.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Stayed in a 2 bedroom self contained apartment in the Lagoon tower, ocean view with full kitchen.Sensational room and best tower on the property. Nothing better than a full kitchen with 3 boys in toe.This was our third time here and The resort is great for families and suits our needs totally.Close to everything, yet away from the bustle of the main drag yet easily accessible.We found prices for almost everything had increased this year so savings of any kind were a blessing.Free Internet and free DVD's were a bonus.We had to do the "sales talk" to receive the rate we received, for the rate and the room we would do it every year. Compared to the hotel rooms this tower wins hands down.Staff were great, room cleans worked around our needs and did a great job.I hope I can get the same room and deal, if so they have got me again next year.Yes it was busy, we stayed for 4th July celebrations but the place was busy and lots of fun. Huge fireworks, great show on the grand lawn which we watched from our room and lots of fun.Yes facility costs are expensive, rent boards and kayaks from outside they are cheaper. Park in the parking lot next door also cheaper. Eat at the round table pizza or outside restaurants to save also. This is a family resort and the kids love it. Beach, lagoon, pools, grass, simply non stop activities and fun for the boys and us.Different pools to try, lots of food choice and endless activities. You are on the beach so yes things are more expensive, however we stayed a few blocks back from the beach previously and the extra cost is worth every cent. You get out and about more, instantly on beach, swim, straight back to room and then back to swim.Position position position.If you are a family with kids we can't recommend the Hilton village highly enough.You too will love it.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and two teenage boys had a great time at the Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. Great lodging and great location. Easy walking distance to top notch shopping and dinning. We received a special rate to take the 'time share' sales tour. Would have never spent the 10k the 2 bedroom 2 bath condo would have rented out for, without the special sales incentive.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just returned from a 10 day stay at the Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawiian Village as guests of friends who are Hilton time share owners. We stayed in a two bedroom(large rooms) that had two large bathrooms, a large den and a kitchen(however there was sparse cooking materials present if you wanted to prepare a meal). After reading numerous reviews on trip advisor both good and bad I didn't know what to expect when we arrived. We luckily had a beautiful ocean view on the 11th floor that overlooked the great lawn and lagoon. While the carpet and furnishings were somewhat dated everything was in great condition and comfortable. I could not have asked for anything more from the room itself. The only problem we had was around 10-12 during the day we had long waits for the elevator as this is checkout time, I cannot believe the hotel does not have a service elevator for the staff and equipment, several times the elevator was full of cleaning carts and staff. The staff was efficient and courteous, when we needed towels, coffee or soap we called and they delivered within 10 minutes. Also I expected the resort to be crowded as it is large, but I was pleasantly surprise that there was more than enough room at the pools or lagoon. I would visit again but demand an ocean view and a room close to the ocean so that you would be further away from the luau that goes on just about every night.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Lagoon Tower itself is very nice. The rooms are clean and spacious. However there are 5 or 6 other giant hotels on the property and you're all fighting for the same lounge chairs and space by the 2 pools. And you have to pay $15 a person to get a lounge chair on the beach!! There are lots of restaurants to choose from but they are all very expensive. Plan on spending a minimum of $50 per person for dinner. And at least $25 per person for lunch. Plan on walking a lot too as the resort is huge and the restaurant or pool you want to go to might be 5-10 minutes away from your door. The staff is friendly and there was always a concierge, bellman, or valet to answer questions and give advice. I would not recommend this hotel for honeymooning couples- there are kids and giant families EVERYWHERE!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: never again not at this resort parkiong was $27 day, even for owners, 2 decks valet, open parking 3 decks up, near acces was up 3-4 flights of narrow dingy stairs, or you could walk down long corridor, take elevator, when available, and walk through garage and up ramps to cars. luggage carts not available to guests only bell hops. internal driveways and parking access congetsted and slow. only one access and exit

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I had an excellent vacation time at the Lagoon Hotel of Hilton Grand Vacations Hawaiian Village. The hotel is located very close to beautiful beaches. I strongly recommend this hotel for families with kids.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Worst experience ever- was promised several times before arrival an ocean/lagoon view & I'm sitting here with my family who wants to go home- looking out at the worst view on the property- nobody can help us to get the room we were promised- WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! They made many promises & have fallen short on delivery- I will never recommend this place as its been an AWFUL experience for us!! If I could give no stars I would- soooo disappointed! Too late to try & get room elsewhere- very busy travel week

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: great location right on Waikiki Beach. Beautiful pools and landscaping. Our room was in need of refurbishing. The carpet and furniture showed some age. If you like large resorts with lots of people, this is the place! We headed for North Shore each day to escape all the hustle and bustle of Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Great place to take the family for a vacation. Many amenities close at hand. Utilize the concierge and other staff...they are "locals" and can give you great advice and point you in the right direction. But be prepared to spend some money...nothing is cheap in Hawaii!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are owners here and have enjoyed coming here many years, but the last couple times we have noticed a change and it has not been for the better. I really don't like going to those resorts where you need to wear the wristbands but I feel they should maybe reinstate that policy as many of the people at the pools do not stay on the property. The locals and others have taken over. We were sitting in some very hard to find chairs at the slide pool and a whole family walked through the back gate set there home towels and grocery bags down against a back wall and jumped in, when chairs became available they took those and stayed all day only to leave out the back gate in the evening. Many others just simply walked in through the gate that was tied open took a dip and walked out.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our only "problem" was the fact that we did not have housekeeping while our stay. Had to call and order clean towels. other then this everything else was fine. had a good time in Hawaii. Will definataly go again!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our first experience as HGVC owners and how disappointing to stay 6 nights in a dated and tacky room with a "city view"', see noisy, and a huge jacuzzi style tub next to our bed. Yuck. We were put in the grand waikikian tower, one bedroom. I just don't get Hilton sometimes. They waste so much space and don't consider the needs of the traveler, vacationer. For instance, they give you towel cards to keep up with that you use to check in and out towels at the pool. What a hassle on a vacation, "oops forgot the towel card in my room, where is the card, etc. Having stayed here 3 times before in an ocean view room in the Rainbow tower, the noisy room facing the street was more than a let down and didn't feel like a vacation at all. Must also say the bathroom is wo small - honestly the tub next to the bed is nearly larger. Ugly and not at all like home way from home. Staff on the other hand professional and amiable. Still if Hilton is to ever compete with true luxury brands like the FS, RC, or JW Marriott or even the Westin they have lots of work to do. Sorry we fell for their bait and switch sales pitch.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I'm an owner here and this place just keeps getting better. I was staying in a renovated 1 bedroom suite on the 18th floor of the lagoon tower with fabulous views overlooking the gardens and the lagoon. Make no mistake, they don't call it a village for nothing. This resort is huge.An abundance of shops, restaurants, pools, activities and of course the amazing Waikiki beach to keep you occupied. 10 min walk to the heart of Waikiki or catch the trolley if you're feeling lazy. I never grow tired of this place and am already looking forward to my return next year

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The timeshares at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club is just terrific! All the comforts of home, yet just steps away from Waikiki Beach and shopping! The resort has everything you need so you can just spend your entire stay without leaving the property. Swimming pools galore, fitness center, beach, Friday night fireworks, great restaurants!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We love this property. The staff make us feel like this is our home away from home. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Love the location. The only negative I have is the food and drink prices are high.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Just completed a three night stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village through our ownership in HGVC. We stayed in a 1 br two full size beds on the 17th floor. Had a great time with no major glitches whatsoever. Since we live on Oahu, we brought food for breakfast and snacks. The small kitchen had everything we needed. Even a rice cooker. The only issue was the dishwasher; it was extremely noisy. Ate lunch and dinner both on and off site. Expect resort prices. Check in and check out was a breeze. Hung out pool side at the main pool, which was very crowded. The pool on the fourth floor of Kalia Tower was lightly used and nice for privacy. It seems that HHV has a new towel policy. Instead of wrist bands like before, they give you "towel cards" when you check in. Turn them in at the towel kiosk, collect your towel, return the towel, get a towel card back. Full size beds were very comfortable, with four pillows each. Be advised that the only bed covering you get is a large comforter, that's stuffed into a giant sized pillow case. A bit awkward at first but it worked. 17th floor mountain view was lovely, we had lanai's in both the living room and bedroom. Two flat screen TV's with DVD players. You could rent DVD's. Best entertainment was Jerry Santos and Olomana at the Tapas Bar, drinks a bit pricey but the music was excellent. We had a great time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My husband and I went to the Hilton Hawaiian Village for our 33rd wedding anniversary. The concerige, Sharon Wheat, was wonderful and arranged all our activities for us. Every part of our vacation met and exceeded our expectations. The beach is beautiful, pools very well maintained, huge variety of stores on property and restaurants...wow! We rented a car for a day as all our other activities had transportation included - which I would definitely recommend taking advantage of that. Each bus driver also acted as a tour guide and provided alot of information about the island. We rented a car and drove to the other side of the island one day and enjoyed the beaches, scenery and Dole Planation. We also hiked Diamond Head, took a helicpoter ride around the island, toured Pearl Harbor and went to the Polynesian Cultural Center. All activities were awesome! It was a pleaure coming back to the hotel each night and on Fridays, there are fireworks on the beach. It was both romantic and fun. Definitely a wonderful hotel for both families and couples.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Had the best time ever--loved the beach, the hotel was excellent, so beautiful with all it amenities. Fabulous meals with Luau and outside bars were awesome. Had something to do everyday with entertainment, shopping and beach activities. Had a wonderful time--especially for the cost. Everything right there.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower in May in a one-bedroom suite and were very disappointed. The real problem was the carpet and the dated AC system. The carpet needed to be cleaned big time. The AC is older and can only be turned on or off. You can't set it to a specific temperature, you can only move the lever warmer or colder. It doesn't click off when it reaches a specific temperature; it continually runs. For the bedroom to get cool, the living room is freezing. There is no exhaust van in the bathrooms and no ceiling fans in the unit.The 3 elevators are slow because they shared by housekeeping and maintenance. They have no service elevators. I am a Hilton Diamond member and stay in a hotel approximately 80+ nights per year. In terms of AC and carpet cleanliness, this was one of the worst I've stayed at in years. Hampton Inns are much nicer.That said, this is my third visit to the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The first two times we stayed at The Grand Waikikian and The Rainbow Tower, and these visits were a positive experience. I would recommend either of these. The grounds at the entire complex are well kept and beautiful. The employees are polite but not friendly. If the Lagoon Tower is your only option, stay at another hotel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My family and I stayed in this resort from May 16 to may 22nd and we had a wonderful time. The staff are wonderful. The location of hotel is excellent. There are stores, restaurant and shopes open until mid-night. Rooms are large and the beds are so comfortable. We really enjoyed and we will come back.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: As a Timeshare owner, was most distressed by the dirty room at time of check-in. The Internet router had to be replaced during our stay. The Luau, which Hilton has on the roof of the parking garage is really noisy for the residents of the two nearby towers.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Hilton has thought of all the ways to make staying and vacationing fun at this huge complex with all the options. The evening of fireworks were fantastic - have never seen such a display at such close range for nearly 6,000 people. The ability for everyone to have a good seat was excellent. The pools were terrific - especially loved the tube water slide running through the rocks. Everything was very clean. The free DVD Kiosk was a nice touch. Staff were attentive to every aspect.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Although this is the older tower and perhaps dated the position makes up for it the views from the rooms especially the higher floors overlooking diamond head are great. We have been many times to this hotel and yes it is a walk into the main area of Waikiki but other benefits compensate for this,We will definitely return as soon as we can.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After reading mixed reviews about this property on here, I was almost afraid to arrive but at first, was pleasantly surprised. We were given a studio on the 19th Floor, which is very dated but clean, and that is important! It is literally right next to the elevators so the noise level can get pretty bad at times. The view is okay but because we wanted a king bed instead of two doubles, we look at the harbor instead of the lagoon/ocean.The bigger problem is the management of this property. We've been here since Saturday and had to request a light bulb be put in the bedside lamp 4 times before it finally was accomplished! They kept saying they would bring it right up, only to not follow through until my husband finally went down and made enough noise that a manager got involved and once he was made aware of the situation, even he agreed that we were right to expect better service than this. Hubby likes to read and all we asked for was one light bulb. 3 days to get one is unacceptable. We were also quite surprised to learn there are no ice machines in this building so if you want ice, you literally have to call housekeeping for it and guess what? They are the same folks who could not scare up a light bulb. So disappointing. In this day and age, no ice on each floor or at least every 5th floor or so?We realize renovations have been taking place for awhile but do not understand why no one seems to be checking on the state of the rooms before they get assigned. There are only 2 of us but we still think at least 2 towels each would be good. Instead, we each get one towel. We'd like to ask for more but when we call housekeeping, the phone rings endlessly. I just noticed that the tv remote has dead batteries but do not feel it is worth having to get a manager involved just to get them.Also, we valet parked the first day and the next morning, it seemed there was only one valet for the entire property and it took forever to get our car. And for this we pay $33. Seems wrong to us. So wrong.HGVC is definitely not staying on top of things here and it is disappointing to fly all this way and be made to feel like our business/ownership doesn't matter. It seems obvious that they are catering more to "prospective" buyers, which puts a damper on the whole "vacation club" feel. Instead it is more like we are simply stuck up here and forgotten and the staff simply wishes we'd leave them alone. As owners, we expected much more from the Hilton family and nobody should have to work so hard at having a vacation here. We are left with the impression that now that we have purchased, they no longer need to impress us. That is just inexcusable. When we were prospective buyers ourselves, we were treated much better than this.We are not demanding people. We simply would like the same treatment that others are gushing about on here. When you can't get a simple request accomplished without having to practically beg for what should have been taken care of before we ever arrived, it does not make for a "grand"vacation. No one's vacation should be filled with having to worry that each little thing you might need will become a big. Housekeeping staff here seems to operate on their own and if they are in the mood to be helpful, you are lucky. What a shame. We will not be returning.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The facilities are beautiful. The view the best. Sunset from the balcony was spectacular. The beds were cozy. It was a great experience and my 5th time back. The hotel staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Thank you for another great stay in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I am writing this review to answer some questions others may have had about this resort. I know I had some questions prior to going. This might be a long review. Originally I had booked my husband and I for 7 nights at the Lagoon tower in a studio using HGVC club points because that was all that was available. A few weeks prior to departure I was able to change to 5 nights in a 1 bedroom in the Kalia Tower Ocean view and the remaining 2 nights in the Lagoon tower studio due to vacancies coming open. The airfare I found at a good price had us arriving after 10:00PM, so I decided to fly in the day before our timeshare was to start and booked 1 night at the Hilton adjoining hotel for 50,000 points. We are Hilton Honors Diamond members and were able to get a free upgrade to Ocean View in the Rainbow Tower. Wow, what a score. I apologize that I did not take any photos. We were very tired when we arrived, but I can say the room was recently updated with very nice new furnishings a huge flat screen TV. I know, we are in Hawaii, why worry about that, but we do enjoy a nice TV, while in the room. We were able to get a 4:00PM check out, so we had the room until our timeshare was ready. This was nice to relax in after being out our first day, we were adjusted from Central Daylight Time.On Saturday, we checked into the Kalia 1 bedroom, I posted photos. It is wonderful as it faces straight out towards the ocean. You are further back in the resort and if you look straight down you see the roof of a large building, but just look beyond it to the sea and smile. It is a little noisy on the balcony due to the traffic from Ala Moana street during busy times of the day. There are 2 balconies, 1 off the living room and one off the bedroom. The bathroom is very large and has access from both the living room and the bedroom, which is extremely convenient if someone is using the sleeper sofa. We did not have guests with us, but it is great knowledge for the future. There was plenty of storage in the bedroom as well as in the living room for guests clothes, etc.We bought milk, coffee, eggs, wine and sourdough bread at the ABC store. They had a larger selection at the ABC by the Grand Waikikian Tower. I brought packaged ready to eat bacon from home, coffee filters, Crystal Light (both Pitcher and individual sizes) Microwave popcorn. These little things helped save some money on eating out. We did usually have leftovers from eating out and it was nice to have the facilities for warming and eating our leftovers.Our last 2 nights were at the Lagoon Tower Studio. Sorry I didn’t get photos, we checked in after Happy Hour and just need to crash a bit. It is spacious for a couple. The room we ended up receiving had 2 double beds, would have preferred a king, but it had a great view of Diamond Head, the Resort, Lagoon and Ocean. The furnishings are all new with a huge dresser with lots of drawer space, a huge flat screen TV, Large closet. There is a small table and chairs, a full size coffee maker (we are big coffee drinkers, so appreciate the large coffee maker instead of the normal small ones). There is a mini fridge, a large microwave and dishes and cutlery for 2. Our room 2162, was a lock off to a 1 bedroom and across from the elevators, but we never heard anything.To finalize everything, we loved the extra space in the Kalia 1 bedroom, so if one of the guests woke up early they could go in the living room and not wake the other . but to stay a few extra nights in Hawaii, the studio was good too. We love the Hilton Hawaiian village location. Both the beach and lagoon had plenty of space and great views. In 15 minutes walking you can be at the Ala Moana shopping center. In fifteen minutes the other direction, you pass through a very nice park at Ft De Russy on the way to Shorebird for $3.50 Mai Tais during Happy Hour and dinner at Dukes. A great trip can’t wait to come back.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After my wife and I turned down the timeshare opportunity in Las Vegas in March 2012, Hilton Grand Vacation Club (HGVC) wanted another bite on the apple, so they offered us a two-bedroom suite at the Lagoon Tower at Hilton Hawaiian Village for seven nights for $1695 with 18 months to use it. They call it the Vacation Introductory Program, or VIP. Birth of granddaughter in late 2012 put April 15-22, 2013 as ideal timing. We would not have purchased it if deadline to use was 12 months or less. They put us in the 10th Floor, on the south end of the building, facing the ocean, for spectacular views!One friend accompanied my wife and I, so two bedroom, two full bath suite was ideal. Spacious living room, dining room, kitchen with pantry closet, and two lanais(balconies). We used the lanai with table and four chairs almost daily.This unit, probably rated for 800 sq ft or more, an end unit facing the ocean, was so nice, so comfortable! We had a great time and we really liked the unit!The Lagoon Tower was constructed in 2000, so it is between brand new and old. Other hotels in the Hawaiian Village, Hilton's largest complex worldwide, vary in age, up to the rather new Grand Wakaiian. The Lagoon Tower replaced kitchen appliances on one floor during our week. If this is part of program it will keep the hotel fresh, but we saw appliances removed were like ours and ours were in quite nice condition. I travel on business, and as much as I would like for the maintenance staff to check all working devices - lamps, faucets, other - reality is that hotel guests must check them and report deficiencies. The Lagoon Tower maintenance crew gets a 100% rating in promptness and effectiveness in dealing with light bulbs and a slow draining tub. (Another rater reported a dim bathroom; management would be well served to coach guests about reporting small and large deficiencies that result in internet-posted complaints solvable with a $1.00 bulb).I missed the instructions for lining up lanai doors with sensors at night, to enable the A/C to run. Maintenance explained it, the A/C was not broken. Lagoon Tower management may deal with this repeatedly; they would be well served to provide creative graphical instructions, maybe on a magnet on the fridge so everyone would see it.Some complaints by others seem out of place. Being bothered by housekeeping is just a clue the guests stayed in the room most of their housekeeping day(s). A distance to reach various features of the Village? The Village lies within an urban setting no doubt, and you need to be prepared to walk on paved surfaces to have an enjoyable visit. The International Market is a one mile walk, as is the Top of Waikiki restaurant. Walks to the ABC store on-site, the fitness center in the Ali'i Tower, and other on-site facilities are short in comparison. We did not want to split all of our vacation between the beach and stores, restaurants, and the Intl Market. We wanted to get away from the Lagoon Tower on most of our seven days. A comfy Dodge Charger from Dollar at $240 for a week ballooned to $337 with fees and taxes, but it allowed us to come and go as we pleased. Use the self-service parking in the garage and pay the high price of $27 per day. The garage is adjacent and really close to the Lagoon Tower, as in 150 steps from the elevator doors, and you can walk to it without getting wet during rainstorms. Passengers and belongings can be unloaded even closer to the elevators, then you can pull into in the garage to park.On our first morning we drove to Foodland grocery store, the first challenge for the iphone (or GPS), but well under 10 miles and feasible outside of rush hour. ABC Stores, open to 12:30 am, are a second choice. We bought breakfast and snack food, which made for a few pleasant breakfasts on the lanai. The kitchen was well equipped. Wailana Coffee House, one block away, also was excellent, but go before 730 am to beat crowds. Breakfast for three ranged from $19 to $25, reasonable in an otherwise high priced town.It helps to be comfortable driving and maneuvering about a city environment, but if you are, the Lagoon Tower is a great base to use to drive and see on your own schedule the Iolani Palace and nearby old churches, the WWII Memorial with the USS Arizona, the North Shore and Waimea Vally Park, the Flea Market, and several other attractions. The fitness center is not large enough to accommodate all interested guests in the morning, We hope management turns their attention to this, one additional fitness center is in order. But this is Hawaii, so when the treadmills were tied up at sunup, a long brisk walk on the beach, in nearly perfect air temperature, was a memorable alternative. Beautiful beach and water are adjacent to the hotel, for a break from driving and walking or hiking day trips. Rock jetties and south facing of Waikiki Beach mean waves are non-existent, so forget about using the whitewater surf (Boogie) boards. Go to the North Shore if you have to surf. Buy a tube from the ABC Store for $4.00, blow it up, slather on sunblock lotion as the sun is rather intense, bring some cash so you can buy ice cream at the DQ in the Rainbow Tower for lunch (75 ft from our beach towel), and enjoy. We will return.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: If you are going to the Hilton Hawaiian Village on Oahu, Hawaii staying at either the Lagoon Tower or the Rainbow Tower seeking rest, relaxation, and comfort FIND SOMEWHERE ELSE TO STAY!! I stayed at the Lagoon Tower for two weeks and was utterly disappointed and exhausted by the time I got home from vacation. There is a piece of land between the Lagoon Tower and the Rainbow Tower that was and is used daily for buffets, luaus, corporate parties, and private parties. The set up for these events begins at 4:30 a.m. when the staff is putting up tables, chairs, dishes, and meal buffet tables without consideration of the hotel guests just above them trying to sleep in their rooms. The staff talks, laughs, and works moving carts across the sidewalks to the grassy areas making a great deal of noise until the customers arrive around 7:00 a.m. The noise of these customers is additionally loud enough to awaken everyone in both Towers. The evening events set up begins around 4:00 p.m. and customers usually arrive around 6:30-7:30 p.m. The noise from the evening festivities lasts usually until 9:30 p.m. but one night it continued on until 10:30 p.m.If there is any kind of music during the evening events it is usually turned up so loudly that I could not hear the television in my room with the lanai door and windows closed! And the night the music continued until 10:30 p.m. was so loud that it shook my windows and lanai door! Had I known I would be enduring this kind of noise daily I would not have stayed at this hotel!There was a corporate private party for 3 or 4 days during my visit so there were daily morning buffets, nightly dinners, and one day in which the entire lagoon was closed down to all hotel guests so the corporate private party could use it for a “team building exercise”.The hotel itself is lovely; nicely appointed rooms, spacious lanais, beautiful landscapes surrounding the facilities, large enough rooms, comfortable furniture, and the condo-type rooms with kitchens are spacious and have full-sized appliances. The lighting particularly in the bathroom was very dim and there was no fan to exhaust the steam after showering. For those staying in the timeshare or condo facilities there are laundry appliances down the hall and they are free which is a nice bonus. The lagoon is an excellent place to swim, paddle board, snorkel (yes there are small fish in that lagoon!), and to lay out in the sun by--it's a great place especially for families with children since there aren't any waves and it is spacious enough for everyone. There are really nice places to swim—the “super pool” where they have three different slides (usually extremely crowded), a larger pool by the Rainbow Tower that was very nice, a smaller pool by the Tapa Tower, and the lagoon between the Rainbow and Lagoon Towers. If you're staying in the condo-type portion of the Lagoon Tower housekeeping is done only once a week. They will make your beds but not change the sheets and it appeared they never vacuumed.I stayed on the 6th floor facing the Rainbow Tower, the lagoon, and the ocean. The views were absolutely exceptional and if it weren't for the noise I would have absolutely LOVED this room!My impression was that the Hilton Hawaiian Village values the additional money received from the private parties more than they value providing rest, relaxation, comfort, and good customer service to their hotel guests! There was never any mention of compensation or appreciation for what the guests had to endure during these daily early morning wake ups or later evening disturbances of exceptional noise from the hotel management.One day when I inquired from the concierge what the price of the breakfast buffet and luau was for hotel guests I was told that those activities were just for private parties and that the hotel guests were not invited. I think (or hope!) the concierge was only addressing activities for that particular day as opposed to every activity done in that space daily! While I enjoy parties, good music, eating and drinking with friends I did not enjoy the early mornings and late evenings filled with tremendous noise when I was on a vacation. I would definitely NOT recommend a stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village if you’re looking for rest, relaxation, and comfort because that’s exactly what you will not get!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I made our last trip to Hilton Hawaiian Village in April. We were there from April 9 - 19th. We didn't know it was the end of the rainy season, but had two days where it rained all day. That didn't stop us from having a great vacation. I've been to the HHV several times, however this will be our last. The cost of flying is prohibitive. We used airline miles to fly and I no longer have enough points to do this again. I always enjoy HHV. This was our first stay in the Lagoon Tower. We stayed in a Studio for three of the days we were here and then moved over to the Grand Waikikian. We were on the 20th floor facing Diamond Head. The view was very nice but this particular room doesn't have a balcony. The room was pretty small. There is a sink, and microwave and a few dishes, but no stove or dishwasher. The room had two double beds which seemed small since we have a queen bed at home. The room is advertised for two people and that's probably all you would want to have. We hadn't made any specific requests and were surprised to have a room so high. However, we didn't spend a lot of time waiting for an elevator either. Since we were in a Studio, we knew this was actually a second or third bedroom of a two or three bedroom suite. That being the case, we did hear voices and sounds from the kitchen of the next room. However the folks didn't keep us awake and the level of sound wasn't that bad. We could hear voices but not understand what they were saying. Also, after we turned the lights out we could see light under the door to the next room if someone was there. The main drawback was the bathroom. There is only one sink which isn't surprising for a Studio, but the lighting was inadequate. Nothing fancy about the bathroom. But then again, you don't usually spend a lot of time there either. However my wife had a hard time fixing her hair since the lighting wasn't very bright. From the time we could make a reservation we tried to find a Studio at the Kailia Tower since I was told those Studio rooms were larger. However none ever opened up. Once at HHV we found out that there are very few Studio rooms in the Kalia Tower. If we had to stay at the Lagoon Tower in a Studio for our entire stay, we wouldn't have been very happy, but this was only for us to acclimate ourselves to the time change and then move over to the Grand Waikikian. I'll make a separate review of that part of the stay under that accommodation.Just a couple of points outside of the Kalia Tower review. Parking is very expensive for overnight parking. It's $27 a night. Also, you will find that the Hertz desk is only open from 6am to 1pm. But we also found that you can drop your key off on the 5th floor of the parking garage anytime and not be charged for an overnight parking stay if you only want to keep the car for 24 hours. In other words, when you are finished with the car, turn in your key at the drop box along with your parking stub and you shouldn't be charged for that day. When we wanted to keep the car for more than one day, we went to the front desk and informed them that we would be keeping a car overnight. They will give you a pass card for the parking garage. The pass card allows in and out privileges for the time you have the car in the parking garage. When you have turned in the car, return the card to the front desk so that they will not charge you any more nights. If you only keep the car for a day, you won't need the pass card. Just turn in your key to the drop box when you are done. Parking without the pass card is like $8 per hour. So you want to avoid keeping the car in the garage for very long. Something that might help is that there is parking at the Marina next to the property. Lot "A" will cost $6 per hour. However, a little know secret that is mainly known by the locals is on that same marina is parking at no cost. However, the sign says it's for people going to the beach and so forth. If you are only going to be there for a short period, it might be possible to find a parking space in that area if all you need is an hour or so. However, that parking is only open until 10pm in the evening. And it's very popular so it might be hard to find a parking space. All in all, I love going to Hawaii and staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village. The Studio in the Lagoon Tower was fine for the time we were there, but it would have been very close if we had stayed there for our entire stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: this was our first vacation as a family. our 4 year old and our 2 year old really were overwhelmed with all the cool things going on (especially the fireworks on friday night). it was a good atmosphere for our family. we felt safe and were treated very well while there. one caution, be prepared to spend 27-33 dollars a night for parking if you plan on renting one. there is no parking otherwise.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Just spent a week at the HHV. I had a 2 bedroom condo in the Lagoon tower. The place is a city unto itself. I found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The grounds were impeccably maintained and the beach in front of the resort was great with a sandy bottom. A bit further down, the beach does have a rocky bottom.I would recommend this hotel without hesitation and would stay there again in a second. It currently ranks as my favorite hotel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Condo is set in Hilton Hawaian Village. Beautiful pools, landscape and beaches. A wonderful trip with many restaurant choices and shopping is plentiful. Enjoyed hula lesson and luah. Perfect vacation spot. We are planning a return trip.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: THE ROOM WE WERE PROVIDED WAS NOT AS AGREED (LOCATION, ROOM TYPE, ALL OF IT !!!) Our room was facing a BUSY STREET (with typical 2AM LOUD motorcycle races, heavy trucking, etc.) and a parking lot - THERE WAS NO VIEW OF OCEAN AS HAD BEEN AGREED BEFORE WE CAME !!!! Our rooms were strangely/partially "wheelchair-accessible" rooms but there were MANY DANGEROUS CONDITIONS (including BNLT bathtub !!!, insufficient grabs, sharp edges on wide/heavy sliding bathroom door, too many doors, doors in the wrong places, etc.) and stupid situations (including BNLT all pots, pans, dishes, etc were stored in very high cabinets above 'frig and stove hood - for a "wheelchair-accessible" accommodation??? Are you kidding ???). Furniture and beds did not smell nice (We bought Fabreze, which helped a little.) Sofabed was broken and almost impossible to open. HVAC did not work (There was no notice that HVAC would not work if any door was open. HVAC filter in bedroom was FILTHY !!!)

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
