review_body: This wasn't a grand vacation. We were given a confirmed reservation in a two bedroom suite and a few weeks before travel we got an ambush call that said, "Oh. You have seven people, you can't stay in that room." Hilton knew that we were seven people from day one. Somehow they changed their mind and gave us two one bedroom suites, on different floors, put us in a different tower far from the beach, and we had no choice, It was that or nothing.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Kalia Tower this time around because it was the only tower with two bedroom timeshares available. First of all, after reading some negative reviews, I thought that we would get terrible customer service, but we were pleasantly surprised. Not only were we waited on as soon as we stepped out of our car, but we were even carted to the Kalia Tower since we mistakenly checked in at the Grand Waikikian desk. Every employee we encountered was courteous and welcoming - including housekeeping!Upon arriving at the Kalia, we were handed a DVD card with unlimited rentals! Our oceanview suite was immaculate and had all the comforts of home included unlimited internet access and a laundry facility a few doors down the hall. It was quite a bit of a walk to get to the lagoon pool, but we enjoyed the hotel grounds - penguins, koi, different shops. Although our children enjoyed the lagoon pool with all the slides, it was nice to bask near a quiet, uncrowded pool on the 4th floor of our tower.Honestly the only complaint I have is the coffee provided in our kitchen. It was not very tasty. The Starbucks in the lobby had to take care of my coffee fix - and it did not come cheap!The food is quite pricey if you're visiting from out of state, but we chose to cook our meals in our kitchen out of convenience anyway. The ABC Store has reasonable rates for most everything you would need including drinks and food.Overall, a fantastic stay at a grand hotel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The resort caterers to Japanese tourists as they make up "65% of the ownership" at the hotel per several employees. The rooms are great and spacious - no rollaway beds. Tropics Restaurant - service very poor and food over priced for quality and quantity. Much better options off site.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: For the price, I recommend going elsewhere. Housekeeping does not knock when entering your room, and will constantly pester and inconvenience you. The service is terrible and the food is awful. The food is greasy and you could get something of better quality at your local McDonald's. I recommend that, in fact, as it is much cheaper. The resort itself does look nice, though the industrialized city in the surrounding area is horrendous, plagued with graffiti and big crowds. The beach is also nothing to be proud of, crowded and dirty. Stay on one of the smaller islands if going to Hawaii, because Honolulu is not even worth passing by.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: There are so many people staying in the Hilton HGVC the place is crowded like a city. The rooms vary from studios that are minute to apartments and the quality varies depending on how old the tower you are staying in is.But the biggest problem is Waikiki as it is a high rise hell! If you want to see hawaii's beautiful beaches and volcanoes stay out of Waikiki, I would stay on a different island.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Loved the 2 br condo for our family of 5. Perfect accomodations. Having the full kithen and washer/dryer makes being away just a bit easier with the kids. We also enjoyed haing a ps3 with free game/movie rental. The only drawback is tge 4pm checkin though we wre lucky an got in early.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: You will feel like you are a special guest at this resort. From front desk, to housekeepers, wait staff, the trip planners, etc. They are all very friendly and helpful. The food IS EXPENSIVE. Its Hawaii. Everything is going to be expensive, you have to come to terms with that before you ever get off the plane there. The breakfast in the lower level of the Rainbow tower...amazing, fresh, homemade, omelet station, all kinds of muffins being baked before your eyes, everything you would want..and good....But...it cost about $60 ish for two of us each morning. But it was worth it. Best food and kept us going all day. I enjoyed the live music right outside out window in Rainbow tower (rm 2421) but some have complained of that as being noise. I found it very vacation like. The resort, as well as the entire area is very very touristy, with a side of paradise. There are plenty of small nooks and crannies all along the resort and beach that you can have to yourself and the place was completely booked when we were there. Do your research on trip adviser about luaus and outings and plan your trip ahead...you will be very overwhelmed if you just show up with no plan. It is a HUGE place. Easy to get lost the first couple of days. Dont worry, you will get the hang of it. and last but not least ...make the ABC store your personal friend the first day and every day to keep costs down on food and supplies and even souvenirs. Mahalo and Aloha.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed for 3 nights -- March 14th -17th. We were greeted with Lei's and a speedy check-in. We stayed in a 2 bedroom penthouse suite in the lagoon tower, which my kids absolutely loved. There were stairs leading to a top level with bedrooms. The room was showing a few signs of aging, but it was very clean. I've read the reviews about the noise, and we could hear the luau, but it was very faint and didn't bother us. I would suggest getting a floor as high up as possible to avoid the noise, but I would still stay on the ocean side because the views of Waikiki Beach were fabulous. If you are looking for a quiet getaway, this isn't the resort for you. It's definitely crowded, but we had no problems with service, and the staff was very friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The staff at a couple of the restaurants and even housekeeping and front desk staff seemed "put off" by the asking of questions. The overall attitude of employees was lacking. However; our room at Kalia Tower was fantastic and the Hilton Village grounds/pools/amenties for families is great! We will definitely stay here again. We will just be sure to fill out comment cards on the attitudes of the staff/personnel.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stay here every year as this is our home resort for time share. We LOVE IT! We also had an extra hotel room for family in the same tower this year. Very convenient. Facility is very well kept, clean, and employees are really nice. Housekeeper on our floor (14) was very nice and accommodating when we needed an extra towel etc. Front desk staff in Kalia was GREAT.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Our family left the resort March 17 and we had a wonderful 5 day stay. The resort is very beautiful, clean, and the staff is friendly. We had a bad experience with the Round Table restaurant on property but, other than that, the stay was everything that my family and I hoped for with this resort. We stayed in the Kalia tower with the mountain view 1bedroom/1 bath with full kitchen. Tropics staff was kinda slow and that restaurant is VERY pricey. Overall, we would stay there again and recommend to anyone looking for a great stay in Hawaii.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We spent 6 nights in a 1Bdrm/1Bath with a sofa-sleeper in the Lagoon Tower and really enjoyed our stay. We wanted a condo, but also wanted to be close to the beach and this proved to be the best option-we were not disappointed. We are not "timeshare" owners so we booked as hotel guest through the Hilton Grand Vacations website (note this is different than regular HHV hotel website-I think I linked to it from the Tripadvisor site). We checked in at the lobby of the Grand Waikikian and everyone was extremely friendly and helpful, I requested and was given a bit of a later checkout. Our room was on the 11th floor on the Diamond Head side of the hotel and our ocean view from the lanai was fabulous, we sat out there every morning for coffee and ate several meals there. The 11th floor is not high enough to see down the beach and Diamond Head because of the Ali tower, but what you can see is fabulous. The unit was spacious and clean and the kitchen had everything we needed for our stay. The 2 kids had plenty of room on the sofa sleeper and our bedroom with the king was large. Housekeeping came everyday since we were "hotel" guest and not owners and did a fabulous job, even loading and running the dishwasher. It never felt crowded in the Lagoon Tower and the elevators were fast. You don't pay resort fees when you stay in the vacation suites but get all the same amenities, like free wifi, DVDS/games etc., but you still have to pay to park. We were very happy with our room and would stay again, I would probably go for a 2brm unit next time just for the extra beds, but a 1bdrm would work fine if you have kids that will sleep together on the sofabed.The resort itself is beautiful and every employee we encountered was friendly. Is it busy? Yes, but it's a large resort with lots of rooms, so it's what I expected. Was it overcrowded? No, Waikiki is a busy place and all the hotels and resorts are the same, as are the streets and sidewalks and restaurants. We had no trouble finding a spot on the sand or chairs by the pools. If people are not your thing, than I suggest maybe you consider one of the the other islands, or resorts on the other side of Oahu. As others have said, the HHV is pretty self-contained with shops and restaurants, so you really don't have to leave the property if you don't want to. I can't imagine not exploring the rest of Waikiki and Oahu and its great shopping and dining, but if you want to arrive at HHV and just hang-out you can. It's it nice short stroll up the beach to the heart of Waikiki and all she has to offer, but the HHV location lets you avoid the traffic noise and hustle and bustle that goes with that location while still being perfectly close.Check-out was quick and smooth and we were given lounge access to use between check-out time and when we left for the airport. My family really loved their first visit to Hawaii and HHV, I have been to Honolulu several times and have stayed at other locations. Based on that, I highly recommend the Lagoon Tower at HHV and would happily stay there again. Our stay could not have gone better.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Service was not so great. Bartenders and wait staff at Tropics were slow, if responsive at all. Housekeeping didn't begin to clean our room until well after 3p every day of our 6 days, except on the day of our departure...they were wanting to clean our room at 11a. Staff at the pool at the Ilikai'i were laying down towels for other guests, even though as guests, we were not allowed to do the same thing for ourselves. For the price, I'd stay elsewhere next time...and I'm a Hilton Honors member.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Once we made it to the hotel we we greeted with "ALOHA" and bell man assisted us getting bags in storage since we were early! Friendly front desk!! This was my granddaughters first trip 'ANYWHERE" with ages of 26 and 25! We climbed Manoa Mtn to get to a great waterfall. It was nice to get back to Kahlia and get off our feet. Here is where room service would have been really special!! The Hilton Village is really special. Shops, stores, restaurants and Friday night fire works!! What a Blast - we had a great timeWARNING: Front desk keeps too much cash in top drawer! Set up fro front desk is set up without a counter so you can see right into the drawer holding the cash!! I pray it never happens but that was easy pickin' for a robber

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed here because we got a killer deal for airfare and thought it would be a change of pace to stay so close to Waikiki. Honolulu has gotten so big since we visited last! The service was great. Everyone is friendly and they want to be helpful. We called for ice and they brought it. We wanted a blender (yes, the ice and blender where used together) and that was brought as well. The rooms were nice and clean. We stayed in a studio, and had a view of the fireworks from our room on Friday night on the beach.Here's the issue...the noise level from the bar and luau below the towers will echo. When I say echo, I mean it was completely annoying and impossible to relax in your room at night with all the racket. We hit it hard all day and want to relax at night! We asked to be moved (sold out), but they were able to accommodate us the last couple of nights. What a difference! On the other side of the lagoon tower (garden side) no echo! Not quite the view (see the harbor, which is not that bad), but you can have a quiet evening. We brought a collapsible cooler and picked up fruit and sandwiches to take with us for lunch. We hit a Starbucks for breakfast. That really reduced the cost of eating. Since we had a studio, we couldn't cook like we would in a one bedroom.So, if you are thinking of staying at the HGVC in the lagoon tower, get a one bedroom and request the garden view side. We were in a studio and you get a room where they can fit you in. You have a much better chance of being on the other side (quieter) when requesting a one bedroom. I would have a limited view over peace and quiet. You can then go to a Costco (outside of Honolulu...the one in Honolulu is the busiest in the USA), and get food to take back for dinner. You don't have to spend as much as others to eat while in Hawaii!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: And no real room service. Seriously? Self-serve breakfast buffet $28/adult and $14/kid, plus tax and tip. If it was something better than your basic buffet, that would be one thing, but it's not: the usual congealed scrambled eggs and so on. The place is overcrowded and impersonal; there are long lines for elevators, front desk and restaurant service. My kids loved the pools, and our room was pleasant and had a great view. I would not return, however: crowds and crummy, overpriced food will keep me away.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed here for 8 nights in march with my husband and two toddlers. It's about a 15 min walk to the main strip and same to ala moana mall; there's also a free trolley that takes you to both places. This is our 6th time in hawaii, we usually stay right on the main strip but we wanted to try a more more family friendly hotel this time. They have penguin and turtle feeding mon-fri at 8am, my kids loved it. We all had a great time and will definitely stay again. Ww rented a one bedroom suite with a partial ocean view in the lagoon tower with full kitchen. I'll know next time to get a full ocean view because that way you can watch to fireworks from your own balcony on Friday nights to avoid the crowd if you have kids. All the staff was so friendly and helpful. We also had a great time at their luau, it was huge so you can bring tour stroller and they have plenty of high chairs.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is our second trip to the resort. We have stayed at two different towers and enjoyed both. They have a great assortment of rooms \ towers to accomodate needs for both couples and families. The lagoon is wonderful. You get the beach experience but it is less crowded and the water is a little warmer and easier to just relax in. It is close to the pool bars so getting food or drinks is easy.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Very helpful staff and great resort location. Clean and beautiful beaches. Rooms in Kalia tower could use some upgrades as they are starting to show their age. Overall, great experience. Only downfall was an extremely slow internet connection via Wifi.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After multiple calls to make sure we would have an ADA room at this property, we arrived to learn they had no ADA rooms available. The overall checkin process then took over an hour as the hotel staff tried to find an ADA room for us. After upgrading to a nicer room than what we have reserved, the room was ADA but not really for someone in a wheelchair. There was not shower chair and since I am a paraplegic this is a requirement. The hotel staff instructed me to use a chair from the balcony as a shower chair (not a great option nor a safe option at that). The next day the hotel allotted me a $50 budget to rent a shower chair from a local supplies house. I have had better experience with ADA rooms at properties without nearly the reputation for quality as Hilton.Oh, and then there were the cockroaches. Lots of them! Even on the 12th floor. The roaches appeared to be limited to the kitchen and most likely coming out of the drain. We did not see roaches in the bedroom.And then was the ADA support bar in the bathroom that broke off the wall. This then took them two days to fix.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed here last september.fab room.helpful staff.a two minute walk to the beach.would definately stay there again. Everything was within walking distance, cant fault it at all.Room were a nice size, cleaned everyday with fresh towels.had a good view as our floor was 26 floors up.good view of wakkiki beach, dismond head was to the left.greay views all round.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Last time I stayed at this property, I was in the Grand Waikikian which was wonderful. This time I was assigned to the Kalia Tower and at first I was somewhat disappointed but after the first night, I would request this tower again. Easy to get around, Starbucks right downstairs, room was smaller, which was fine with me as I had a 2 bedroom last time, by myself. Housekeeping has a lot to desire however it was fine for the 2 nights I was there.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed a week in the Lagoon Tower - 2 BDR Suite. The accommodations were --"OK" Housekeeping was poor, Table had dried syrup on it, carpeting needed to be cleaned as whoever spilled syrup on the table spilled on the carpet as well -- windows were smudged with little people fingerprints etc. All in all the room just was not all that clean. There is poor lighting in the living area.We had an Ocean View but mostly the view was of the Rainbow Tower. We were told that our floor was one that had not yet been renovated so.... be sure to ask - if you end up destined for this tower.Now ---- The staff was absolutely superb! People went out of their way to help us with any request and --- this place is sooooo large -- help us find our way around. Food in the restaurants was great as was the service. I feel like the Hilton Village is just too big. There is too much confusion and it's just way to crowded for my liking. If you like crowds and plenty of choices in food, stores and swimming pools then this would be a great place for you --- for me, I'll stay at an Outrigger or Marriott next time.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Huge hotel. good location close to Ala moana center & beach.a small world you could enjoy eating,sleeping, drinking, shopping & shows.enough parking space.stores & restaurants (both western and eastern food)open late till night.we like HANAJUBAN - a small noodle restaurant can satisfy your appetite if you are Chinese, korean or Janpanese.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My husband and I stayed in the Lagoon Tower for a week on a VIP package deal I got through my ownership at another Hilton Grand Vacations timeshare. (Please note, if you're considering staying here you probably want to also read reviews for the Hilton Grand Waikikian Suites and the Hilton Hawaiian Village Hotel since all of these are part of the same large resort complex (Hilton Hawaiian Village) and share restaurants, bars, and other amenities.) If not for the good package deal we likely would have selected another hotel, because big resorts like this tend to cater to families rather than couples looking for quiet time, and because we tend to spend more time out sightseeing than hanging around a resort using its amenities. With that in mind, our stay turned out nicer than I expected.Checking into Lagoon Tower was a bit of a hassle. Although HHV told us several times that Speedie Shuttle would drop us directly at the Lagoon Tower, Speedie Shuttle told us several times that they only pick up and drop off at the Grand Waikikian main lobby area a block away. Hotel and Speedie Shuttle need to communicate better on this, especially since check-in for Lagoon is at its own desk inside Lagoon Tower and not at the Grand main lobby area. We ended up having to schlep our bags a block from main lobby to Lagoon lobby and then schlep them up a very long ramp to another floor where the Lagoon check-in was (we couldn't find it on arrival since we weren't dropped at the Lagoon entryway by the shuttle), then back down the ramp to elevators to our room. Very confusing and tiring. (Note that the Tapas Tower bus area is on the opposite side of the large complex to the Lagoon Tower, so if you have luggage I do not recommend using any airport service that drops you there.) Our Lagoon Tower "ocean view" room was on the 10th floor overlooking a side street (Kahanamoku Dr.), but had a large balcony from which one could see ocean and mountains as well as a large local marina. No traffic noise as there isn't much traffic on that street, but we did get noise from (a) screaming kids all day at Paradise Pool which was almost directly under our bedroom (went away by about 7 pm when pool closed), (b) loud drumming, singing and announcements from the Hilton luau on top of one of the adjoining buildings in the evening (this was kind of atmospheric and went away by about 9 pm). We noted our room had a door that could be opened onto the next room, which usually means you can hear the person staying next door also, but the soundproofing seemed pretty good as we only heard them once the whole week. We had a living room with big balcony, full size kitchen with coffee maker and many cooking amenities, separate bedroom with very comfy king size bed, good size bathroom and two big closets - about the size of a one bedroom apartment. Lagoon Tower is an older building but is being renovated floor by floor and our room had reasonably new furniture, carpet and fixtures. Bathtub looked a little old but hand-held shower attachment worked great (high pressure) and considering that the tub probably sees tons of beach sand, I could understand its not being fancy. Biggest complaint was bathroom not having a window or a fan, just a passive ceiling vent which was not enough to remove odors, and also there was a musty old smell coming from either the bathroom sink plumbing or the drain all week. Hotel staff were all very nice and polite. As with most Hilton timeshares you only get housekeeping once all week, which I prefer because it cuts down on hall noise and people coming in your room, but the staff was very quick to bring towels or whatever else we needed in between. I was impressed that when our Wi-Fi modem connection quit, there was a dedicated help center to call and they sent a tech to our room to fix the problem. We rely on the Internet not only to stay in touch with work but also for booking the tours and activities we wanted to do (there's concierges to help if you want, but we like to choose our own) so a good connection was really important to us. There is a free penguin pool exhibit with a talk each morning by the keeper, which was cute and fun (we got to pet a penguin). We also tried out the HHV beach, Paradise Pool, Tropics bar/ restaurant and Bali Steak and Seafood restaurant. Beach - very clean, lots of room, and close to tower; daily fees for renting chairs and umbrella were steep (we flew so couldn't bring our own) but we only spent one day on the beach. No alcohol allowed on beach, but if you are discreet with your takeaway cup, no one is really policing it either. Paradise Pool - lots of kids, less than 5 feet deep, but still fun except that the water slide closes 2 hours before pool does and then you have kids jumping the gate to use it unattended while others try to crawl up it from pool end - a real safety hazard. We thought food and service were both good at the restaurants, although they were expensive and have a slower service pace than on the mainland. We did notice that Tropics, which doesn't take reservations, seems to have more customers than it can handle at dinner hours, and that Bali often seemed to be closed or only operating a limited number of tables (often not the beach view ones unfortunately). Lepperts coffee and Round Table Pizza are both very close to Lagoon tower and very good. The blocks surrounding the HHV complex are almost all large hotels, interspersed with a few ABC convenience stores, cheap diners and souvenir shops. So there's not much to walk around and see once you get "off-campus". The resort clearly would prefer you use the pricey shops and restaurants inside the resort. If you do not have a car and want to go out for kitchen groceries or other shopping, you need to walk a long way, or take the city bus (thebus dot org) or a "shopping trolley", either to the Ala Moana Mall (has a Foodland) or the other direction down Kalaukua (has Food Pantry and more convenience stores). The closest bus/ trolley stops to Lagoon Tower are the ones at Ala Moana/Opp. Kalia, and Ala Moana/ Hobron. Overall a nice time, but a bit crowded like Disney World. We understand Hilton is opening a new "urban timeshare" (Hokulani Hilton) with smaller, more modern suites located closer to the shops and restaurants in Waikiki, and that would probably be more our speed than this large family-oriented resort.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton Hawaiian Village and Resort is lovely and well run. The room was perfect with a beautiful view of the ocean and marina. The swimming pools and lagoon were great. Everything was convenient and within walking distance.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful property in great location. ABC convenience store has basic foods for eating in room. CJ's Deli and Round Table Pizza are good light food options, but Hilton restaurants are mediocre. Easy walk to Waikiki restaurants, tho. Bus service good for travel to local attractions. Hilton staff were especially friendly and helpful. Don't miss the Friday night fireworks on the beach.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Absolutely beautiful property. When you first arrive finding your tower can be a bit challenging, especially when you're tired from the long travel time. There are plenty of activities but be prepared to pay...it's a pretty expensive place to travel to. I would suggest buying your own snorkeI mask and doing your own. Also don't expect to be happy with jet skiing. When I inquired at the activities desk I was quoted $200+ for 20 min and you couldn't go off on your own. You had to follow a set path which was basically in a circle...where's the fun in that. However I give very high kudos to Mandarin Spa...now that was such a wonderful treat. I would agree with another review in that there's no real room service...one restaurant will deliver with an $8.00 service fee as well as a nice gratuity added and they were the only option for such a huge property. There's so much opportunity for shopping...stores and malls everywhere and if you love Macy's you'll really be happy. They seem to be on every corner along with Starbucks

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful property, some rooms very dated. No real room service. Bar staff has poor attitude. Went there for the Pro Bowl. It is within walking distance of great restaurants and shopping. If you do stay at Hawaiian village, avoid the Hilton restaurants and go across the street to the shopping area, food and service are so much better, and they appreciate you. Benihana was also great!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is the hotel where Elvis stayed when he was on Oahu for the performance of the '73 Aloha concert so it was a natural choice for Elvis Presley Enterprises. Hilton properties are always a cut above most and this is no exception. The construction on the property was a bit of a challenge but between the hotel and EPE folks were stationed in strategic locations with signs to get us from point A to B and beyond. Appreciate that extra thoughtfulness.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We passed the New Year on HGV Suites at Hilton Hawaiian Village. The room we got was ok, clean and with a nice beach view. We payed $569 per day for one studio with kitchenette, without kitchen sink in the room... But for us, the worst thing was that Hilton in this time had a very poor celebration... We didn't have nothing extra or special to celebrate the New Year, neither a bottle of champagne in the room or even a garnish on the door... In the last year we went to the HGVC in Orlando and we had all. In the next New Year we 'd probable go back to Orlando!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We went on holiday with other families (including 7 children) and found that the Hilton Hawaiian Village was great in catering for the kids. It's in a great location, about a 5-7min walk from the main street in waikiki. There are plenty of things for the kids to do including water activities and daily entertainment (i.e. feeding penguins, fish etc). I would definitely stay in the same place again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Grand Hilton Resorts are great resorts to stay at. Great locations and consistently clean and upscale. They can provide you all that you need to make your vacation a pleasant and enjoyable trip. I have been to several difference resorts and they were all very comfortable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The room we got was fabulous, nice and big clean and airy.However I had been hoping for much more from this Hotel.They claim the "Biggest Pool" in Hawaii - they have got to be kidding. This might have applied in the 1960s! They have far too many customers for the poor staff on the desk. I recieved three "Check Out" bills so far ALL of which were incorrect with added extras I had not used.Interesting as the customers in front of me were also complaining of the same problem. That little "added extra" or incorrect bar bill.To be honest I actually loved staying here BUT felt it overpriced and like a Butlins Holiday camp not a 4 star resort.My partner agrees with the above comments.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The Hilton is known for their hospitality... and although I have been to many worldwide locations, this location in Waikiki is probably the busiest or maybe it was because I landed there in the busiest times, New Years with long lines and many irritable guest, the front desk staff and the housekeeping staff were very helpful and pleasant. I believe If you have a great attitude about enjoying every moment, it will make it a great experience... no matter what....

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are diamond members and this was cubic zirconium level!We were stuck in there for one night.They told us they would move us. They were trying to string us along because the next day in the morning, they told us 'check back we will see what we can do, by 3:00 the story changed to 'we are completely sold out.'We called SPG and they confirmed it as sold out. We paid to move to a Hilton hotel. We were booked to stay Dec 18th Tuesday to Monday the 24th. No one would service our room for the entire stay, 6 nights. The room was already grossing us out.There was someone else's dark body hair in the bathroom on the floor and on the toilet. There was a piece of metal protruding from the floor. The room was like a box, small windows facing a bunch of balconies next door. The hotel is beautiful and I am sure there are some beautiful rooms - but it is not the Studios!!!We were told all the studios are exactly the same. Next to the elevator with limited views. Tired, worn furniture with an odd mix of new and old. They updated the countertops but put a faded sleep sofa in with beat up furniture.The bathtub was another oddity, it couldn't have be more than 4' long. There were some great employees and some not so great employees. I put poor for service because the hotel managers hide. You ask for them but they are not available. You call them and it goes to voicemail. The bell service, valet and concierge were all excellent. I was excited about going to this property but the room we were given was not up to the Hilton standard.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The resort is close to shopping and restaurants, and there are plenty of activities to choose from. The Kalia Tower pool was very cold, and I heard others saying all the pools were cold. A good reading light in the living area would have been nice too. Overall, I enjoyed the 1 bedroom unit I had and found it comfortable.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I am a Diamond Hilton Honors member and also a HGVC owner at Hilton Flamingo Las Vegas. We currently our staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village Lagoon Tower. I have stayed at all the Hilton properties in Hawaii at least once. The staff is excellent and the property is well maintained with a vibrant location in Waikiki. Now for the bad news : HGVC is a waste of your money ...don't bother ...our location in the Lagoon Tower is in the back of the Tower on a low floor overlooking the Illikai Parking lot and screeching kids in the Lagoon Pool. The beds are dreadful , I guess the sweet sleeper beds are reserved for Hotel Guests only at Hampton Inn and other Hilton Brands ..our mattresses must have been "army surplus" or second hand from the local prison. The room is good size for Hawaii and has a fully equipted kitchen ..If Hilton wants to retain loyalty they had better pay attention to the DETAILS of the amenities offered by HGVC because they are not up to the standards of the rest of their brand ...we contacted the management regarding the location and they said they were booked and could not make any changes ..they will call us if there is anything else that opens up ..the sad part is that the same thing happened last year in The Grand Waikikian Tower when we were given a room that the previous guest had smoked cigars ! Again there was nothing management could do EXCEPT assure me that the next time they would make sure our stay was exceptional ....so much for promises ... after 25 year career in management and marketing I have determined that the Hotel Timeshare Concept is fatally flawed, once captured the brand has no loyalty to the owners at least in this case . I also own fractional Jet and fractional Boat ownership and they provide excellent service and always exceed expectations ...HGVC is the weakest link in the Hilton Brand...IMO ...The Hotel side of Hilton is best in class ...the HGVC side of Hilton is mediocre at Best ...at least when Waikiki is concerned .

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower in a two bedroom suite and it was an incredible experience. The ambiance, amenities and location make the Hilton a desirable property to stay at. The property is large and has a mini shopping area which includes luxury items. There are a number of large pools for the kids and water activities at the lagoon for the adults. Because our suite had a large, functional kitchen, we bough groceries and cooked on site. The restaurant options directly outside the hotel property such as the coffee shop and Todai's were not desirable. You would have to drive or take the bus to the International Market area for a wider variety of restaurants and food vendors. Our suite was located overlooking the luau area, so we were able to watch from our spacious balcony. Overall an incredible visit.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in an ocean front 2BR 2BA unit on the 19th floor of the Lagoon Tower from Dec 22-Dec 29. Ocean front truly means ocean front, the two southern end units on each floor have balconies that front the ocean with no obstructions. The view was incredible. Condo was clean, nicely decorated and kitchen well stocked. Having a kitchen in Waikiki really helps - just being able to eat breakfast in your room can save big $$. Some other reviews mentioned music/noise from bars below - we heard them every night, even on the 19th floor. The music went late - bring ear plugs. They do the trick. Free laundry on each floor was great. I never waited for a machine. We had a car. A car in Waikiki is both a blessing and a curse. Parking at the Hilton Hawaiian Village is expensive - $25-$30 per night. We got a tip that you can park for free until 10:30pm in the lot directly across from the Lagoon tower, where all the locals park to surf. There is an overnight lot next to the free lot where you can park for 10 hours for $6. If you are willing to do a little work, you can save a lot on parking. Finding a spot in the free lot can be tricky during the day. Most visitors from the mainland are up early anyway so securing spot early in the AM is not so bad. I would recommend trying to get out of the complex at least a few times for a meal. Alan Wong's Pineapple Room is at Macy's at the Ala Moana shopping mall (walking distance)- even after reading questionable reviews, we thought the burger (at $15) and the Kailua Pig BLT were both incredible. Every burger in Waikiki is expensive - might as well get a good one. The Wailana Coffee house across from the Hilton had good breakfast food. Every breakfast place seems to do a good Coconut Macademia Nut pancake so use this trip as an excuse to eat something you would not normally. Restaurant Epic requires a car, but was probably turned out the best meal we had - roasted duck salad, cioppino, shrimp risotto, and short ribs with mac 'n cheese. Dessert was a french toast with nutella, macademia nuts and caramel. Also a car ride away was Cinnamon's - red velvet and guava chiffon pancakes. Ala Moana Mall had the biggest food court I have ever seen - lots of options, but definitely food court quality food. Fresh malasadas from Leonard's are worth the trip. We went to Costco and loaded up on basics - they had a fresh tuna poke bar which was really good. I still don't understand the appeal of the Loco Moco (hamburger over rice, topped with an egg and gravy). We ordered pizza from Roundtable in the Hilton complex the night of the fireworks - it was expensive and just OK. Still nice to have dinner on the balcony and watch the fireworks.The Hilton Hawaiian Village faces three well known surf breaks - Kaisers, Rock Pile, and Ala Moana Bowls. We watched the surfers go out every morning - some before dawn. Our son who regularly surfs in FL enjoyed Rock Pile. I think the other spots were more advanced. By Florida standards, the paddle out is long to all three breaks. Before I let him go out on his own, I made him take some lessons. We used Hans Hedemann in Waikiki and had a very good experience. They have a shuttle that can pick you up at the Hilton (pick up point can be a madhouse, many tours leave from the same spot in the Tapa Tower). Watch out for the reef - we don't have those where we live and it takes a while to get used to it. After lessons (Seth and Moses were both excellent instructors), we rented longboards from Hawaii Surfboard Rentals. They deliver and pick up - 2 day minimum, about $25 a day - much less expensive than the rental stands at the beach and you don't have to abide by the stand's hours. The Hilton has a special storage area for boards rented through third parties. My son was able to surf before 8:30am and after 4:30pm. We also tried stand up paddle boarding a couple of afternoons and really enjoyed that. The sea turtles swim right up to you if you paddle past the Hilton dock. Many reviewers have commented on how crowded the Hilton complex is. The days before Christmas were not so bad. In the days following Christmas, the crowds got considerably bigger and lines got much longer. The line to rent chairs/equipment and check out towels started well before 8:30am when the stand opened. With so many visitors coming from the mainland, the Hilton should really consider opening the stand earlier, especially during peak periods. There are over 3,000 rooms and maybe 3 stands throughout the property for rentals/towels. Fitness center was full every morning by 6am. Since we are from Florida, we don't do pools, hot tubs, or lie in the sun on vacation. However, every time we walked past the pool with the water slides, it was packed. Despite the crowds, I must note that we never waited very long for an elevator, even on check out day. Everyone was extremely friendly and we had an incredible trip. Would return to this property in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: All things considered, this property has everything to be had in Hawaii in a major resort destination. At the Hilton Hawaiian Village , it is clearly a destination property, and at the Grand Vacation club with the rooms that have a kitchen and dining facilities, its worth the price (and savings over constantly eating out). We found the kitchen well stocked with more then basic cooking utensils and once we walked around a bit, found some great grocery shopping for what we needed for some great in-room meals. This allowed us to splurge on some great meals out at other fine restaurants which were the usual high price of the islands, but given we hadn't eaten out for a couple of days it was no problem. The hotel property is quite large, so make sure you know exactly what tower/property in the 'village' you are booked into, so your cab or the Wiki bus from the airport (best value) drops you as close as possible to your tower/property as there are multiple in the village and you don't want to end up hiking with your luggage. Make sure to walk the property to get used to everything it has to offer, it is mostly beach front, and has its own private lagoon, so wander the property and get familiar with it, the pools tend to fill up their chairs early so plan accordingly. If you want to take the beach front boats, walk about 1/2 a mile towards Diamond Head where most of them 'park' on the beach and take on passengers. Ask the front desk if they have any coupons or check the coupon books on the blvd. Also across the street from the property (east) is a great cafe and breakfast stop for that one time you don't want to cook (try the banana pancakes). Also, watch for the nightly torch lighting at dusk, a great photo op. cheers,, uh AlooooHaaa,

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We recently stayed in a two bedroom in the Lagoon tower on the Hilton Hawaiian Village property. We requested a room overlooking the beach and lagoon and were very happy that they fulfilled our request. The staff were very friendly (for the most part) and we had no problems when needing assistance.The rooms were very spacious and provided everything we needed for a lovely stay. We were a bit disappointed with the master bathroom as we compared it to several other Hilton's we stayed in. Very basic no frills tub/shower combo. The master also didn't really have a proper closet that you could hang up dresses or suits in. This was slightly annoying,An issue we ran into was that on several nights there was extremely loud blaring music coming from one of the clubs on property. Yes, there was a Luau close by that took place, but the noise was always done by 930pm. Wherever this was coming from was extremely loud and happened between 1030 and midnight. None of us could sleep, including my 1 year old son, until it was over. It really put a damper on our vacation.Another issue we have (which it sounds as though they've been dealing with for a while) was cockroaches in the kitchen. They were scurrying around every time we turned the lights on in the room. Very gross and made us uncomfortable to leave food around. To the resorts credit, they did come in one day to 'spray' the kitchen to try and get rid of them. Sadly it worked for maybe 24 hours before they were back. As a Hilton hotel they really need to get this problem solved.The ground at this resort are beautiful. They have numerous pools, restaurants, shops and beaches. You really don't need to leave the resort for your entire vacation. My son loved to see the animals and splash in the calm waters of the lagoon.I have travelled to other islands and stayed at many other Hilton's and have to say that I as a bit disappointed with this place. As I said, the grounds are lovely, but the bugs and noise control issues need some fixing. We probably won't be staying here again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Make your dreams of the perfect Hawaiian vacation come true by staying in these first class accommodations. These suites have the feel of a gorgeous island villa with beautiful amenities such as granite bathrooms with soaker tubs, beautiful appliances, high end bedding, in-room washer/dryer & much more. Encased within the Hilton Hawaiian Village, you have full access to all of the amenities such as 3 pools, shopping & dining in a variety of restaurants within the village. It is also within walking distance to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre, the largest shopping centre in Honolulu. Located on Waikiki Beach, with a firework show every Friday evening, you will truly feel that you have spent your vacation in paradise.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Hilton Grand Vacations Lagoon Tower at the Hilton Hawaiian Village at Waikiki HI. We stayed in a 2-BR corner unit on the 4th floor next to the Parking Garage and Great Lawn. The Hilton Hawaiian Village to begin a very large property which is shared by both the Hilton Grand Vacations and Hilton Hotels. It is quite a impressive complex of hotels, suites, restaurants, pools and shops. When we checked in at the shared Grand Waikikian and Lagoon Tower Lobby, we were given very poor directions to our tower that we ended up walking quite a distance away from the Lagoon Tower! It was not fun dragging our luggage around after a 8 1/2 hr. plane trip!When we finally got settled into our 2-BR suite and after a quick bite to eat, we realized very quickly that we located right next to the Starlight Luau which was held nightly a top the Parking Garage right next to us! Not only did we have to endure this nightly, but the walls in this tower are paper thin and again, unfortunately for us on our first night, the room above us (mostly teenagers from the sound of it) decided to party loudly until 3 am! We almost called Security but didn't. Fortunately the noise makers above left the next day! There were a number of other problems: the sink disposal did not work, the tub in the master's BR drained very slowly, the safe could not be locked because of low battery, the shower in the master BR was weak b/c the switch from faucet to shower was not working (was predominantly on faucet mode), had only 1 maid service for 10 days of stay (really?). When the maid service came that one time, did not restock kitchen and did not dust the unit! If you rented a car for your vacation, be ready to pay $30 per day for Valet Parking or $25 per day for Self Park. The lagoon and beach area was very nice but be prepared to spend $30 for all day umbrella and $15 all day for beach lounge chairs otherwise be content with just a towel! The property is nicely situated and close enough to get to all the sites that Honolulu has to offer (Diamond Head, Koko Crater, Hanauma Bay, Chinatown, North Shore, Pearl Harbor, etc.). We did a majority of our cooking in our unit. Groceries are very expensive but so is eating out. I would go back to this property but only if they placed me in a corner 2-BR facing the lagoon on a high floor away from the nightly luau!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Instead of reservating a regular hotel room at HIlton Hawaiian Village Hotel, we selected HIlton Grand Vacation accommodation: Reason: price was about 20 % higher than hotel room but the studio accommodation came with free Wifi, mini regrigerator, microwave oven and complimentary access to a very clean laundry facility on the same floor. I read many reviews on Lagoon Tower Studio. Almost all of them were negative, citing the bad view, noise from the pool, the location near the elevator etc. I was very nervous before I checked in . Here is the list of my very positive review of STUDIO accommodation here.#1. Our taxi driver knew ahead of time that we must check in at Lagoon Tower. Check in area was not crowded, a very nice lady greeted us with lei. Doorman and bellmen were courteous and quick. In the past,we had used the main lobby when we had stayed at regular room. Hotel check in line there was always like a Central Station platform. But not at the Lagoon Tower lobby. It is smaller and more private and upscale.#2. I was hesitant to open the door to our Studio here. We were pleasantly surprised: There were two windows with plantation shutters. We saw ocean from each window. Rainbow tower was located in between our windows, so the wall sort of hid the rainbow tower. All we could see from our window was Pacific Ocean View ! If we looked down, we saw Great Lawn where private parties take place at night. It was quiet and the room was beautifully decorated.#3. I hope my review will erase the previous negative Studio reviews. Studio did not have any balcony. It was OK with us.#4. Flat Screen TV has closed to 300 TV channels....I was tired when I checked in as we were on the Big Island prior to Waikiki. So I rested in this comfortable room for 3 full days. Bed was comtemporary and comfortable. Bathroom amneties were from PeterThomasRoth which is an expensive luxury line of skincare product company.#5.I took many photos of this room. I will try to attach some of the photos with this review.#6. Excellant and caring Housekeeping staff.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I have experienced previous stays at Kahala in 2010, Trump in 2011 and this year taking my 2 daughters aged 5 & 6 y/o I was torn which to pick. I was traveling for 10 days b/w 27 October - 7november 2012.I needed a kitchenette most importantly- if the children wanted to snack.On a friends recommendation I was advised the Hilton Grand Vacations would be befitting ....the girls would love the fireworks, the pools, the lagoon as advertised on their website and the fact they had a kitchen was inviting......I thought I would give them a go. Upon arrival the receptionist requested payment up front?? My first taste of Aloha from Hilton.I have never experienced this before...normally you would pay at the end of your stay.Whilst she took an imprint of my card... Normal practice .....she requested another form of payment for incidentals at $250.00 ... I was advised I had to use another card or cash...it was relayed to me that my card she just used was not able to be accepted...indicating it had declined....this annoyed me as I knew there were sufficient funds....in addition I asked what the incidental were for and she replied 'yes' to minibar...THERE WAS NO MINI BAR IN THE ROOM,!!! I still don't know what incidentals she referred to as the room was empty of everything. Not even brochures of the services the complex has to offer...the spa, the shops,Nothing. Not even a magazine.My card worked fine later that day at the ABC store and at Ala Moana shopping centre.The receptionist also failed to advise us of the events that are popular within the hotel. There was no welcoming to your room, no direction given of where you are and where everything is......there was no information about any breakfast options....there was literally NO INFORMATION. IT WAS FIND IT YOURSELF. A map was given to us by concierge the day after but still very vague as to what we could experience within the complex given it was so large with multiple buildings. We waited for our luggage and after an hour phoned, only to be advised that the receptionist had failed to collect our ticket from us. On day 4 .....typically the cleaning crew arrived after we had left out room at 9.30. On this day they arrived at 8.00 am and left a calling card stating they do not disturb patrons if the Sign is out..and in addition we missed our day and they would return tomorrow. I phoned ASAP and requested someone come back that day. By 2pm no one had serviced the room. I had to demand that this service be actioned immediately as we had no towels.On day 7 being Friday it was fireworks night. A very popular event and the little ones were devastate when we heard them and ran to watch them. We missed them as they are only on for 5-7 minutes. I then went to speak with the duty manager and vented my frustration from DAY 1 and the above incidents that had happened to date. I was disgusted that there was no advertising or information given when these events happen. It was on this night I discovered that the towers are ALL ...TIME SHARED OWNED AND THEY THOUGHT WE WERE TIME SHARE OWNERS. OMG ! Customer service is totally non existant with this Hotelier group. The duty manager was mostly concerned about what time she should book the cleaning staff to service the room....in addition I was advised that the cost was $75.00 per day......now this really stressed me to the maximum as I had never heard of this before......she then realized that this was a mistake made by her.......She was not interested in any other concerns or bad experiences I had with the hotel....Eg; the lack of information, NO WELCOME PACK UPON ARRIVAL GIVEN TO US apparently, the lagoon as advertised on their webpage is not owned by the hotel ....it is a publiclagoon area and the costs are associated with the rental of beach furniture.No pool service by the pool. No room service in your room. Children are not permitted to wear floaties around their waist in the pool which is deep for them. Because of the low fence gating the complex near the pool area, there were thieves that casually swam amongst with patrons, stole patrons belongings and pool towels so that they could blend in next time around. Security is non existant on these premises and staff are not interested. The doors accessing into the pool area do not work and you have to wait for some one to leave to gain entry....advising hotel staff of this was totally a waste of time. It appears this is a daily problem. Security is a high problem here and safety is of no of concern to this hotel. Given what I experienced when these thieves roamed amongst the patrons in the pool area as I was privy to the incident, I would never ever contemplate staying here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Love the property! Although it is a large property , it's very organized and lush. Great place for a family trip , and even better for a romantic vacation! Loved the restaurants , the multiple swimming pools , and easy access to the beach. Close walk to Dukes for a sunset cruise! There are always different activities going on , the staff makes this a busy but fun time!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This complex of multiple buildings is just too big and too confusing for its own good, with grossly inadequate information for new arrivals. We ended up dragging our luggage from one building to another trying to find the right place to check in, and then getting lost going from the check-in desk to our room in another tower. By the time we finally found our room my wife and I were at each other's throats from the stress, which is not how we wanted to start our Hawaiian vacation. My recommendation to management would be to print dozens of "your are here" flyers and put them all around the site so people can have some hope of finding their way from one place to another; I only saw two such maps after we'd been there for a day. On the plus side, staff we dealt with were friendly and the upgraded room we got in the Kalia tower was very nice - other than being far from the beach. My advice to most travelers would be to avoid this facility and stay somewhere better organized, either on the main stretch of Waikiki Beach if you want to be there or further out of town for more peace and quiet. Leave the Hilton Hawaiian Village to the big tour groups who come here with their own guides to walk them around the complex.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This Hilton Grand Vacations booking was by far the most convenient, easiest and well run operation we've experienced in all our leisure travels. The icing on the cake was the outstanding accommodations and services at HGV! Our HVG included a rental car in our rate that the special VIP check in process at Dollar rental car was absolutely seamless and a warm welcome from other past experiences at other rental car places. Next, upon arrival for check-in at the Grand Waikikian front desk adjacent to the Lagoon Tower, the open air lobby was beautiful and everyone from the valet to front desk immediately made us feel welcome! To our surprise, our deluxe suite was two levels with open concept kitchen, dining and living areas which are nicely decorated and very clean. Both bedrooms and the living room had flat TV screens with Direct TV (or equivalent). The master suite was huge and comfy and both bedrooms had private bathrooms with an extra half bath on the first floor which was very convenient. The only very minor drawbacks were: 1) second bedroom had poor lighting and had two twin beds (but we could put the two beds together); 2) there was no real storage closet for golf clubs, coolers, beach chairs etc; and 3) we got charged for an entire week of valet parking even though we parked most nights at a nearby overnight lot (those charges were immediately reversed without question). As for the other amenities, we usually don’t care as we always leave Waikiki during the day on day trips and then return at night for the nightlife. However, our first day we stayed close to the hotel and I would just like to note my observations: the lagoon pool area is very noisy given the water slide area is designed for kids and the “super pool” is a little less noisy. Also, the beach area in front of the hotel is expansive compared to the rest of Waikiki Beach and is less rocky than other parts and the lagoon is a nice feature as well. Also, note well: the sit-down restaurants in the village are very expensive while the food is just average. Clearly, the restaurants at the HHV have a captive audience for those tourists who don’t branch outside of the HHV. In general, the village itself is huge and there are plenty of shops including the ubiquitous ABC store which has something for everyone including an amazing wine selection. We thank the entire HGV staff for their wonderful hospitality and seamless operation. From original booking, to Dollar rental car, to the accommodations, HGV really has all the details nailed down to make this an enjoyable and memorable vacation experience.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This is our 4th time staying at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the 2nd at the Grand Vacations Club in the Lagoon Towers. Both times we stayed in a 2 bdrm suite, with kitchen, 2 lanai's living room, with large TV and DVD/Games stations. The Laundry room was great to have a few doors down, no charge to use machines and soap was also provided. The grounds of course are spectacular and family friendly, several pools to choose from and restaurants and bars on site. The beach and lagoon on the property are the best in Waikiki also enjoying Friday night Fireworks. Family or Couples can both find something to do on the property. We look forward to many more visits in our future.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My all adult family spent the week at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at Hilton Hawaiian Village and we were pleased with our experience. It was a timeshare exchange and we could not have been happier with our accomodations. It was a large 2 bedroom on the 16th floor with an ocean view in the Lagoon Tower and it was beautiful. We could see the ocean and the private Lagoon on the property. From our room we could see the fire works displays they have on Friday nights and the entertainment on the roof of the adjacent building at the Luau. This is a very large facility and a little over crowded even in Oct. I do not swim but I noticed the pools were very full. As others have mentioned you have to get a towel card to get a beach towel and return the towel for the card , then turn the card in at check out or be billed for the towel. There is construction going on to build another pool on the property and to add more stores. This facility is almost a self contained little town. There are all kinds of shopping and restaurants and a small ABC store with groceries. Items are a little higher but the convenience is worth it. Although milk was $9.99 a gallon in there we were told it was about $7.00 a gallon average on the island.The room was clean and the beds and pillows were very comfortable. Master had a king bed and the other bedroom had 2 double beds. It had 2 full baths, living area, dining area and kitchen with all utensils. Only complaint I had was there was only a 1/2 gallon pitcher and I am from Texas and drink lots of iced tea.The beach is only a few steps from the outer edge of the facility and you can walk all the way down the beach side on a sidewalk. In addition to shopping there are several small clubs with free entertainment on property. It is an all non smoking facility with only a couple of designated areas for my bad habit. I did not find the large area with benches until the day I was leaving. We came in early from another hotel and they held our luggage for us and called as soon as the room was ready.There is a thermostat in the unit for Heat and A/C but it just says warm/ cool with different settings in between and a three speed fan. We found we had to shut off the vents in the living area to keep the bedrooms cool at night. And you can't leave the balcony door open or the unit shuts off.The balcony was furnished with a nice table and four chairs. Big flat screen TV's in living and each bedroom with a playstaion and dvd player in living room. You will get a card to use at the kiosk in the lobby for free dvd movies and playstaion games.Decent water pressure in the showers and I never ran out of hot water.Staying for a week we only got maid service once but, if you need anything, all you have to do is catch the maid in the hall and she will be happy to provide you with items from her cart. To get clean towels just take your dirty ones to her to count and get fresh ones.There are 2 free washers and dryers on each floor of the Lagoon Tower. You can buy detergent in the ABC store in the lobby. So pack light and wash. Save yourself baggage fees. We did not rent a car during our stay we used the Waikiki trolley but I heard that parking was $20.00 per night. Did not take my laptop as I read different stories about Wi-Fi availability and prices. All staff was friendly and helpful. I did notice that there wasn't much security. Only saw 2 guards driving a 4 wheeler through the property once and guards at the private events they had on the lawn by the Lagoon.If I was planning on going back to Waikiki I would definitly stay here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just returned from 1 week at the Hilton Grand Vacations Club at the Hilton Hawaiian Village, Waikiki Beach, Honolulu, HI. It was a fun place with lots to do right on the property! We enjoyed Maui Zaui pizza at the Round Table - Yum! We went to the Hawaiian Luau on the property (HGVC owners get free upgrade to inner circle of tables - orchid leis - first in line for food) and enjoyed the singing, dancing, and traditional clothing. We shopped along the Rainbow Bazaar and were pleasantly surprised at the prices right there in the resort. For example, the shop downstairs in the Lagoon Tower had bottled water - 1.5 L for $0.99! Also there was an ABC store on the property that had different Hawaiian items to try: pineapple wine (YUM), local craft beers, Kona coffee, macadamia nuts, etc. By staying in our fabulous HGVC room in the Lagoon Tower (2 BR, 2 BA, full kitchen, dining room, living room, and 2 balconies overlooking the lagoon and the beach), we could also eat out on our balcony with food from the ABC - coffee in the morning was the greatest! Don't miss the Honolulu Cookie company, and the Pitake Jasmine lotions, candles, etc smell divine. We ventured out of the village for several excursions: On Sunday, we took a van to the Swap Meet at Aloha Stadium - not to be missed - can find all sorts of great Hawaiian items for reasonable prices: 7 Beefy T-shirts for $20, basket purse $20, watercolor paintings with woven matting and local wood frame $85, fabrics $3.75/yd, Tiki lamps $45, King's Hawaiian bread $7 for 3-4 loaves, shirred dress $30, etc. Loads of fun and you can munch of FRESH pineapple as you walk around.Next day, we hiked up Diamond Head (go for the very early morning tour - our 10 am one was HOT). Rana was our guide, and she was full of local information and how to get up Diamond Head the right way - hydrate often. Did you know that Diamond Head is not a crater??We also took a hike, kayak and snorkel tour to Chinaman's Hat island. Awesome - drove through rainforest to get to the other side of Oahu, short hike to a lookout point above a working ranch, kayaked out to Chinaman's Hat, ate lunch, snorkeled, kayaked back, and then drove back to Waikiki. It was our favorite outing.Rented a car from Enterprise just down the street from the property for about $50 for the day (kept it overnight so we did not have to be back to return it by the time they closed at 5 pm). We headed east to Hanauma Bay for snorkeling - it was like snorkeling in a fish tank - tons of fish right in front of your mask. You pay to park, pay to enter the park, and have to watch a video on protecting the wildlife. We freshened up there, and then headed on the road around the island - stopping for the photo ops at the blow hole and other well-marked areas. Had an early dinner at Giovani's Shimp Truck (shrimp scampi to die for) and then doubled back to see the Polynesian Cultural Center. After taking in some of those sights and shopping opportunities, we headed to Sunset Beach for.... sunset pictures! We saw lots of surfers off to the left in the Banzai Pipeline. Then used the GPS to find Ted's Bakery - just 0.4 mi down the road - for pineapple cheesecake, etc.From the Hilton, we took the catamaran tour to Turtle Canyon and snorkeled with lots of Green Sea Turtles. It was also fun to walk out to the main drag and see all the fancy shops - go to the Hard Rock for Happy Hour - but even more fun once we found the International Marketplace. Even met Wally Amos of Famous Amos cookies! He's still smiling.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed for a week in a king bed, full kitchen suite on the 12th floor with an ocean view. The view was wonderful as we could see the ocean, the lagoon, the big pool, our own pool, and a bit of the shopping village below. We were high enough for it to be quiet and to see surfers in the waves off the beach. The room was updated and clean with only minor annoyances (broken hair dryer and playstation connection) that were quickly remedied with a call downstairs. Concierge was always friendly without being too pushy. On site dining was a bit pricey and somewhat bland, but it's on-site and in Hawaii so we expected as much. I found the prices mostly comparable to other restaurants nearby. Landscaping is fantastic and I took several photos of the water features, birds, and fish. The village is very large and it might be useful if there were more maps posted around the site. We stayed during the off season and it was busy without being overly crowded. No problems getting choice seats at the pool or on the beach. Overall, I'd give it a 4.5, with the deduction only being because it wasn't absolute perfection.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Been here many times since 06. My wife prefers HGVC Lagoon tower to all the other resorts in the islands we have stayed at so far. The Grand Waikikian is nice but we held out buy our timeshare at the lagoon tower instead, just like it more there. We always get a car but it really is not needed as everything is in walking distance from the resort.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We are back for our fourth year here! Last year, we were a little concerned about the units showing a substantial amount of wear, but we are very pleased to see that things have been spiffed up! And someone took note to add a wine bottle opener (missing the last three visits) and a coffee pot with a gold screen filter... Hooray to whoever has been taking note! This trip, the dishes match! Yeah!!! Looks like the cabinetry has been updated! What a relief. I read some of the reviews before writing my own. We usually come in September so we can miss the crowds. This year, the entire area is busier than I have seen (only my 5th or 6th visit to Hawaii)... including the resort, beaches, and pools. We could not find two chairs together yesterday at the pool, and everytime I spotted two together, before I could get to them, they had been snagged! And the pool by Lagoon Tower was too busy to go in. If my husband did not have a recuperating knee, we would be in the ocean!!! I wish they had an adults only pool! I was also concerned about John L.s review about theft. We have seen more security this stay, which creates mixed emotions. The resort does not have lockers and my husband's swim shorts don't have a zipper pocket! Where to leave your room key and credit card while swimming??? Inquiring minds would like to know... I also am concerned about the plans to add another tower. Certainly the resort is busy enough as it is!!! More people means more traffic, more bodies, more waiting, less room at the beach, more bodies in the water... etc. We will see what happens. There is a reason we vacation as far away from L.A. as possible... there is also a reason we bought at "the quiet end of Waikiki"... In short, HGVC Staff is great! The rooms are back to being beautiful... and someone has been paying attention to detail! I remembered to bring salt and pepper this year, but didn't need the wine bottle opener or coffee filters I packed! When you book try to get a room as high up as possible if you are near the pools. Since we are oceanfront owners, we are close to the pool as it is, and the noise can get a little grating... but we must accept the tradeoffs for such beauty... Noisewise, higher is better... now if the guy next door did not think he was a foghorn... Aloha!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Upon arriving looking at the beautiful gardens we thought wow this is heaven. Our room not so much, they have shutters in the rooms which don't keep a lot of light out. It was meant to be relaxing but the bed wasn't comfy and we really didn't get much sleep. The lagoon pool was great but the other pool near the lagoon tower was extremely slippery and I was too scared in case of injury. The pizza shop at the hotel was great though. Luau entertainment was great the food wasn't, I'll stay somewhere else next time

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in a 2 Br in the lagoon tower over the labor day weekend and had a great time! The rooms are nicely appointed with enough service utensils for 6. The room was missing sheets for the sofa bed and baking pans but a quick.call to housekeeping and they were brought up quickly. My kids enjoyed using all the pools and the lagoon. The pool with the waterslides was undersized in my opinion. Not enough chairs, and I found it strange that the main hotel pool didn't have a Jacuzzi, but they put two jaccuzzis right next to the kiddie pool with slides! It is definitely not relaxing. Lol but overall my kids enjoyed themselves. There is construction on.property to build a new pool by the tapa tower so hopefully it'll relieve the pool crowd. There really is no other property like this in Waikiki.. with this much beachfront. Most Waikiki hotels have a sliver of sand in front... Not here.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Full Disclosure - writing this on Day 1 of trip, invited by Hilton Grand Vacations for their timeshare offering.So where do I begin? Well, I am supposed to be on vacation, but I feel I just got off a nasty summer ride in a NYC subway! Traffic jam for 20 mins outside the hotel trying to find a place to park and check-in, then a 30 min line at the registration front desk (no preferred Hhonors treatment), get a room in a dingy building called Diamond Head and then the most foul smelling room ever (1287). Call Guest Services, get put on hold. Call again, and told room is being changed. Wait for another 30 mins and call back only to be told that they were expecting me to walk back to Front Desk to pick up the keys!!! Finally get a room...tired, exhausted, angry and feeling completely cheated! My last days as a Hhonors member!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We went on a VIP package to the Hilton in Waikiki. This is a package Hilton will sell you for $1700.00 to stay in one of 4 resorts-Orlando, Waikiki, Las Vegas, or New York in the hopes that you will buy into their vacation club. We had already attended a vacation club talk in Orlando a year ago and felt strongly about buying into the club when we felt it was appropriate (we own other club memberships). Orlando was lovely. The accomodations wonderful. Had we not known how good they could be, this VIP stay surely would have made us feel strongly AGAINST joining the Hilton Vacation Club. Seriously Hilton, if your trying to sell someone into the club, this room is not the one to put them in. We were given a 2 room suite they call premium that they tell us rents for $700+ a night. We have an entirely different word for Lagoon 2067-Disgusting. It is an old, manky suite with disgusting carpet, dirty apolstery, moldy baseboards, a circa 1980 kitchen. Other than the view which is good and the reason I gave 2 stars instead of one, there is nothing redeeming about this suite. Honestly, we would never have paid more than $200 a night for this suite and that's pushing it. In no way was the $1700 weekly package worth it particularly when we had to spend 2 hours with Rick the OCD sales consultant pushing ownership down our throats. (A comment to all vacation clubs-no way are we spending 50K+ on the spot without going home and thinking about it as any intellegent prudent person would. If your product is that good, you would give us the time to mull it over and not try to strong arm your potential owners).We have stayed in resorts all over the world and we would not recommend this one. The pools are WAY too overcrowded being closed daily because someone defecates or vomits; the pools are old-you simply do not want to put uncovered feet on those tiles or stones; there are very poor dining choices other than Bali which was excellent-we do not care for fast food for every meal; you have to pay for absolutely EVERYTHING and I'm not kidding. We brought our little water mattress for our son and I asked the pool shop if they could blow it up with their compressor and they charged me $5.00. We will most likely never stay here again. If we had to do it all over, we would stay at the Royal Hawaiian down the beach. It is a lovely hotel that is charming, well kept and less crowded in the better part of Waikiki. It's more our style.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Brought our young kids to the resort and stayed in. 1BR suite in the Kalia Tower last week. I have staed at this resort about 10 times. I do not ever get tired of it. For me, it's the convenience. Everything is at the doorstep; pools, beach, spa, gym, ABC Store, myriad of restaurants, activities, trolley, shuts, etc. I love it. However, it is true that it is crowded. The occupancy rate is high year-round. So, for that reason, if you are looking for a private, quiet secluded getaway, I wouldn't really recommend the HHV. Our family had a great time. The room was quiet and having a kitchen was very convenient. Negatives are that the hotel dining options are pretty pricey. Parking is also very expensive. We loved the new pool, which was always crowded with families because of the slides. Our kids did not want to leave the pool! The new towel system makes sense to me. It prevents guests from "parking" their towel on the chairs all day and then leaving them behind and preventing another guest from using the lounge chairs. Our kids never wanted to leave this pool! We also loved the kayak, paddle boat rentals in the lagoon. It is great for small kids. We also took the catamaran trip from the HHV dock. Very nice. We loved the firework show. Very impressive. Overall, we had a great trip. We will be back.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This place was massive! I enjoyed my stay at the grand vactations club. The room was amazing. It was a one bedroom apartment, very spacious and the decor was nice and modern. The villiage had many pools, restaurants and shops. We found this Japanese sushi restaurant which we could not get enough of. It could get a bit corwded at times, the pools ecspecially looked very crowded however we rarely used it as the beach was at our doorstep.
