Shuttles and taxis are also always available on the property 24/7. Overall we were very impressed with the Hilton Hawaiian Village property and would definitely return!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: It is everything you want it to be. The rooms are great, the beds are heavenly, the location on Waikiki is superfab. There are tons of open air bars and pools and entertainment happening everywhere. I thought it was romantic as well. Loved my stay.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: I stayed at this hotel for five nights and wish I could have stayed longer. You get a good value for your money and the service is great. If you stay at this hotel I suggest that you stay on the Concierge floors because they have a continental breakfast each morning and have snacks in the afternoon. All the towers have a great view of the Ocean and the beach is wonderful. The enviroment is great for kids and lots of fun for the whole family. Have fun. Aloha!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just got back from our second stay at the HGVC HHV. This is a nice resort significantly set apart from most of the hotels on Wakiki. This is a good thing for us, as we don't necessarily like the chaos of central Wakiki and you do get a little more space on the beach down on the HHV end. It's also nice to have a selection of pools areas to choose from.The bad stuff - ElevatorsThere are clearly not enough elevators for this building. The wait can be extreme around check-out/in times.The PoolIt's tiny. Both time that we've been there, there were too many people in the pool and a few of them were smoking (dropping their ashes into the water).ParkingYou have to pay extra for it.The GymYou have to pay extra for it.LaundryIt's not in the unit.The Good Stuff - HHVIt's part of HHV, so you can charge things to your room, get room service and enjoy the facilities in the whole complex.ComfortThe rooms are comfortably outfitted and well maintained. For a timeshare, it is surprising to find that the beds were not terribly uncomfortable.The only other thing that I can add is that you really need to be careful about the room you select. The standard rooms are all on the back side of the building. They have just broken ground on a new HGVC tower that will be alarmingly close to these buildings. I suspect that there will be a lot of noise for the next couple of years and then neigbors that can look into your windows pretty easily. The "ocean view" rooms are on the opposite side. They more appropriately have an ocean peak, but do not have the problems associated with the other side. The "ocean front" rooms are on the end of the building and have an unobstructed, fairly spectacular view.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: First trip to Hawaii, stayed at the Lagoon Tower with partial ocean view. Have stayed at many timeshare units before and the quality of this unit does not stand out. It was clean and neat but does not warrant spending an extra $20,000 over other timeshares. They try to sell you on the Hilton name but we had the same issues trying to book this one as we do other timeshares and once you enter the unit it looks the same as most other timeshares.The sand on the beach was nice but having to pay $30 for a beach umbrella and $13 for a chair is a joke. The water was a bit cold and it got really deep really fast, Waikiki is not the best beach in the world.If renting a car, order online at thrifty and pick it up at the Radison on Al Lamona avenue behind the hotel, this way you will save a bundle compared to any other rental agency. I also did not like having to pay for parking at the resort, but was told that all hotels will charge in Waikiki.Check out the International marketplace (flea market) across from the cheesecake factory on the main strip for great deals. Don't miss the Wailana Coffee House for breakfast, good food and cheap.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just got home last weekend from another great trip to Hawaii, I see that some people complain about this resort and that the Kalia Tower to far out from the beach, IT IS NOT 4 -5 CITY BLOCKS as on writer says, the attached photo was what we looked at when we walked in the door of our 1 bedroom unit last week. The units in the Kalia Tower are all new, wood floors and the most helpfull staff of the whole complex, we have stayed in Rainbow, Lagoon and Kalis 5 times in the last 2 years and have already booked for Kailia again.I have stayed at Las Vegas Hilton HGCV and this knocks its socks off! If you do want to try a Japanese Steak House and find Benehania to crowded or pricy, we prefer Kobe Japanese Steak house located next door to the resort behind the parking structure and KaliaTower, way better food and they take the Entertainment Card for $20 off your bill!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon and we stayed at the Hilton Hawaii only two nights before we headed for Maui. It was so wonderful! It was a beautiful resort on a great beach! We stayed in the Ali Tower with a partial ocean view and view of the wonderful pool! Our room was awesome with a wonderful king size bed, down comforter, flat screen t.v. beautiful bathroom...we felt like we were at home! :) They staff was also great. They were there whenever you needed them! We especially loved the private little bar at the Ali Tower. The bar tender was wonderful and made fabulous drinks! We were really sad to leave and wish we would have stayed longer. We now know for next time! You'll love it here!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: After a week in Kauai, we stayed at the Lagoon tower for the last week of our honeymoon. This place was beautiful. The room was very spacious. Kitchen and bathroom had granite counter tops, floors were ceramic tile. The kitchen came fully equiped with all utencils and appliances. W/D was not in the room, but available on each floor. The balcony overlooked an incredible view of Waikiki. The beach in front of the Hilton Village has many acitivities for you to do, but I would receommend walking about a block down where every activity is about $10-15 less. Also, Bali by the Sea is a must eat restuarant. You also do not a car if staying in Waikiki. The public bus system is pretty good and can take you to places like Hanamau Bay, Diamond Head, shopping, more. Aloha.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and I spent two fabulous evenings at the Hilton villiage for our honeymoon. We were married in Maui and stayed in the Alii tower for two nights on our way back home. One thing you must remember when booking here is that there are several towers all part of the same property. This may cause some discrepancies among reviews. We can only speak for the grounds and the Alii Tower. One of the major advantages of staying in the Alii tower is the check-in desk and private pool and hot tub exclusive to the Alii Tower. You still have the use of the other pools on the property as an added bonus. We also had a Manager's reception each evening between 5 and 7pm where they served finger foods (hot and cold) for free. The staff was very friendly and courteous and they were kind enough to upgrade us to a King Ocean Front Suite because it was our honeymoon. The room was incredible, complete with two lanais overlooking the ocean on different sides, a plasma flat screen tv, and even a tv in the washroom. We were given all the bottled water we could drink at no extra cost and welcomed with fruit and chocolates upon our arrival. The grounds are spectacular, showing off incredible gardens and some of the most beautiful exotic birds you will ever see including pink flamingos and penguins believe it or not. We went in June so I'm sure it wasn't their peak season, thus the beaches were not crowded at all. The water was great but the sand was a little coarse. After walking down Waikiki beach it became very evident that the beach at the Hilton is the widest and best for swimming along the stretch. They are in the middle of construction of a wedding chapel on the property so be forwarned if you are thinking of booking in the near future. It didn't bother us much, just took away from some of the gardens. All in all a tremendous stay!!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We just returned from a 2 - week vacation in Hawaii. We spent the 1st week (5/14/05 - 5/21/05) in a 1 BR HGVC condo on the 17th floor, in the Kalia Tower. The condo was beautiful, we had an ocean view, & the Kalia Pool on the 4th floor was directly below our balconies. It was great just sitting out on our balconies enjoying the view of Waikiki Beach, the Rainbow Tower & the lagoon. The free washers & dryers happened to be across the hall, just outside the door of our condo. We enjoyed the shopping available on the Hilton property. We stopped at the Mandara Spa Store in the shopping area & even got 10 minute back & neck massages there, without an appointment! There is an ABC Store in the shopping area, where you can pickup convenience food, souveniers, etc. Our family loved the penquins, fish ponds, flamingos & the waterfalls in the resort. We really enjoyed our days spent on Waikiki Beach. We took our own beach mats, chairs & umbrella, to avoid paying the resort rentals. The Amercian Express desk was very helpful in booking our luau (Paradise Cove). We had a rental van, it cost $13 per day to keep it in the parking garage.Went snorkeling at Haunama Bay, beach hopping around the island, visited Ala Moana Mall & Pearl Harbor. Unfortunately, one person in our party got ill during our stay. However, she was able to see the Dr on property 1st thing the following morning. We can't wait to return to the Hilton Hawaiian Village, we had a fabulous time, absolutely no complaints.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: This was our first visit to Hawaii and we stayed at the Lagoon Towers in a 2 BR/2BA villa, March 26 - April 1, 2005 (Spring Break). The units were well equipped for a family vacation. The kitchen had granite countertops, and well appointed appliances. The master bedroom had a king size bed and the 2nd bedroom had 2 full size beds. Both bathrooms were large and exceptional clean. Washer/dryer are on each floor, but not in the room. The unit was facing the ocean, so every morning you awake to the beautiful sounds coming off of the beach. I got up early one morning a took a quiet stroll on the beach. It was heavenly. Words could not express the tranquility you feel, just walking around looking at the water.Wakiki Beach is located in the city, so there's something for everyone.We ate at many of the restaurants on and around the Hilton property. We loved the shopping and the various sights on the island.I didn't mention a lot of things about our trip, but I will say that this has been one of the memorable moments in my life. I'm already planning our next trip.Gwen Jones

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: The one bedroom villa that we occupied at the Hilton Hawaiian Village's HGVC Tower (Time Share Division) was spacious, with an equallty spacious balcony with a view of the Pacific Ocean and Waikiki Beach to the North, as well as Diamond Head. The rooms and halls were quiet and extremely well kept. Laundry service was available at an extra charge at w/d on each floor. Easy walk to shops, groceries, siteseeing, beach, park or bus. Concierge was knowledgeable about everything, although always suggest reading up on places before you go (i.e. Frommer's) and the Village has cultural events, such as a parade and hula dancers, ukelele classes, lei making classes (sign up quick for those). They have some nice touches. We were offered a compimentary suite to dress for airport when our place took off much later than check out. This left us almost entire day to spent at beach/pool/spa. You just can't imagine, the open air lobbies, the penguins walking around, the beautiful birds and the food choices are unlimited. What a nice ending to a beautiful trip!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the Lagoon Tower Condos for 6 nights in early October. We originally booked that time because we heard the weather was great that time of year. Also, because it wasn't during the high tourist season. We all had a memorable vacation. We arrived about 10am and was told our room wouldn't be ready till about 2pm, so we left the luggage with the bellhop in the lobby. They have a huge area roped off and everyone's luggage is tagged so we felt safe leaving it there. When our room was ready it was great ! It was a one bedroom/one bath condo. The kitchen was stocked with enough dishes for 4. A very nice sized refrigerator. Bathroom was ok size-nothing huge, but fine. And the master bedroom was good-sized too. Every day, the maid would leave coffee packets and laundry detergent (both free).I had heard that coffee in Hawaii is very expensive so I didn't use the coffe packets the first day-thinking we would be charged for them, but we never were. They come with the condo.There's 2 washers and 2 dryers on each floor (free). Our lanai faced the next hotel-the Renaissance Ilia-but not too close that you could see into someone else's room. It was EXTREMELY quiet and private. Even though we were on the 17th floor, taking the elevators was no problem. The shops at the Hilton Hawaiian Village were great too. Did lots of shopping for souvenirs and essentials at the ABC store (closes 1am). Good place to get milk and bread and sodas for the kids. Maybe cuz we went during the "off" season it was never too crowded in the Village. Also ate at the Rainbow Tower Restaurant for their dinner buffet. With Pleasant Holidays thru AAA you get buy-one get-one free coupons otherwise it would have been very expensive ($30-adults;$25-kids). The only thing I could say that was bad about the hotel was the security. You didn't need a room key to access the elevators like in a lot of other hotels--anyone could access any floor. Also, the parking was good. We paid the extra $12 a day for parking at the hotel. It turned out to be a good thing. If you want the entire trip's parking charged to your room, they will give you a card-key to enter and exit the parking structure, so you don't have to deal with parking stubs-you come and go as you please and they bill you at the end. The parking structure is right next to the hotel. You just have to park on the upper floors cuz the first 2 floors are for valet parking only. But they have walkways leading from the upper parking floors right into the hotel lobby so it was very convenient. We were VERY lucky we didn't stay in one of the hotels closer to the heart of Waikiki--near where the Outriggers are and the Beachcomber Hotels. That was way way too noisy and crowded. I would have hated to have had a room either facing the streets or the beach as both are extremely noisy all day and all night. I guess that would be ok if you were young and just wanted to party all night long-but we have little kids and needed some quiet time. That's what I liked best about the Lagoon Tower--it was the last tower on the property and very quiet, yet you only had to walk a few hundred yards to get all the action at the beach. It was a great place to stay--you're staying in a timeshare without having to buy one. And there was never really any pressure to listen to their timeshare lectures. At the conceirge desk they ask if you're a renter or a buyer, then ask if you'd like to go to a lecture-but that's it. We walked through one of the Outrigger Hotels (with Dukes in it) and were totally put off by their sales lady. Every single time we walked past her booth she tried to grab us. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially with kids. Enough room for everyone and 2 tv's. Also there's a great coffee shop right across the main entrance to the hotel. All you can eat pancakes that come with egg/toast/coffee for about $3.99 a person. Open 24-hrs a day. Late mornings there's a line outside but it moves quickly. A great deal !!!

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We had previously stayed at the Hilton Hawaiian Village and the Hilton in Waikoloa 4 times....then we bought ownership in Hilton Grand Vacation Club...our first stay in a one bedroom with our grandaughter was great!. We had a lovely time and everything was clean, taken care of, and the staff was extremely helpful...Then, my husband and I went for a three day weekend.....we thought that a studio would be fine just for the two of us! Boy, were we Wrong!....no balcony (we knew that) but still, the hotel rooms have balconies ...... then there was the problems of water on the carpet in front of the refrigerator-which had been defrosted and the water left to run everywhere...we called down and the results were less than satisfactory!...Oh, yes, the bed was hard as a rock and lumpy and the pillows were lumpy and awful (not like the Hilton quality I knew) We had to ask for washcloths as none in the room...the t.v was small and I mean small....the room was small and claustrophobic! It was by the elevators and was like a space left over they didn't know what to do with!!!!!...If we wanted to sit, one got a comfortable chair and the other had to sit on the bed or a hardback chair....there were two of everything for dishes and silver...(what if we had wanted visitors - and actually we did) No forks, glasses etc. for who we wanted to visit so we didn't ask them....(not like home!- I know you want it for two, but that is riduculous!) the staff was thoughtful and considerate, but even they knew the room was a crackerbox...we used points for this...it was to be a weekend get away and we could hardly wait to get home to get a good nights sleep....I certainly hope our next stay in Orlando Seaworld is better in January...As an owner-I deserve better than someone staying in a hotel room for a couple of nights...I think we deserve our points back...Dorothy and Gerald Person

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed at the Lagoon Tower in a 2 bedroom unit from Sept 7-11, 2004. The unit was new - granite countertops, new appliances, etc. One bedroom had a king - the other had 2 twin beds & the sofa pulled out to a bed. Bathrooms were both nice as well. Plenty of space for 4 adults and most important to me, it was clean. They do have washer & dryers but not in the actual units. They are down the hall and they are free so feel free to use them. If you call housekeeping, they will provide you with extra boxes of Tide.For those of you who have never been to HI before and imagine isolated beaches, the Waikiki area is not for you. Try visiting the Big Island or Maui or the North Shore of Oahu. For those of you who like "city life" near the beach, Wakiki is great. I have stayed at Hilton Hawaiian Village 2x before (1980 & 1993) and briefly lived in Honolulu in 1995. I can say that Hilton does have a great location in Waikiki - most other hotels do not have the amount of beach front or amenities. Yes, it is a very big hotel and almost like a little city by itself. My husband had never been to HI before and liked this the best (we visited the Big Island & Maui as well during this trip) He loved being able to learn to surf right there yet having all kinds of amenities around. It really depends on your likes/dislikes.2 definite must sees while in Oahu: Pearl Harbor & Hanauma Bay. If you go to Hanauma Bay, go EARLY (be there by 7:30am) and you will beat all the crowds and see SO much sea life. We swam around w/a sea turtle for good hour. It was wonderful.We ate at many of the restaurants at the Hilton and ventured to some other properties. I know someone commented about cost but actually Honolulu was much cheaper than the Big Island or Maui. But HI is expensive in general so be prepared for that.We had a late flight - 10pm but had to check out of our room by 10am. However, if you go over to the main lobby of the hotel to the "Mail & Key" desk you can sign up for a hospitality suite and get 20 min per person in a room to shower, etc. We did just that and it worked out great. Went to Hanauma Bay that morning, had lunch, beached it and then showered around 5pm, went to dinner and went to the airport. Great service.Overall, I think the HGVC at Hilton Hawaiian Village was very nice. Again, depends on your wants/needs in a vacation. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: My wife and two sons, 3 and 4, probably vacation 4-6 weeks a year. We stay in condos most of the time and own several timeshares. We had a week at the Marriott Ko Olina Timeshare but decided to do 3 extra nights at the Hilton Village Condos since this place has a reputation like it is THE place to stay in Waikiki. We had a 1 bedroom. The unit was nice, but primarily because it is very new. There's no washer/dryer (at least in the 1 bedroom). I'd say it was average to slightly below average size for a one bedroom. The tower the condos are in is the one furthest from the beachfront in the back of the complex - the village is huge with several towers as big as hotels in themselves. The Lagoon tower pool was a standard pool. The main pool was fancier but nothing compared to what you find at most the hotels in Las Vegas. The food and service was good, but not exceptional. The prices were too high, even for Honolulu. The room price was a rip-off. This place caters to the Japanese who aren't as price conscious as most Americans I think. Compared to the timeshare condos at the Marriott Ko Olina (and elsewhere), Hilton can't hold a candle to Marriott. The furnishings and size of the Marriott units are much better. If you want to stay in a new condo on Waikiki and aren't price sensitive, this may be your place, especially if you want a resort that has everything so you don't have to venture out of the resort (There's a little shopping/restaurant complex within the resort - the restaurants are nothing to write home about though.) Otherwise, you can get much more for your money elsewhere in Waikiki.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: Beautiful and roomy. They upgraded us from a studio to a one-bedroom. Everything was nice, clean, new. We had a great view, and we enjoyed the Lagoon tower because it's a little quieter than other buildings at the Hawaiian Village. Our only complaint is that this nice hotel is in busy Waikiki instead of on the beautiful north shore.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: i used some introduction HGV membership points that i had purchased in las vegas to book a 1 bedroom suite in the hilton village. my girlfriend and i needed to take a vacation from the cold NE to get some sun and play golf.upon arriving at the HGV (rainbow?) tower, the staff informed me that my girlfriend and i would stay in the kalia tower. we did not know what to expect but things turned out fairly well. they did not have a king-bed room so we took a 2 double-bed room. however, when we got checked-in and opened the door to our room, we were pleasantly surprised to find a never-occupied and completely remodeled suite. hilton tastefully fitted the dual balcony room tropically with hardwood floors (kitchen/living), marble counter (kitchen/bath), tile bath, carpetted room.ROOM we enjoyed eating breakfast in the room and sometimes hung out in the roomy suite.STAFF one of the young staff was particularly helpful.LOCATION end of waikiki so slightly more quiet but easy walk to busy areas. luckily, we missed some nasty weather and got sunny and 80 degree days!HGV unfortunately, our lifestyles don't fit the HGV plan so i found the pressure sales presentation just aweful. the guy wouldn't let me leave.HILTON VILLAGES big and not good. the on-site ice cream parlor (name escapes me) staff was the least friendly retail people i had ever encountered. we ate off site most of the time because we had the most disappointing sushi dinner at hatsuhana.KALIA TOWER new but farthest from the beach of all towers (4-5 city blocks). NOTE: i later read that they had remodeled kalia due to massive mold problems. *************$ for my price, well worth it. we stayed 5 nights in hawaii and still have points left over for another few nights. even giving up 1 precious hour to hear the HGV pitch again.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We stayed in the top floor, two story,three bedroom and three and a half bath penthouse suite. What more can i say. It was huge and had a great ocean view. HILTON is the greatest, no reason to stay anywhere else in Hawaii. Best week of my life. LOVED IT.

hotel_name: Hilton Grand Vacations at Hilton Hawaiian Village
review_body: We used our club points (a full years worth plus some of the next years) to stay 8 nights at the HGVC. We had a beautiful 2BR condo overlooking the ocean. We ate breakfast every morning on the lanai. We could tell there were others there from our time zone-lights on at 3am. The desk staff was awesome with suggestions, preprinted maps, and information. We didn't enjoy the beach as much as others we found by simply driving around the island. Definately go to the north shore and stop and have shave ice at Matsumoto's General Store-oh, and try some tropical fruit flavor that you've never heard of-promise that you'll love it!
